story:
About Us

CodeArt.Miami highlights the creative side of coding and provides a vehicle to inspire young women to learn to code and to showcase their creations. It also fosters community among the participating student groups and paves the way for future collaborations. Also, participating girls have the opportunity to submit their art for a competition. To further the cause of increasing the number of women in computer science, event proceeds will go towards funding a $7,000 scholarship for a woman enrolled in one of MDC MAGIC’s two-year animation and gaming programs. With the help of local nonprofit, CODeLLA, whose mission is to empower the next generation of Latinas through coding education, and local Girls Who Code clubs, the Code-Art-Miami team has started an event to promote STEM to young women. 
For more information visit: www.codeart.miami

What We Need & What You Get

Any funding made will go to providing as many scholarships as possible to female students at MAGIC and to covering any upfront costs to make the event possible. 

The Impact

Code | Art | Miami (CAM) is meant to show other GWC clubs that Computer Science can be combined with any other field, talent, or interest- especially art! Since many girls show an interest in art or are scared away by the mathematical side of Computer Science, CAM will show underrepresented minorities in STEM that anybody can pursue a career in or express themselves with technology. 

Risks & Challenges

This event relies on the participation of multiple individuals in order for it to be a success. In order to reach some of our goals, we need the appropriate funding, which we do not have at the moment. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word! Share us on twitter, instagram, or Facebook so that we can get the word out. 

Perks

Ryca's R2Heart2 Print:

Binary Bracelets:

story:
_____________________________________________________________________________

What's the problem we're solving?


We understand that creating circuits on breadboards, stacking boards or wiring up your normal Arduino board to the sensors you want can get messy, complicated and frustrating, especially when something from the electrical side doesn't work. 

We wanted to solve these problems by creating a platform that houses the most commonly used sensors for many different scenarios whilst keeping it simple to use and educational at the same time.


_____________________________________________________________________________

An Integrated Development Platform for 
Makers, Students and Engineers.


We designed a platform that integrates the maker's favorite sensors, tools and controllers... all without any wires or connections.

Bluetooth 4.0, Wi-Fi, Infrared Sensors, Motor Control, Light Sensors, color Sensor, Compass, Gyro, Accelerometer, SD Card slot and USB on one platform the size of your fist.


The ATmega2560 is installed on the eeMod, so you get the best of Arduino.




It even transforms into a customizable robot...


The platform can even be customized to transform into a robot. Just add two wheels, a ball caster and a battery and you can control it from your smart phone, tablet or PC. Or maybe you want to let it operate autonomously?


Note: The decal is only intended to portray any sticker. Spider-man is the property of Marvel Comics and the sticker is not included with the product.

Customize the 3D printed body!


The body is 3D printed, which means common acrylic paint sticks to eat easily. So do stickers and decals. You can customize it or even 3D print your own body if you want to. Our 3D designs will be available if the campaign is fully funded.


Here are a few cute examples of what you can make them look like :)


_____________________________________________________________________________

Features



We understand that different projects require different processing power. Or maybe you like to work with a certain microcontroller?

Choose from our selection of controllers or design one yourself!

We're currently using the ATmega2560. That means it's Arduino compatible and we ship it that way.

_____________________________________________________________________________

Rewards

We've got something for everyone! We worked hard to decrease the price as much as possible without compromising both the quality and the functionality of eeMod.

We need your help because manufacturing at low quantities skyrockets the price or the product. So production cannot take place without your help. Help us make this happen.

_____________________________________________________________________________

Who is eeMod for?



Want to use it for Projects, Class or Research? Learning or starting from scratch?


Why not another module? The norm has always been to buy a prototyping board and then buy additional boards or sensors to wire them up. This is a lengthy process that takes time, and many things can go wrong. eeMod integrates the most commonly used sensors, so students can focus on the programming and not on wiring problems.

What can I learn with eeMod? eeMod is a versatile tool, but also a learning platform. Students who have the slightest curiosity on programming and want to do cool things with hardware are in for a treat. Starting from programming concepts, to how a program is run on a microcontroller to controlling and manipulating robotic arms; it can all be done using eeMod.

Is it suitable for kids... and researchers? There's a drastic difference, but yes it can. Reason being that eeMod can be programmed and used in different ways. A young student might program eeMod using Arduino to move the motors with a button click, whilst a researcher might use an FPGA for mesh networking and positioning problems using eeMods hardware.

How can eeMod be used in research and projects? eeMod was first built for swarm robotics purposes. That means having multiple robots performing a task cohesively. This entails in having lots of on-board functionality on a small package. Besides this, it's a great tool to have during project development and debugging.

We're currently using eeMod for reliable data logging and research, take a look:

   

_____________________________________________________________________________

Specs


The platform is divided into two parts, the top module and the bottom module.

The top module houses the microcontroller, RGB LED, programming port and extra pins to connect more platforms.

The bottom module has all the sensors, the power supply, USB controller and connectors.



To better understand what eeMod is made of, check out this non-technical system diagram. It includes all the sensors present on the Bottom Module as well as the micro controller present on the Top Module. There's also code to get an idea of what programming looks like. We also wrote a cool tutorial, keep scrolling down for that!



The eeMod-T is designed to be interchangeable, allowing you to upgrade to more powerful controllers without changing the underlying sensors or supply.

             

 Variable Microcontroller/FPGA. ATmega2560.

 RGB LED       Status LEDs      Connecting headers



Custom Controller



You can program eeMod using different programming languages to suit different ages, different difficulties and different levels of detail.

The programming language depends entirely on the controller you choose on the eeMod. We started using a dsPIC and installed an ATmega2560 to make it Arduino compatible for you to use freely and easily. You can design your own Top Board or even expansion modules to add sensors, custom made circuitry or additional hardware capabilities.



The bottom platform of eeMod enables you to access the most commonly used sensors used by the open-source community. No more connecting wires and stacking countless boards.  Convenience on one board.

"We chose the most commonly used sensors by hobbyists, makers and students. Every sensor and line of code is open-source and easily accessible."





Size


eeMod is small... In fact, it's smaller than your fist.



Technical Specs, Pin-outs and Pin Labeling


Everyone wants good documentation to start with. This is why we included a non-technical system diagram and code for you to really know what's in there and how to use it. We also included signal pin-outs and pin labeling, so you can really get a clear view of how eeMod is constructed and used.




Proudly designed with CircuitMaker - An Open-source PCB design software


____________________________________________________________________

A short tutorial


Every user of every board, module or platform that he or she buys asks the same question: "How do I use it?" We've proudly built eeMod using the most commonly used sensors out there - all open source. What's more is that our first microcontroller is run using Arduino. That means that there's already a tonne of information on how to program and use the device: https://goo.gl/T1ZgRd

So let's assume you're going to start with Arduino. You've downloaded the free IDE, connected eeMod and you're good to go:



Let's say you want to control the motors forward whilst having some LEDs on, what do you write? There are two ways; either use our library, or just go ahead and include the pins that are used to connect to the sensors from the ATmega2560 and write some code to make use of them. Here we show a mixture of both.


1. First include the pins and library
2. Make pin 13 (standard blinky LED) output, then on
3. Shine the RGB LED Red whilst we're at it
4. Go in the loop, make the motors go forward (e.g. if in robot mode) for one second
5. Then reverse at full speed for half a second and repeat the loop.


    


It's that easy. We'll be adding tutorials and code if this campaign is successful, and we can't wait to share it with you!

Here's another full tutorial for you, this one explains how we made part of the video - the part where eeMod is used to turn the cube on the monitor. We think you'll enjoy this one.



____________________________________________________________________

Time-line



We spent a lot of time perfecting the product prior to our campaign. We designed, re-designed and tested the platform until failure. Now we're ready to produce and ship the product to you. 

Here are a few other prototypes and testing pictures:

____________________________________________________________________

Our Team



We're the small team that built eeMod. What started out as a joke has arrived to this, and we believe we have what it takes to make this project successful. To make sure that our manufacturing, testing and delivery are seamless as well as of high quality, we partnered up with NOA Labs - German driven engineering located in Hong Kong. Combined, we come from a background in engineering, software development, 3D modeling, product development and manufacturing - making sure we have the best hands on eeMod.

In partnership with:

____________________________________________________________________

Frequently Asked Questions


Who are eeRoots?

We're a small team with big ambitions. Started over a cup of coffee with good friends, and grew into a company aimed at creating simple, educational, and fun integrated electronic products and services.

What does eeRoots stand for and what does it mean?

eeRoots is a short word for "Electrical Engineering Roots". We chose this name because the idea, design, and core of the products all stem from electronics engineering. Our logo also represents this, showing a tree like structure formed from the ground - pun intended.

Why crowd funding and why flexible funding?

Crowd Funding is an effective way to get this product to market. Since it's ready to be manufactured, we feel confident to sell it on-line, otherwise we wouldn't. We chose flexible funding in order to allow people who would otherwise have problems contributing with Paypal to contribute. This can only be done with flexible funding.

What is eeMod?

eeMod is the first and primary product of eeRoots. It is a truly integrated prototyping platform - because unlike other modules, it integrates all the tools, sensors, and functionality on one single platform that's smaller than your fist. We worked especially hard to make it compact, robust, and easy for everyone to use. We chose the most common sensors used by the open-source community, so there's plenty of free resources for everyone to tap into.

What can I do with eeMod?

This is a vast question, and it deserves a vast answer. eeMod has an on-board controller that can be changed. This means anything that an Arduino or your favorite module can do so can eeMod. The beauty of eeMod is in the integration of features and ease of use. With other modules, you must constantly stay buying a sensor or add-on module, connect wires, or stack multiple boards to include the feature you want in your project, e.g. Wi-Fi. It's a messy, very expensive, and time consuming process...

On the other hand, eeMod comes pre-built with over 10 sensors and modules. This enables you to activate and use any sensor or combination of sensors, and is as simple as writing a few lines of code. There are no wires, messy connections or extra costs with eeMod. Talk about bang for buck. One can also learn electronics and how to code using eeMod. We will make clear and easy tutorials for you to follow, starting from a beginner up to an engineer.

Can eeMod be used in the classroom?

Absolutely! Since our primary module is Arduino compatible, it's easy for students to code and see their projects come to life. With loads of information online, compiling notes and materials will be easy.

How can I change the controller?

The controller can be changed by replacing the Top Module. From our experience, different users often get accustomed to different microcontrollers, but the underlying tools remain the same. So you can either design a PCB with a different microcontroller or buy one that we'll support in the future. Having said that, we installed an ATmega2560 on eeMod - one of the most powerful and widely used Arduino compatible microcontrollers out there, making sure that there's plenty of information and tutorials to start and grow with.

Will there be support and tutorials?

Definitely. We believe in proper documentation. We understand that as a user, you want tutorials, code to begin with, code to continue with, and code to really get into it. So we'll provide these if the campaign is successful. Having said this, we strongly recommend that you check out Arduino tutorials since much of the information is already available.

Is eeMod safe to use?

Yes, there can be no harm done from eeMod to a person in any way. This is a prototyping module made for education and fun.

Where and when will eeMod be available?

eeMod will go through a process of crowd funding in April 2016. After that, it will be in demand on Indiegogo and possibly in different distributors around the world.

Where can eeMod be shipped to?

We're making eeMod available worldwide, so you'll be able to get it no matter where you are.

Is eeMod certified?

eeMod has components that use official FCC and CE certifications. eeMod is sold as a kit and is therefore exempted from certain certifications. Although certain certifications are not required for this product, we still abide by ROHS, CE, FCC regulations.


____________________________________________________________________

                         Thank YOU! :)

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

I will create a magazine for children in the English speaking Caribbean, with an accompanying website that will monthly offer writing prompts and writing activities for children . The two inaugural issue will be for ages 14-18 and ages, 8-13, scheduled to be released September 2016 and January 2017, respectively. The magazine will be a combination of stories, poems and art by children. Caribbean children need the opportunity to share their life stories and to feel as if they are part of the global community by having an outlet to express themselves in a way that can be appreciated by a larger audience. 

What We Need & What You Get

I need $20,000 to do the first 2 inaugural issues, Fall 2016 for students ages, 14-18 and Spring 2017 for students ages, 8-13.

As a contributor of $5000 or more, you will get an electronic copy of the journal; we will send journal to 5 of your friends; you will be listed in the journal,  receive  a personal Thank You email from one of the student contributors and receive two 8 x 10 photos by Opal Palmer Adisa, from her Caribbean children series.

As a contributor of $1000 or more, you will get an electronic copy of the journal; we will send journal to 2 of your friends; you will be listed in the journal,  receive  a personal Thank You email from one of the student contributors and receive one 8 x 10 photos by Opal Palmer Adisa, from her Caribbean children series.

As a contributor of $500 or more, you will get an electronic copy of the journal, will be listed in the journal,  and receive  a personal Thank You email from one of the student contributors.

As a contributor of $100 or more, you will get an electronic copy of the journal, will be listed in the journal.  

As a contributor of $50 or more you will be listed in the journal.

All contributors will have the pleasure of knowing that they supported children to write and share their poems, stories and art with each other and the world. You will contribute to growing a whole generation of writers from the Caribbean. You will get to see and learn about the Caribbean other than its music and white sandy beaches.  You will get to know the heart of the Caribbean, through the eyes of its young people.

BUDGET

$5000 to build and sustain a website that will update montly, featuring different writing prompts for children, interviews of students, as well as writings by children that are not included in the bi-annual magazine.

$3000 for graphic designer to layout a 64-100 page,  8 x 11 magazine, Fall 2016 & Spring 2017

$5000 to print and distribute (cost of mailing) 300 complimentary copies to contributors, plus 200 copies to libraries and community centers throughout the English speaking Caribbean,  Fall 2016 & Spring 2017

$8000 to do outreach in 5 islands, and which will include conducting creative writing workshops in schools and community centers, training teachers in creative writing techniques to implement in the schools, Spring & Fall

$8000 honorarium for editor and assisting staff to produce magazine, generate material for and keep website ongoing.


  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

If I do not reach my complete goal, I am optimistic that I will secure enough to create the website and accept poems online and publish that way, initially. However, this will only impact those students who have access to technology at home or at school, which  unfortunately is not the majority of students, who are my desired audience.

Value to Contributors and the World

This journal will validate for children throughout the Caribbean that creative writing is a valid and viable medium to share their ideas and feelings. Equally important, it will augment their writing and critical thinking skills, and develop self-expression, which bolsters self-esteem. Children in the Caribbean will learn more about what they share in common, and the diverse cultural traditions.  They will also come to realize that there are different career opportunites in writing and publishing.


  • Successful track record with projects like this

Over the last 20 years I have done workshops with thousands of chidlren in schools, primarily in California, but also in Brazil and Egypt when I was an artist in resident in those places, as well as in Tunisa, Kenya and South Africa. I have produced over 40 anthologies of children’s poems and art for schools in the California Bay Area.

  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Creative Literacy is vitally important  to train critical thinkers. My entire career as an educator has been working with young minds to help them find their voice and write their stories.

I feel driven to make this contribution to the Children of the Caribbean to enhance their future.
story_txt:
Short Summary Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:  Introduce yourself and your background. Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you. Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.  Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?   What We Need & What You Get Break it down for folks in more detail:


I will create a magazine
for children in the English speaking Caribbean, with an accompanying website
that will monthly offer writing prompts and writing activities for children .
The two inaugural issue will be for ages 14-18 and ages, 8-13, scheduled to be
released September 2016 and January 2017, respectively. The magazine will be a
combination of stories, poems and art by children. Caribbean children need the
opportunity to share their life stories and to feel as if they are part of the
global community by having an outlet to express themselves in a way that can be
appreciated by a larger audience. 

What We Need
& What You Get
I need $20,000 to do the
first 2 inaugural issues, Fall 2016 for students ages, 14-18 and Spring 2017
for students ages, 8-13.
As a contributor of $5000 or
more, you will get an electronic copy of the journal; we will send journal to 5
of your friends; you will be listed in the journal,  receive  a personal Thank You email from one of the
student contributors and receive two 8 x 10 photos by Opal Palmer Adisa, from
her Caribbean children series. 
As a contributor of $1000 or
more, you will get an electronic copy of the journal; we will send journal to 2
of your friends; you will be listed in the journal,  receive  a personal Thank You email from one of the
student contributors and receive one 8 x 10 photos by Opal Palmer Adisa, from
her Caribbean children series. 
As a contributor of $500 or
more, you will get an electronic copy of the journal, will be listed in the
journal,  and receive  a personal Thank You email from one of the
student contributors. 
As a contributor of $100 or
more, you will get an electronic copy of the journal, will be listed in the
journal.  
As a contributor of $50 or
more you will be listed in the journal. 
All contributors will have
the pleasure of knowing that they supported children to write and share their
poems, stories and art with each other and the world. You will contribute to
growing a whole generation of writers from the Caribbean. You will get to see
and learn about the Caribbean other than its music and white sandy
beaches.  You will get to know the heart
of the Caribbean, through the eyes of its young people.
BUDGET
$5000 to build and sustain a
website that will update montly, featuring different writing prompts for children,
interviews of students, as well as writings by children that are not included
in the bi-annual magazine.
$3000 for graphic designer to
layout a 64-100 page,  8 x 11 magazine,
Fall 2016 & Spring 2017
$5000 to print and distribute
(cost of mailing) 300 complimentary copies to contributors, plus 200 copies to
libraries and community centers throughout the English speaking Caribbean,  Fall 2016 & Spring 2017 
$8000 to do outreach in 5
islands, and which will include conducting creative writing workshops in
schools and community centers, training teachers in creative writing techniques
to implement in the schools, Spring & Fall
$8000 honorarium for editor
and assisting staff to produce magazine, generate material for and keep
website ongoing.




Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire
     goal.

If I do not reach my complete goal, I am
optimistic that I will secure enough to create the website and accept poems
online and publish that way, initially. However, this will only impact those
students who have access to technology at home or at school, which  unfortunately is not the majority of
students, who are my desired audience.

Value to Contributors and the
World
This journal will validate for children
throughout the Caribbean that creative writing is a valid and viable medium to
share their ideas and feelings. Equally important, it will augment their
writing and critical thinking skills, and develop self-expression, which bolsters
self-esteem. Children in the Caribbean will learn more about what they share in
common, and the diverse cultural traditions. 
They will also come to realize that there are different career
opportunites in writing and publishing.
    

Successful track record with projects like this 


Over the last 20 years I have done workshops
with thousands of chidlren in schools, primarily in California, but also in
Brazil and Egypt when I was an artist in resident in those places, as well as
in Tunisa, Kenya and South Africa. I have produced over 40 anthologies of children’s
poems and art for schools in the California Bay Area.


Make it real for people and build trust.

Creative Literacy is vitally important  to train critical thinkers. My entire career
as an educator has been working with young minds to help them find their voice
and write their stories.
I feel driven to make this contribution to the
Children of the Caribbean to enhance their future.

story:
What it does

Bookbot is an exceptionally powerful tool that can make a real impact in the lives of children with learning difficulties. Its purpose is to make reading fun and engaging for struggling readers and people with dyslexia.

It achieves this through sophisticated software which “follows along” with the child as they read out loud, highlighting incorrectly pronounced words and audibly stating the proper pronunciation when mistakes are made.

 

This is a powerful application which affords those with learning difficulties the opportunity to identify and work through problem areas on their own terms, in their own way and at their own pace. It brings control, privacy and ease to a process that brings discomfort to so many.

It will be built to run on multiple devices of multiple sizes, bringing more flexibility into the lives of the people who need it most.

Bookbot doesn’t tire. It doesn’t judge. It doesn’t get impatient. Bookbot exists for the children who need a little extra practice but don’t want to feel like a burden, or who feel a bit shy and want to practice alone.

...And your pledge makes it all possible.

 

App features

We interviewed a myriad of parents, teachers, tutors and kids to get to the bottom of what Bookbot needs to deliver in order to be the most effective tool for people with learning disabilities around. This is what we found:

  • Parents are looking for something that helps build self-confidence.
  • Teachers want children to develop self-reliance.
  • Tutors have outlined the need for decodable readers (books that have phonetically simple words and text dependent on the child's reading level).
  • Kids love to read when they have the confidence to do so.

Our testing suggests that the app will be effective in helping kids build up their self-confidence and self-reliance in reading.

The other features in development to address the needs of tutors, teachers and kids include:

  • A comprehensive collection of decodable readers, licensed from publishers. The right books would be carefully selected for the child’s reading level.

  • Detailed reporting to help tutors and teachers design lesson plans.

Perks

Many of the perks are subscriptions to Bookbot.

Two perks that we’ve had a lot of fun with are the “Feature your child in a book” and “Make your child a star”. We have a wonderful children’s author part of the team, as well as some very talented artists that we work with.

The books are professionally made, have a lot of personality and look great. Having a book written about your child can be very inspiring. They can be an astronaut on Mars, a deep sea diver exploring Atlantis, or a scientist finding a cure for a zombie plague. Anything is possible!

Here are a couple examples of our two Bookbot kids, illustrated with one of our special artists.

 

 

The story

My name is Davina, and I’m a mother. I’m also a passionate writer, a ravenous bookworm and a big part of Bookbot.

Now, I might be biased because I’m his mum, but my son Forester happens to be one of my favourite people on Earth. I think he has a big bright future ahead of him, and I can’t wait to see what he does with his life.

But even I can admit that, although he’s perfect to me, he faces challenges that others will never have to.

To be more specific, Forester has dyslexia. It’s a disorder (or series of disorders) that affect his ability to read.

For a long time, I tried reading with him and helping him myself. But life isn’t always that simple. Eventually, I admitted that I needed a little help as well if we were going to work through this thing together.

So, I immersed myself in learning all about reading difficulties. I did courses, spoke with teachers, tutors and parents, and got my elbows in the mud trying to understand all the ins and outs of what Forester’s experience was like.

After hours, days, weeks of digging, I came to understand how he learns and what he struggles with. It’s become a lot easier to help him with his school work and communicate with his teacher.

But I still want to do more for Forester and other people with learning difficulties.

And that’s why I’ve been so involved with Bookbot, a sophisticated tool that gives struggling readers the chance to work through problem areas on their own terms, in their own way and at their own pace.

We’re thrilled to have you on board, and I promise… this is only the beginning.

 

FAQ

 

Which devices will Bookbot work on?

Upon release, Bookbot will be compatible with iPads, iPhones, Android phones and Android tablets. In the future, Bookbot will be released for Windows, Mac and Chromebooks as well.

Why not have the app just work with website

While Bookbot is helpful for struggling learners of all ages, the main focus of the app is to help readers from the ages of 5 to 15. This requires a bit of extra consideration – children's books and decodable readers specifically.

Another issue is the books themselves. The books need to be processed and tested to ensure that they work correctly with the speech system.

And finally, having control over the books allows the algorithm to select the appropriate books for the child’s reading level. This is very important, as text that is too simple will not stimulate progress and text that is too difficult might frustrate or discourage the user.

Can multiple children use the same app?

Yes. You will be able to have multiple profiles within a single subscription. At the moment we are pricing the subscription the same for families, but this may change in future.

Could Bookbot discourage children from reading if they find it too difficult?

We’ve thought about this as well. Our solution is to select books that are at just the right level for the child using the app. Through algorithmic correction, books will be easy enough to help with confidence, while also hard enough to stimulate growth.

Is your product user-friendly for young students with dyslexia and other learning issues?

Bookbot is specifically designed for dyslexic readers from the bottom up. Everything from design to font to brightness has been optimised to give users with learning difficulties the ideal experience.

Will it work for children with foreign accents (or who are learning English)?

Yes it will.

What reading level does this start at?

We will start with beginning reading levels all the way up to confident readers.

Will it be available in the USA?

It certainly will. In fact, most of our interest comes from the USA.

Will it need to learn your child’s voice?

Bookbot picks up most words, but sometimes he needs to think about what was said. After it hears difficult words a couple of times he gets faster at understanding what was pronounced.

Can I add my child’s school books to this?

At the moment, we have to prepare each book for the voice recognition system. We're first going to focus on decodable reading books that are designed for those learning to read.

story_txt: df

story:
Bottom Line

I need to place myself on a map. Get published, that is! And right now, it costs $1,600. 
In June 2015, iconic fashion photographer Nick Knight, announced a Talent Program for photographers around the World. Three words: VERY BIG DEAL. I spent a few days compiling my favourite pieces of work onto my website, Mara Vb Photography, and then sent my application. Three months of anxious anticipation later until finally today, September 7th, 2015, I received the official acceptance E-mail:

I plan to mark my name in the industry as one of the World's most INNOVATIVE photographer, given my high interest in special effects. A cosplay and fashion photographer who puts strict attention to craftsmanship and enjoys collaborating with make-up artists, stylists and costume makers.
I should then, naturally, be able to build my brand more effectively and meet the right people to achieve my real dream:

Mara Vb's Dream

Through this program's mentorship, my real dream is to one day start a non-profit organization where I am able to employ Cosplay artists  and connect them to a network of events and parties! Most Cosplay artists do not earn a single dime for the hard work they put into the characters. As such, I dream of being able to connect a Spiderman cosplayer with an organization like SickKids. Or Wonder Woman to a Breast Cancer Awareness event. Children will be able to spend a few hours with their favourite hero, patients can have a temporary distraction and best of all, the Cosplayers will be able to do what he/she already enjoys doing in the first place. (I apologize in advanced, Mr. Clown!)


If you'd like to know a little about me, I'll do my best to satisfy your curiosities !
Mara Vb's Story
My name is Maria Belano. I was born in the Philippines. My parents did a fantastic job in ensuring my constant lust for education, as well as my desire for constant advancement, so we relocated frequently. 
At 4 years old, my parents took me to Brunei where I started in the British educational system. 
At 12, my Architect mother taught me Photoshop 7.0. 
At 16, I relocated to the Philippines to formally attended school for Multimedia Arts.
At 17, with an overall average of 97%, I was put on my university's President's List.
At 18, I was named Best Director of a short-film called "Fall", for a film festival held for our program, and earned a chance to be an apprentice director on-set for ABS-CBN with Director Paolo Villaluna.
At 19, I worked on my first published commissions for an events company in the Philippines, and also earned a Special Citation from the UNFPA Philippines for a short animation called "Si Leo ang Batang Lito" (Leo, the confused child).
At 19, we moved to Canada and started my first job as a design artist at a print shop in Windsor, while attending school for Business Admin at the University of Windsor. 
At 22, I moved to Toronto and started my first (miniature) business as a photographer, graphic designer and web master. 
At 23, I took a Book-keeping course at McMaster University.
At 24, I moved for a year to Windsor and started a Photo Booth company. 
And now, before I turn 25, I applied and got accepted into Nick Knight's prestigious talent program, selected among 9,631 other potential candidates.

Personal Life

Along the course of my little achievements, I was blessed with a daughter who means the World to me. I need to be self-employed because she lives 13,278 kms (8250.5 mi) away from me in the Philippines. Every year, I try to see her for about 2 weeks to a month, so holding a full-time employment is not feasible. To cut on cost, I sometimes travel with many stopovers, between 24 to 31 hours to get to her. I would love nothing more than to see her multiple times a year, or hopefully someday be able to bring her to Canada as well. In the meantime, I am growing a business that can help finance my yearly trip.

Dilemma

The $1,600 tuition for the program is absolutely worth every bit of hard work I put in to earn the fund. But that same amount is also the approximate amount it will take for me to see my daughter in the Philippines. I am hoping that with a sufficient amount of help, I can do both. :)

Shop Talk

By far, the profits from my business have been constantly put back into buying new, necessary equipment for my craft. Almost 3 years later, I am confident in saying now that I have all the necessary tools and knowledge of the trade. Along the way, I do make it a point to travel to various places in North America and along the Pacific (on my way to see my daughter), to attend photography workshops and diversify my portfolio. When budget permits, I also try to bring a team for mutual learning. 

Since starting my business in 2012, I have been nothing but frugal, constantly trying to budget my spendings to things that can potentially further my abilities and have a decent return on investment. To further cut on cost, I stay in two cities where my businesses are established. When I'm in Toronto, I stay with my best friend and we share household bills, and when I'm in Windsor, I stay with my parents.

Artistry

My photography style includes elaborate sets that require a team to execute; make-up artists, hairstylists and fashion technicians. As such, I enjoy working on Cosplay sets, as well as Fashion and Weddings. I constantly look for innovative ways to create art and make the entire experience for the team fruitful. Think green screens, special effects, smoke and black lights. I am also meticulous and focus a lot of care into the experience as a whole, for both my team and the client(s).


Ribboned Up

I highly believe that life is an eternal learning curve. I always consider myself a student. To tie this all together, I am confident that being a part of this program will strongly assist in making my goals even more achievable. Not only will it further push me to create pieces of art that will matter, but also enhance my ability to meet the right people for the organization I aim to build.


Your Story

Your generosity, I will forever treasure and will do all I can to reciprocate appropriately. Any help will absolutely be appreciated beyond its monetary value! The program is 1,600 USD in one instalment, or 1,830 USD over 3 instalments of 610 USD. That is all I need help for. The background stuff (Indiegogo fees, etc.), I am willing to shoulder myself. 

Sweet Nothings

In exchange for your kind heart towards a lowly stranger, perhaps you may enjoy these items as a token of my gratitude:

  • 4 x 6 prints of your own provided photos, 
  • Quarterly coffee-table book copy of my work,
  • A custom, 1-hour digital photography session,
  • Social media mention for up to 2,479 people to see!*
  • Your Name engraved on the wall of my future non-profit studio*
If the entire goal is not reached, I shall still proceed with the program by obtaining a loan from other sources. Hopefully I need not do so, as I am more fond of the idea of sharing photography-reated goodies with you! :)
If the entire goal is reached and MORE, I will be transparent and announce it. Budget-permitting, I may even then be able to start planning the non-profit organization that I want to start. 
*Optional, if you allow

The 'F' Word

Future.

My dream is to help make children's dreams of meeting a superhero come true. Or at the very least, give them a quick distraction from their daily struggles in battling their ailments. As a side-effect, I intend to make their families momentarily joyous as well. I imagine being able to bring in superheroes to visit them and brighten their days. 

On top of that, my Photo Booth will be available on-site to provide a fun atmosphere. The creative team will be present on-site to provide face-paint, make-up and hair services, as well as professional photography services worthy of an editorial. Finally, a simple printed album or coffee-book for them to keep.

The 'P' Word

Past.

Both my Photography company and Photo Booth company have been to various non-profit and charity events in various communities. It is our practice to do at the bare minimum, one event or project for a chosen organization, absolutely free of charge. This is what sparked my interest for working at events or projects that removes the element of profit-making. Seeing smiling faces, be it children or adults, ignited another 'P' word that came into play: Passion. This passion and my past experiences are what furiously inspires my creative stamina to succeed.


The 'S' Word

Share.

Monetary contribution is not the only way a person can help. You can also help by telling others about my humble little campaign here on Indiegogo. Also, feel free to view my website and look through my work here: www.maravb.com

Thank you for having a huge heart! Meanwhile, here are some of my favourite work:

Your Name engraved on the wall of my future non-profit studio*

If the entire goal is not reached, I shall still proceed with the program by obtaining a loan from other sources. Hopefully I need not do so, as I am more fond of the idea of sharing photography-reated goodies with you! :)
If the entire goal is reached and MORE, I will be transparent and announce it. Budget-permitting, I may even then be able to start planning the non-profit organization that I want to start. 

*Optional, if you allow



The 'F' Word
Future.
My dream is to help make children's dreams of meeting a superhero come true. Or at the very least, give them a quick distraction from their daily struggles in battling their ailments. As a side-effect, I intend to make their families momentarily joyous as well. I imagine being able to bring in superheroes to visit them and brighten their days. 


On top of that, my Photo Booth will be available on-site to provide a fun atmosphere. The creative team will be present on-site to provide face-paint, make-up and hair services, as well as professional photography services worthy of an editorial. Finally, a simple printed album or coffee-book for them to keep.

The 'P' Word
Past.



Both my Photography company and Photo Booth company have been to various non-profit and charity events in various communities. It is our practice to do at the bare minimum, one event or project for a chosen organization, absolutely free of charge. This is what sparked my interest for working at events or projects that removes the element of profit-making. Seeing smiling faces, be it children or adults, ignited another 'P' word that came into play: Passion. This passion and my past experiences are what furiously inspires my creative stamina to succeed.



The 'S' Word
Share.
Monetary contribution is not the only way a person can help. You can also help by telling others about my humble little campaign here on Indiegogo. Also, feel free to view my website and look through my work here: www.maravb.com
Thank you for having a huge heart! Meanwhile, here are some of my favourite work:

story:
Hello world!!! (Hopefully..) My name is Sally and I'm a second year college student from Los Angeles. Almost two years ago, I came to UCLA and chose to major in Political Science and International Relations. Now I’m a full time student with a work-study job, a part-time job and an internship. And yet somehow, that’s still not enough to cover a 4 month study abroad in Paris! That's why I've turned to Indiegogo and try to raise money to put towards housing and tuition and other travel expenses which adds up to about $14,000. More specific information about my program can be found here. 

You see, I’m aiming for the big leagues - I’m going to be a diplomat or ambassador, ideally one to France. That’s why, as soon as I learned of this opportunity to study at a top Political Science University in Paris - Sciences Po - I didn’t think twice. But as you can see, I finally had to get around to the thinking twice part. 

When I got to 9th grade, I had to pick my “second” language. Of course, for me it was my sixth and maybe final so I had to chose wisely. I chose French. What I didn’t know was how hard it would be to retain it. Time passed, I went to college, studied hard, got a job, and then a second, and then a third and almost two years went by where no matter how hard I tried, there just wasn’t enough time for French maintenance. However, I am not ready to give up on it or on the four long years I spent on learning it just yet! I So I figured my best bet is the most drastic one - actually moving to France! Even more exciting is that I will be studying in my own field at a top Political Science University. It is honestly a dream combination - an incredible opportunity to experience European politics while mastering French. Not to mention learning from a completely new perspective, destroying any tunnel vision I might have from living and studying in the same place for too long. 

I have already made a promise to myself that from the minute I land in Paris, I will not speak a word of English. My people back home can use Google translate. I will carry baguettes under my arm. I will take the subway everywhere. I will eat croissants for breakfast and crepes for dinner. I will wear stripes and a beret and ignore the sneers I get. I will literally become a French citizen. I will do all of this, and I will come back speaking French so well, you will have to excuse it. I am very excited about what Paris has to offer! All I need is a little boost to get there. 
If you'd like to know more about me or my trip, I'm just a click away! :)

If you'd like to virtually come with me on this trip, please follow my instagram @oneminut3 to see updates ofmy life and travels!

story:
Hello

My name is Emma Marvel Petergal. I am a high school student and I work at a skateboard shop. I am a genuinely silly kid with lots of very close friends who I love as you can see from the silly picture of me riding on my friends back from a photoshoot. I am interested in art, especially jewelry making and glass blowing, baking and cooking, and swimming. This summer my parents are sending me on a 19 day trip to visit Europe with the People to People ambassador program.  I am so excited to go on this amazing adventure. It will take me to Italy, Austria, Switzerland, and finally France. I will be able to experience so many things and grow as a person. My parents are paying for the expensive trip with their savings, so I am doing all I can to raise money to pay them back.

People to People

The People to People site describes the European Discovery.

"This multi-country journey will rev up your adventurous spirit, inspire your inner artist, and provide you with an insider’s look at European life. Compete in medieval games at a castle. Whip up Austrian apple strudel during a bakery lesson. Discover ancient art on the streets of Rome at the Trevi Fountain, the Forum, and the Pantheon. It’s 19 days of cultural immersion, medieval adventure, and exclusive access to intriguing people."

Risks & Challenges

Throughout my life I haven't been in the richest situation, but my parents are still paying so much money to send me to this trip. I love them immensely and want to prove that I am an adult and that I am mature.  I am terrified to leave my home for so long with strangers and I'm scared I will do something wrong, but I believe that the experience will be worth it once I am there.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you know me and can contact me I am also selling freshly baked, home made cookies to fund raise even more, and my mother has been selling baby blankets and bracelets.

Just trying to raise enough money to get settled in until the post 9/11 GI bill kicks in. I have served 2 combat tours overseas and now im so close to my goal can anyone help me please!

story:
We need your support to advocate for more low-cost community schools that gives kids from poor backgrounds better life opportunities.


In Indonesia, 36 million children do not complete basic schooling because poor families must choose whether their child should go to school, or find work to support the family. This significantly limits access to better life opportunities that could break the cycle of poverty. 

Low-cost community schools is a way to get more kids in classrooms. 

Low-cost community schools are schools set up by community leaders and members to teach children from low-income families. Community schools use curricula that give parents and teachers more influence, so that schools provide their child the type of education they feel is most needed for better opportunities.

There are already some low-cost community schools that exist in urban and rural areas in Indonesia. Below are just some of the schools established and supported by community members.

 TK Tunas Harapan

The Tunas Harapan kindergarten is in Bajulmati, a rural village south of Malang in East Java. The kindergarten is made a reality from the cooperation and full support of the village community, who fully fund the school by selling farm products. 

The school emphasizes awareness and importance of their environment, a focus that parents and the community want to instill to their children. 

Their blog can be found here, and a feature article on the school, here (both in Bahasa Indonesia). 

Sekolah Alam Tunas Mutiara

The Alam Tunas Mutiara school is located in an urban landfill in Bantar Gebang, east of Jakarta. The school was started by Nadam Dwi Subketi (pictured above), whose house was near the landfill and wanted many of the kids working as trash pickers to receive an education.

The school is also an opportunity for kids to get away from the toxic environment of the landfill and poor living conditions. The school has over 200 students and relies much on donations and scholarships, which have been used for students to move on to higher level education. 

Their programs as well as donation channels can be found here through the school's foundation blog (in Bahasa Indonesia).

Studies indicate community schools make an impact.

Students from low-cost community schools in Asia and Africa have even done better than their counterparts in government-run schools. Proving that quality education does not need to be expensive, and can be done. 

For example, in India, poor families are willing to invest $2 a month to send their children to such community schools. Kids in these schools achieve higher scores in maths and english than children in public schools. 

These are very promising signs that low-cost community schools can work in Indonesia too. 

We need your help to raise awareness and convince Indonesia's policy makers of potential positive impacts community schools can bring families and young individuals. 

To do this, we need to find exact data and information about community schools in Indonesia to make proposals that are practical and do-able for those in government who have the power to make such change a reality. 

Where your support goes

Analysis: To get policymakers to understand the potential of low-cost community schools, we need to give them real and credible data. We need to find information on the state of any existing community schools in Indonesia, and find whether existing policies make it easier (or harder) for these schools to operate. After we have a better understanding supported by real facts, we will then formulate recommendations that can be implemented at policy level. 


Advocacy: Completing research and recommendations is only half the process. We will push and advocate for the change needed to key policy makers and ministries. Real impact must be made by engaging those in government. 


Training: Our efforts for better access to quality education doesn't stop once we've found the facts. We will train and coach researchers and advocates to continually push for positive change using effective methods. Our Skills for Change workshops invite young Indonesian researchers and advocates from all over Indonesia for 2-day intensive workshops held over three months. The best papers are then published and disseminated to policy makers and key influencers. 


Who we are


The Center for Indonesian Policy Studies (CIPS) promotes social and economic reforms that are based on the belief that only civil, political, and economic freedom allow Indonesia to prosper. 

As a strictly non-partisan and non-profit think thank, CIPS is dedicated to providing policy analysis and practical policy recommendations to decision-makers within Indonesia’s legislative and executive branches of government. 

We are being financially supported by donors and philanthropists who appreciate the independence of our analysis.

Being a partner in the Atlas Network of public policy think tanks, our aim is to promote international dialogue and to encourage comparative research of key issues concerning Indonesia. 


Our Supporting Partner

We are supported by our friends at the Atlas Network for this campaign.

The Atlas Network is a non-profit organization that connects a global network of more than 400 free-market organizations across 80 countries to advance the cause of liberty. They are based in Washington D.C., and is a registered 501 (c)(3) organization. 

Note: All contributions will first be collected by the Atlas Network, which will then be transferred to CIPS once the campaign ends. This allows tax deductions for U.S donors, and lower platform fees for CIPS.


Other Ways You Can Help!

Apart from contributing financially, below are other ways you can support us:

  •  Share our Indiegogo campaign through your social media networks (Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, etc)
  • Talk to friends and family about our campaign and help spread the word
  • Approach businesses or organizations who may be able to donate or offer discounts for goods and services such as accommodations during field work, workshop venues, and transportation.

story:
Help Us Build Each-One-Teach-One

The goal of Each-One-Teach-One is to make an impact on education in the best way possible, which is to teach reading and English. We hope to encourage people like you to become  tutors/instructors. As tutors, you can teach your family members. As instructors, you can train tutors who will help out their communities. The tutors can start by teaching basic reading and English skills. We are not talking about rocket science. This is early reading skills for four, five, and six year old students. All tutors have to do is teach the alphabet and phonetic alphabet. That is all it takes to get started. After that, give the students an assignment; they will start sounding out words and learning vocabulary on their own using the workbook. The basic reading foundation takes only a few hours to learn and teach.

 Illiteracy Rate in the United States

About 20% of the adult population is functionally illiterate, which is about 40 million people. Another 20% reads well enough to get by. This mirrors the statistic that 40% of fourth grade students read at below grade level. Most of the adults are working minimum wage jobs or they are unemployed. Those unemployed people have time to learn to read and then teach reading. 

Many children fall behind and never catch up. Teachers can't take the time to help them get caught up using tutoring, but you can!

+++++++++++++++++++++

Help Your Family and Community

It makes no difference if you are a nurse in Mississippi, bookkeeper in New York, or a high school student in Africa. If you can read English, you can help others learn to read. You can start your own reading program! You only need three or four students to begin and a few family members volunteering as tutors. Start helping the children of family members, then help friends. The only curriculum you will need is "Phonetic English." 

When you teach adults the basic skills, get a pledge from them. Make them promise to teach at least one other person to read.

Phonetic English is the most advanced language skills program in the world. Native English speakers can learn to teach basic reading skills in twenty-four to forty-eight hours. English language learners can learn to read and speak English in a few weeks.

Help Us Reach Our Goal $1 at a Time

Our standard PDF ebook perk  is $10. The other ebooks are $20. However, if you make a smaller contribution of between $1 and $5, you will get a PDF ebook after we distribute the other perks. Those who request the $5 perk will get their PDF ebook before those who chose the $1 perk. The $1  perks will be distributed according to the dates we receive the requests. Also, your kind donations will allow us to continue to distribute workbooks to anyone who can afford to pay $1.

If teaching is not for you, get workbooks for an adult literacy center. Do you know people who are confined in an institution? If so, send them a workbook so they can help others and learn a tutoring skill for themselves. Do you know a child who is at risk for reading failure? If so, tell the parents about Each-One-Teach-One.

Please support us today!

We want to raise about $12,500 to make a first run of 500 quality paperback workbooks and distribute them to the supporters who request them. We should still have enough money left over to license and start our organization. This will get the ball rolling toward building a distribution center. As a larger organization, we will distribute ebooks and paperback books to individuals, communities, and institutions around the world. If we do not reach our fundraising goal, we will still produce the books and distribute all the perks. Also, everyone who orders a paperback book will get a free PDF ebook.

Project Manager’s Note

We all know that reading is the key to a quality education and a better way of life. An education is everything. It leads to better jobs, promotions, and the ability to communicate well with others. Unfortunately, a quality education is not available to most people. However, if this program is funded, more people can learn the basic reading foundation and start teaching themselves and others. That makes Each-One-Teach-One a powerful concept! My pledge is to make this early reading foundation available to everyone. - Dennis Brooks, writer, researcher, reading specialist, and project manager.

If You Can Read, You Can Teach!

Whether you are a native English speaker or speak English as a second language, when you get your hands on “Phonetic English,” you can start teaching reading and English. Phonetic English is the only workbook you will need to teach yourself and your students. It takes only a few hours of studying to learn how to tutor. Wherever you go, your Phonetic English workbook will go with you in your electronic devices. 

Start your own tutoring service using only your laptop, tablet, or smart phone. All you have to do is hand out notes with your name and number: 

“I can teach you to read, write, and speak English. Contact Jane at 123-456-7890.”

When you can read English, you can teach both reading and English. According to some estimations, nearly one-half of the world's population will eventually learn English. Lots of people need your help. English and reading tutors are in demand because of the need for English teachers. 

 Work Part Time or Full Time as a Tutor

Reading and English skills are easy to learn and teach. As a tutor, you can decide when to work, how much to charge, and keep the money. When working for yourself, the pay will be good, the benefits will be wonderful, and you will be your own boss. 

To get started tutoring, offer the first three or four tutoring sessions for free!

The workbooks are for all ages and grade levels. They start with the basic reading foundation and teach the standard vocabulary for both British and American English. Also, they teach reading with the 44+ sounds without using diacritical marks. They use standard formatting instead.

Sponsor a Learning Center Near You

For just $500 you can sponsor a learning center in your area. At the end of the campaign, we will publish the 160 page, 8 1/2 x 11 inch paperback workbook. Your center will get 20 workbooks, which will be shipped anywhere at no extra cost. Many people in the United states and other countries still need to develop basic language skills and you can help. Simply coordinate with your institution, school, or learning center and let them know that you want to sponsor them. You must provide their name, address, and telephone number.

Why Teach Reading and English?

The spread of English by the British Empire and the influence of American businesses have made English the number one choice as a global second language. After World War II, American businesses took English around the world as the language of international trade. English is now the most widely used language in the world. All of the world’s top business schools and universities teach courses in English.

English is Everywhere

Science and technology

Health and medicine

Internet and computers

Journalism and literature

Education and academics

Transportation and entertainment

It is also the language used in international politics.

World Economy

English now plays a great part in the world’s economy and popular culture. It is exported in music, in movies, through television, and over the internet. It also has a solid position in tourism, advertising, and social science. Also, it is the only language used in international air traffic control.

As an international language, English is helping people in different countries, communities, and villages communicate with each other.

Teach Yourself to Read, Write, and Speak Better English

If you can read some English now, you can improve on your own. All it takes is a few hours a day. Use your new skills to get a better education and a better job. The opportunities are endless for English speakers. You can become a  doctor, lawyer, dentist, scientist, teacher, or anything you want.

If this project is successful, we will start eliminating one of the greatest obstacles to a better education. That is why we hope you will become a supporter and ask others to join us in making education a priority especially for those who are just learning to read.

Risks and Challenges

There should be no risks and challenges with this project. We are right on schedule for the book’s publication and expect everything to go as planned. The writing has been completed and the book is now in editing. The editors will start the copyediting after we start raising funds. After completing the copyediting, the book will go to the publisher. They will produce the PDF version first.

After producing and testing the PDF, the publisher will start work on the iBook, the Kindle book, and the Nook book. We will start distributing all of those eBooks at the end of the fundraising campaign or as soon as possible.

Before the eBooks are completed, the publisher will start on the 160 page print version of the physical workbook. If everything goes as planned, we will start shipping out the paperback workbooks about 60 days after the campaign's end date. During that time, we will also distribute the (late) PDF ebooks.

If you can read English, you can help others learn to read. You can start your own reading program! You only need three or four students to begin and a few family members volunteering as tutors. Start helping the children of family members, then help friends. The only curriculum you will need is "Phonetic English." When you teach adults the basic skills, get a pledge from them. Make them promise to teach at least one other person to read.Phonetic English is the most advanced language skills program in the world. Native English speakers can learn to teach basic reading skills in twenty-four to forty-eight hours. English language learners can learn to read and speak English in a few weeks.Help Us Reach Our Goal $1 at a TimeOur standard PDF ebook perk  is $10. The other ebooks are $20. However, if you make a smaller contribution of between $1 and $5, you will get a PDF ebook after we distribute the other perks. Those who request the $5 perk will get their PDF ebook before those who chose the $1 perk. The $1  perks will be distributed according to the dates we receive the requests. Also, your kind donations will allow us to continue to distribute workbooks to anyone who can afford to pay $1.If teaching is not for you, get workbooks for an adult literacy center. Do you know people who are confined in an institution? If so, send them a workbook so they can help others and learn a tutoring skill for themselves. Do you know a child who is at risk for reading failure? If so, tell the parents about Each-One-Teach-One.Please support us today!
We want to raise about $12,500 to make a first run of 500 quality paperback workbooks and distribute them to the supporters who request them. We should still have enough money left over to license and start our organization. This will get the ball rolling toward building a distribution center. As a larger organization, we will distribute ebooks and paperback books to individuals, communities, and institutions around the world. If we do not reach our fundraising goal, we will still produce the books and distribute all the perks. Also, everyone who orders a paperback book will get a free PDF ebook.Project Manager’s Note
We all know that reading is the key to a quality education and a better way of life. An education is everything. It leads to better jobs, promotions, and the ability to communicate well with others. Unfortunately, a quality education is not available to most people. However, if this program is funded, more people can learn the basic reading foundation and start teaching themselves and others. That makes Each-One-Teach-One a powerful concept! My pledge is to make this early reading foundation available to everyone. - Dennis Brooks, writer, researcher, reading specialist, and project manager.
If You Can Read, You Can Teach!
Whether you are a native English speaker or speak English as a second language, when you get your hands on “Phonetic English,” you can start teaching reading and English. Phonetic English is the only workbook you will need to teach yourself and your students. It takes only a few hours of studying to learn how to tutor. Wherever you go, your Phonetic English workbook will go with you in your electronic devices. 
Start your own tutoring service using only your laptop, tablet, or smart phone. All you have to do is hand out notes with your name and number: 
“I can teach you to read, write, and speak English. Contact Jane at 123-456-7890.”When you can read English, you can teach both reading and English. According to some estimations, nearly one-half of the world's population will eventually learn English. Lots of people need your help. English and reading tutors are in demand because of the need for English teachers. 
 Work Part Time or Full Time as a TutorReading and English skills are easy to learn and teach. As a tutor, you can decide when to work, how much to charge, and keep the money. When working for yourself, the pay will be good, the benefits will be wonderful, and you will be your own boss. To get started tutoring, offer the first three or four tutoring sessions for free!
The workbooks are for all ages and grade levels. They start with the basic reading foundation and teach the standard vocabulary for both British and American English. Also, they teach reading with the 44+ sounds without using diacritical marks. They use standard formatting instead.

Sponsor a Learning Center Near You
For just $500 you can sponsor a learning center in your area. At the end of the campaign, we will publish the 160 page, 8 1/2 x 11 inch paperback workbook. Your center will get 20 workbooks, which will be shipped anywhere at no extra cost. Many people in the United states and other countries still need to develop basic language skills and you can help. Simply coordinate with your institution, school, or learning center and let them know that you want to sponsor them. You must provide their name, address, and telephone number.Why Teach Reading and English?
The spread of English by the British Empire and the influence of American businesses have made English the number one choice as a global second language. After World War II, American businesses took English around the world as the language of international trade. English is now the most widely used language in the world. All of the world’s top business schools and universities teach courses in English.
English is EverywhereScience and technologyHealth and medicineInternet and computersJournalism and literatureEducation and academicsTransportation and entertainmentIt is also the language used in international politics.
World EconomyEnglish now plays a great part in the world’s economy and popular culture. It is exported in music, in movies, through television, and over the internet. It also has a solid position in tourism, advertising, and social science. Also, it is the only language used in international air traffic control.
As an international language, English is helping people in different countries, communities, and villages communicate with each other.


Teach Yourself to Read, Write, and Speak Better EnglishIf you can read some English now, you can improve on your own. All it takes is a few hours a day. Use your new skills to get a better education and a better job. The opportunities are endless for English speakers. You can become a  doctor, lawyer, dentist, scientist, teacher, or anything you want.If this project is successful, we will start eliminating one of the greatest obstacles to a better education. That is why we hope you will become a supporter and ask others to join us in making education a priority especially for those who are just learning to read.

Risks and Challenges
There should be no risks and challenges with this project. We are right on schedule for the book’s publication and expect everything to go as planned. The writing has been completed and the book is now in editing. The editors will start the copyediting after we start raising funds. After completing the copyediting, the book will go to the publisher. They will produce the PDF version first.
After producing and testing the PDF, the publisher will start work on the iBook, the Kindle book, and the Nook book. We will start distributing all of those eBooks at the end of the fundraising campaign or as soon as possible.Before the eBooks are completed, the publisher will start on the 160 page print version of the physical workbook. If everything goes as planned, we will start shipping out the paperback workbooks about 60 days after the campaign's end date. During that time, we will also distribute the (late) PDF ebooks.

story:
Hiller Pario

He was born and raised in Masindi, Uganda. As a young village boy he learned how to play football/soccer using rolled up banana leaves. He now has more than 14 years of experience coaching and mentoring young children through sports.Through his coaching he has helped many youth realize their own potential in life. He earned his bachelor's degree in Exercise Science with youth sports coaching certificates. He wants to give back to his local community and schools of Masindi by sharing his knowledge.

Help change local children's lives

Take a moment and make a difference in child's life, and help them to work toward a brighter future, we kindly ask that you consider to support PEYTSAR program again for another year.  Our goal is to raise $4,094 for the entire year. These funds will be used to purchase sports equipment, pay office rent, mentor-coach training and run administration. We also want to strengthen our ongoing program such as track & field, football/soccer, cultural dance and orienteering activities.  Next year we're planning to expand the program to other local schools.

The Impact

Since July 2013, the program has trained and engaged more than 483 disadvantaged young children. Both boys and girls. Our organization also engaged 93 local children. Furthermore, the program provides mentor-coaches to guide and support boys and girls opportunities to learn, practice and play sport.

This February 23rd to April 1st 2015 we conducted track & field afterschool program, over 125 students participated. Many students from PEYTSAR after-school were selected to represent their primary school competition at district level. They managed to be the second best amongst fifteen primary schools in the District for the first time. The school, track & field officials, and track & field organizers were all amazed by students performance. Because of that some of our mentor-coaches were called at District level.

Risks & Challenges

Now our challenges  are as follows: 

  • The need to support young children because many of their families have hard financial struggle.
  • The needs to sustain our existing  and going programs.
  • The needs to pay for office rent and office supplies.
  • The need to buy sport shorts or uniforms for girls. Most train in skirts.
  • The need to train mentor-coaches and provide them with the best practices.
The funds raised will be used to target our challenging problems
  • To support young children in the program.
  • To sustain our existing  and going programs.
  • To pay for office rent and office supplies.
  • To buy sport shorts or uniforms for girls. Instead of skirts.
  • To train mentor-coaches and provide them with the best practices.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Help us spread the words by sending large emails to your friends, facebook and other social media sources,
  • You can contact us email:peytsar@gmail.com. if you would like to make an in-kind donation.
  • Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!
WE THANK YOU FOR YOUR CONSIDERATION OF OUR REQUEST
