“Once again you’ve enlightened my students… Hopefully the increased awareness will encourage them to take care of our earth.”
3rd grade teacher
I also do two birding walks a year, as a volunteer, for the city of Glendale Parks & Rec. and maybe I can also do these at community centers for larger groups of children as well. I have friends in various cities parks & rec depts. and I know they'd be thrilled to have me show kids how to bird. I realize that our economy has hit everyone hard, but I also know that there are those people out there, like many of you, who are able to help.  So, I humbly and respectfully ask you to help me help children. Please go to the website and donate whatever you can and please share the link with others who can help as well.  I thank you from the bottom of my heart in advance.   What We Need & What You Get  I'm asking for $30,000 for equipment and materials that will serve for many many years. The initial investment is a lot of money but it will buy everything I need to get children involved in birdwatching. I need binoculars and bird books to lend to the entire class at each visit. I also need a laptop and a projector with a screen. A birdwatching camera setup is also needed so when the children go on the birdwatching walk they can snap some photos of the birds on their school grounds. A printer is also needed to create the materials that will be given to the children.  You can be a major sponsor  with your name prominently mentioned in the presentation and in all advertising materials with your contribution of $5,000
Donations of $30 will buy a birding guide and the first 30 donors will have their name out in one of the books noting that it was your donation that made the book possible. Binoculars are $200 ea.  The first 30 donors who contribute this amount will have their name placed on one of the 30 binoculars needed so that each child is able to use one.  The projector ($1,300) and screen ($400) will cost approximately $1,700 and if you donate that amount first, your name will always be mentioned as the person who made that equipment possible. Then there's the laptop with the programs to create the slide shows and that's about $3,500.  The most expensive part of this program, but the item that will last the longest is the camera, lens and tripod/gimbal combination needed for birdwatching photography.  The total is about $16,000.  Then there is protective items for the equipment and cases to carry all the equipment from place to place and the printer to create all the materials that will be handed out to children at the presentations.  In any case, every single person who donates will be listed at the end of the program so that the students know that the presentation was made possible by the good will of many people who care for them. 
If you want to purchase the items directly and have them sent to me, we can do that as well.  I have specific brands that I've researched which will work the best for what I want to do, so if you are so inclined to purchase the item straight out from the specialty stores that I've researched, please let me know and I will give you the model number of the item and the store website that it is available from. And as previously mentioned, any item purchased with your donation will have your name on it stating you were the donor that made the item possible. You can contact me at roaemail@gmail.com for any question you may have. I don't have much to offer besides my photography, so if there are any bird photos you like in my Facebook or Instagram I can send you an 8x10 of it for every $50 contribution. Just let me know which one by taking a screenshot and sending me an email to roaemail@gmail.com. I am grateful for anything you can donate and I can also sign the photo for you if you'd like.     The Impact Your contribution will help me get children going outdoors and walking and exercising.   I believe this is extremely important because I can give children skills that will last for a lifetime and they can use those for a healthier lifestyle. Waking outside and looking for birds will take them away from sitting inside playing video games, which I believe is a major contributor to children's obesity.  Every time I've given a birding presentation children they all been positive and given me really great feedback. They write notes telling me they enjoyed the birds and some even go home and look for birds on their own. One child told me one time as I finished my presentation he wished he could go home with me because he liked the birds so much. 
We all know or have children in elementary school. Wouldn't it be great if they could learn something new and exciting like birdwatching.     Risks & Challenges I believe this is a worthy cause and my challenge will be in raising the money needed.  Once I have the funds, getting the equipment and pitching the project to schools will be the easy part. I know my son's former teachers were all very positive about the presentation the first time I told them about it and even other teachers who watched had be come back for their own classes.  I've always been a positive person and outgoing. If I do not meet my goal this time with the fundraising the funds info receive will make the initial purchase of binoculars and bird books and any other equipment that I can afford. I will continue trying to raise funds until I have everything I need to get e children the best presentation possible. I want to give my best to them so they know there are people out there who truly care about them and their health.  I have about 4 months to get everything ready and I know I can accomplish this goal because I've done the presentations before and all I need is the equipment to start calling schools and offering my free program.     Other Ways You Can Help Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:  If you can, share the link on Facebook, Twitter and email to those you know. Please share this story with everyone. I truly am grateful for any help you can give me, financial or otherwise.  Please share this link: http://igg.me/p/1300502/twtr/11017697

story:
Please help the children who need us! 

Please consider a tax-deductible donation to support the Child Advocacy Center of the Finger Lakes (CAC), a program of the Partnership for Ontario County, Inc.

Every ten seconds in the United States, a report of child abuse is made and more than five children die every day as a result of abuse. 

The CAC provides a child-friendly environment where victims of child abuse and their non-offending caregivers meet with professionals. In 2002, the Finger Lakes Child Abuse Response Team (FLCART) formed to streamline the response to child abuse in Ontario County. Instead of subjecting the child to multiple interviews, a one-stop, multi-disciplinary team meets with the child. The team is composed of representatives from Ontario County Child Protective Services, law enforcement, prosecution, mental health agencies, medical providers, victim support, and other family service agencies. In 2008, the CAC opened in Phelps, NY to serve as a safe, designated, child-friendly location for child abuse investigations.

This summer, 2015, the CAC plans to renovate and move into a new location in Canandaigua, NY to provide enhanced services to children and families in Ontario County. A Canandaigua office is more centrally located and the expanded space will allow us to provide more varied services on-site:

  • a counseling suite for specialized mental health services
  • a medical exam room
  • one interview room designed for young children and a separate interview room designed for older children or teenagers, 
  • private spaces for families to meet with advocates, law enforcement, Child Protective Services and other team members. 

Perks:

You may contribute in many ways:  Consider a leaf on our giving tree or name one of our rooms or the waiting room.



Sponsors will be recognized in a wide range of ways, depending on their giving level. These acknowledgments include our websites and Facebook pages, acknowledgment on all materials distributed regarding the new site, and for larger donations, an invitation to an exclusive reception at the new site. Supporters also have the option to sponsor a room. These rooms include the child interview room, teen interview room/family meeting room, medical room, counseling suite, and the conference room. These rooms can be sponsored by the donation of $10,000. The waiting room can be sponsored by a donation of $20,000. These sponsors will receive all recognition that other sponsors will receive, as well as recognition in the local newspaper, and a plaque displayed prominently in the room that they sponsor.  
Please visit our website to see the benefits associated with each level of sponsorship.  The CAC is a program of the Partnership for Ontario County, Inc. a 501 (c)(3) public charity.  All donations are tax-deductible as allowed by law.

The Difference YOU can make:

  The renovation of this new site will allow for better convenience, comfort, and privacy of a child and their family in time of difficult circumstances. These improvements are important as they will allow the Child Advocacy center to continue to accomplish their goals of

1.  Reducing the secondary trauma to children through a compassionate response.

2.  Sharing respective skills, information and resources to rapidly and thoroughly investigate allegations of child abuse.

3.  Providing the best support possible to enable the healing process.  

Other Ways You Can Help:

  If you are not able to contribute to this cause, please help the CAC by sharing our campaign and getting the word out to others who may be able to contribute! 


Please visit our Facebook Pages: 

Child Advocacy Center of the Finger Lakes

The Partnership for Ontario County

And our websites:

www.cacfingerlakes.org

www.partnershipforontariocounty.org


Thank you!

story: St. Jude Children's Research Hospital helps children in need of medical care. No family is ever charged a bill for their services because no family should ever have to worry about anything other than their child's well-being. I want to help raise funds for this organization & I would love your help. I will match your donation by 50% up to a total of $500 (I wish I was rich enough to match more but I'm being realistic). I have included perks for your generosity. Together we can help make a difference in these children's lives. Life is hard enough as an adult, let's not make it harder for them as a child.

story:
Hello,

My name is Kyle Callard. I first viewed the trailer for The Mask You Live In by Jennifer Seibel Newsom for The Representation Project about a year ago. The website for the film states "The Mask You Live In follows boys and young men as they struggle to stay true to themselves while negotiating America’s narrow definition of masculinity."

Immediately I began to stalk The Representation Project's website and social media outlets to learn when it would be available for audiences. Finally the film was released at Sundance and is now available for organizations, communities and individuals to host screenings for their communities. 

Reasons why this film is important for me to see and share:

  • I am a mom of a 5 year old boy.
  • Recently I lost my baby brother to suicide, and even though our family agrees that there was no single reason that influenced my brother to take his own life, we do believe that at some point during his formative years, our Max began to wear his own "mask". He could have been wearing a "mask" to hide or blend in to be accepted by his peers, or the "mask" could have been him slowly shutting off amazing characteristics that my brother possessed, that are not a part of dominant culture's definition of masculinity. 
  • All of us that have any impact on the lives of the youth being raised need to begin this conversation, not only in our homes, but out loud and in our communities. This is not about feminizing boys, it is about establishing a healthy household and community in which all children are raised. 

Screening Costs and Theater Rental Fee

We need your help to secure additional funding to cover the costs to host the Tulsa screening of The Mask You Live In on Tuesday, August 18 at 6pm.

  • Earlier this summer I ran a separate campaign to raise money for an Oklahoma City screening. After the success of that event, I turned to contacts in Tulsa to schedule a second screening and discussion.
  • Now that we've secured the Circle Cinema, a second screening license, and a stellar panel of speakers, we're excited to report that there has been more interest in the event than expected, so we want to upgrade to a larger theater to free screening to a larger group. We need just a little more funding to move forward.
  • $300 USD is our minimum goal to offer the film to a capacity of 140 people
  • $985 USD is the maximum to offer the film to an audience of 222 people in Circle Cinema's largest auditorium. 
  • Unused funding will go toward organizing a third screening in Norman or will be donated to The Representation Project.

Community

  • Your contribution helps to make this screening and discussion free to the Tulsa community. 
  • After I hosted the first screening in Oklahoma City in June, I connected with Mana Tahaie of YWCA Tulsa, who has partnered with me to host this film for the Tulsa community.
  • There will be a discussion panel following the film, in order to jumpstart this very important conversation. 

If you cannot give…

Please, forward the trailer and links on to anyone you know and come to the viewing of The Mask You Live In.

  • Attending the screening is just as important as raising the money to make it possible to view.
  • Sharing information about The Representation Project's The Mask You Live In on any social media outlets and with your friends and family is a great way to start the conversation within your community.
  • Next stop: Norman, Oklahoma. Additional funds will go toward another screening license and present this film in the Norman community.

story:
Ko smo mi/Who are we

Facebook stranica Dečjeg sela Sremska Kamenica

Dečije selo Novi Sad

Children's Village Novi Sad
Kamenicki park 1-14
21208 Sremska Kamenica
Serbia
 http://www.decijeselo.org.rs/
Tel: + 381 21 462 879
Fax: + 381 21 462 960

English summary: This funding effort is helping the largest orphanage in Serbia (Childrens village in Novi Sad) cope with the heating cost for the forthcoming winter, enabling us to get the pellets (bio renewable heating fuel) we need for the season, totaling around 30.000USD. More information in english on the bottom of the page, and on our website in english: Childrens village english website

Ustanova za decu i omladinu  Dečije selo dr. Milorad Pavlović Sremska Kamenica počela je sa radom 1975 godine. Osnovna delatnost ustanove je zbrinjavanje dece bez roditeljskog staranja, dece čiji je razvoj ometen porodičnim prilikama, raznim oblicima zlostavljanja i zanemarivanja do stvaranja uslova za zbrinjavanje u sopstvenu ili alternativnu porodicu ili do osposobljavanja za samostalni život. Dečije selo je državna ustanova socijalne zaštite, delatnost finansira budžet Republike Srbije a osnivač ustanove je Vlada AP Vojvodine. Organizacija i koncepcija rada utvrdjeni su Podzakonskim aktima Ministarstva za rad i socijalnu politiku R Srbije, a na osnovu ovih akata bliže uređena opštim aktima ustanove koja su na snazi.


Šta smo do sada uradili?

9. septembra 2015. godine, potpisivanjem Ugovora o ugradnji kotlova na biomasu zaokružili smo jednogodišnji ciklus žive aktivnosti i investicija  u Dečje selo "Dr Milorad Pavlović" Sremska Kamenica, Srbija, koji uključuje i:
-nastavak 4 i pokretanje novih 8 projekata usmerenih na osnaživanje i obrazovanje štićenika;
-pokretanje akcije "Promeni svet sms porukom na 5186";
-nabavke i instalacije najmodernije telefonske VoIP centrale;
-nabavke i instalacije sistema bežičnog Interneta;
-nabavke i instalacije sistema zagrevanja sanitarne vode solarnom energijom;
-nabavke i instalacije sistema video nadzora sa daljinskim i odloženim osmatranjem;
-potpunu konverziju rasvetnih tela u Selu i stanovima štedljivim, najmodernijim led sijalicama i cevima;
-upristojavanje igrališta u Dečjem selu i izgradnja teretane na otvorenom;
-projekta javnih radova sa 35 radnika svih profila;
-uključivanje stručnih volontera i saradnika u oblastima kao što su radionički rad, logopedija...;
-puštanje u rad softvera za učenje na daljinu, kao i sistema za evidenciju prisustva zaposlenih karticama;
-opremanje 3 nova, poklonjena stana kompletnim nameštajem i tehnikom;
-i mnogo mnogo drugih aktivnosti koje ulepšavaju život i olakšavaju detinjstvo našoj dečici!
Ovim putem se ponovo zahvaljujem svim prijateljicama i prijateljima, saradnicima i radnicima, volonterima, donatorima, predstavnicima vlasti i medija, jer bez Vas, ništa od ovoga ne bi bilo moguće!


Zašto nam je sada potrebna Vaša pomoć

Kako bismo nesmetano grejali Dečje selo uz pomoć novih, ekoloških kotlova na biomasu, neophodno je da prikupimo sredstva za nabavku peleta, koja iznose oko 25.000€.


Rezultati

Svaka Vaša donacija će biti upotrebljena isključivo za nabavku peleta za grejanje. Ove nabavke se obavljaju na potpuno jasan i zakonom propisan način, po pravilima za Javne nabavke u Javnim Ustanovama i preduzećima u Srbiji.

Svaki doniran dinar će omogućiti lakšu, lepšu i topliju zimu za naše štićenike i omogućiti im makar materijalne preduslove za lep život, učenje i rad.

Rizici

U vremenima u kojima živimo često je teško očekivati pomoć drugih kada su u pitanju humanitarni ciljevi, pa makar i jedne takve utemeljene i ugledne Ustanove kao što je Dečje selo u Sremskoj Kamenici. Kampanja "pošalji sms na 5186" je tako dala polovične rezultate, tako da postoji mogući rizik neuspeha i ovog načina prikupljanja sredstava. U tom slučaju će se Selo, kao i do sada, krajnjim naporom zaposlenih i čitave zajednice, snalaziti kako zna i ume.

Ako nemate novca ili ne posedujete kreditnu karticu

Najvrednije što možete da date Selu je prisustvo, pomoć, pažnja našoj deci. Slobodno nas kontaktirajte, navratite, osnažite našu dečicu. Održite im čas matematike, donesite igraču. Ukoliko imate mogućnost da pelet donirate u toj formi, rado ćemo prihvatiti i taj vid pomoći, kao i sve druge.

Još malo o nama
Ustanova Dečije selo pripadalo je do sredine 80tih godina međunarodnoj organizaciji SOS Dečjih sela (Kinderdorf internnational) što znači da je organizacija života i rada u ustanovi bila organizovana na način i po sistemu oponašanja života u porodici. 
Svaka kućica predstavlja jednu celini i tu živi do 8-10 dece različitog pola i uzrasta o kojima brinu vaspitač i negovateljice. Izmedju njih se neguju i razvijaju veze bliskosti, oponašaju se odnosi u porodici (roditelji, braća i sestre).
Ustanova se finansira iz budžeta Republike Srbije u skladu sa zakonom i podzakonskim aktima. Pored toga ustanova stiče sredstva po Projektima koje podržava AP Vojvodina i Projektima koje podržava i finansira Grad Novi Sad, preko gradske uprave za socijalnu zaštitu. Pored ovih sredstava mnoga fizička i pravna lica kako iz zemlje tako i inostranstva doniraju sredstva za pospešivanje kvaliteta života dece u ustanovi. 
Može se reći da je  Dečije selo ustanova koja ima podršku i ugled u Novom Sadu i šire, tako da gradska uprava, mnoge institucije i privatni preduzetnici i fizička lica, doniraju novac, hranu , letovanja , putovanja, opremu: računarsku, sportsku , ulaznice za razne kulturne i sportske manifestacije što u znatnoj meri utiče na kvalitet života dece u ustanovi kao i njihovo osposobljavanje za samostalan život. Isto tako, naša prednost su:

- Kvalitetni i funkcionalni stambeni uslovi i kompleks Dečijeg sela koji zadovoljava potrebe života dece iz Dečijeg sela.
- Iskustvo u dosadašnjem radu ustanove od 36 godina stručnog i posvećenog rada zaposlenih;
- Visok standard života dece u selu (smeštaj, ishrana, aktivnosti u slobodnom vremenu razne radionice, sportske i kulturne aktivnotisti); 
- Mogućnost školovanja dece shodno njihovim mogućnostima i kapacitetima koje pruža blizina obrazovnih ustanova u Novom Sadu;
- Dugogodišnji programi rada sa decom iz sela koja postepeno prelaze u zaštićeno stanovanje i različiti programi podrške za mlade koji napuštaju socijalnu zaštitu;
- Dugogodišnji rad na razvoju kontakata dece i prijatelja dece i kumova u ciju pružanja podrške deci i njihovim emotivnim potrebama i razvijanju i negovanju porodičnih odnosa za koje su ova deca uskraćena;
- Dosadašnje iskustvo u promenama sistema socijalne zaštite i transformacije ustanaova socijalne zaštite, koja je već primenjena;
- Posedovanja stanova u gradu koji omogućuju razvoj otvorenih oblika socijalne zaštite zaštićeno stanovanje, kuća na pola puta , osamostaljivanje i osnaživanje mladih za samostalan život, pomoć kod zapošljavanja idr. 

Misija i vizija
1. U narednom periodu nastaviti sa radom i održavanjem dostignutog nivoa uslova smeštaja i adekvatne nege (bezbednost u selu, nega, kvalitetna ishrana, briga i vaspitanja dece i omladine, rad na obavezama vezanim za učenje, briga o zdravlju i stvaranju uslova za kvalitetno odrastanje i korišćenje slobodnog vremena i dodatnih aktivnosti).

2. U narednom periodu razvijaćemo nove programske aktivnosti i usluge, kao što su npr: predah, hraniteljskim porodicama (kada se pojave ozbiljniji problemi kod dece), ili (i) priprema dece i privremeni smeštaj dece do pronalaženja adekvatne hraniteljske porodice.

3. Ulazak u ustanovu i napuštanje ustanove, pažljivo planirati planom tretmana i otpusta utvrditi procedure i uspostaviti tretman prema individualnim potrebama deteta.

4. Participacija deteta u donošenju svih za dete značajnih odluka uz učešće organa starateljstva, i drugih relevantnih lica, kao što su: roditelj, srodnik i sl. Kontinuiranu pomoć svakom detetu imajući u vidu njegove potrebe.

5. Predvideti i doneti programske sadržaje u cilju prevazilaženja i saniranja posledica traumatskih iskustava iz porodice porekla, probleme u adaptaciji, kao i priprema za integraciju u otvorenoj sredini.
6. Poštovanje privatnosti deteta i osmišljavanja pragmatičnog pristupa u radu kroz individualni rad i toleranciju.

Additional information in english

Children’s Village Sremska Kamenica was created as a part of large family of SOS Children’s Villages.  Children s village has been open 1975 as 100th in the world and first In Eastern Europe.  

Children’s village has been named after Milorad Pavlovic, in that period the Secretary for Social Affairs of. Milorad Pavlovic was searching for an answer to the question: “How to help children without adequate parental care, to give them a happy childhood?” when he found teaching of Hermann Majer. He embraced his ideas about the concept of children’s villages, relying on a story about the life of children in a family where the foster relationships of trust, cooperation, closeness of unconditional acceptance.

His great desire to help children moved him to make his dream true and build Children’s village in Sremska Kamenica. He brought together a numbers of associates who supported his ideas, support and financial assistance received from a large number of citizens and organizations of the then state of Yugoslavia and the Children organization.

Traditionally people in this country region take a care about children with lots of love, respects and understanding. Sremska Kamenica lived and worked most benefactors who have dedicated their life’s and property to humanitarian work and children, such as children’s greatest poet Jovan Jovanović Zmaj.

The most beautiful part of the old park Sremska Kamenica, leaning on the bank of the Danube was chosen area where the village was built. Natural landscape, architectural furnishings create a sense of the nature park with two rows of picturesque red-roofed houses lined up in a circle form a harmonious composition of the village.

Daily, 365 days a year, lead teachers, carers and professionals of different profiles (social worker, educator, psychologist, special education teacher …) taking care about children. Treatment for children is planned along with the Centers for Social Work. Since founding, the Children’s Village networked in the social security system of the Republic of Serbia.

Quality care for children involves multi-sector collaboration and multidisciplinary approach with fully involvement of other stakeholders outside the social security system. First of all, that includes education and health systems. Major contributions to creating a stimulating environment make different non-governmental organizations.
Life of youth, theirs empowering, growing and working takes place in several locations in Novi Sad.
The process of working in the Children’s Village is organized through services such as:

  • Department for accommodation and care for children and young people based in Sremska Kamenica, Children’s Village 1 – 13 and 2A and 2B with a capacity of 120 places.
  • Department for alternative forms of care and support programs for children and young people and
  • Department for general and common tasks which carries out general and common activities of interest for the entire institution

In Sremska Kamenica situated 15 high-standard facilities, 12 houses intended for children and young people living, while other objects intended for use Children’s Village administration.

Work organization is set up on the way that each house is a separate family. Relation between children has been created in contest of older and younger brothers and sisters. They socialize together and continue support thought whole life.

In the urban area of Novi Sad village has 8 fully equipped, flats and a house with two apartments. This space is intended for young people who are on the path of independence, as well as young people who are studying at universities in Novi Sad. All of the above objects that are placed within the separated part of the Children’s Villages were obtained donor funding heritage. This program is called the “House on a half way”.

Children’s Village few year ago as gift got weekend house near the town, which is intended for program youth activities throughout the year.

Houses on the half way

The “Halfway House” is one of the most important alternative protection programs for young people who have designed the Children’s Village in 1995.as responds on a question where after completion of professional training and leaving care. This program allows young people who have long been living in the village and graduated from high school or continue their education help to gradually become self-sufficient and take full responsibility for independent living. The concept of the program involves the existential and psychological support to the self-organization of life that is based on the values of their own work.

It began modestly with one apartment, which was a gift, and after that, the support of the International Children’s Villages and the citizens of Novi Sad was a eight-equipped apartment and a house with two separate apartment with a total capacity of 28 places. These facilities allow young men to prolong his stay until two or three years, depending on their needs.

Basic characteristics of the “Halfway House”:

Young people are involved in the professional training program which includes practical training for independent living.

Young people are involved in activities for mastering important pragmatic skills (driving tests, language schools, school computers) to facilitate employment and other activities necessary for independent living

Transfer and develop a model of social and life skills to young people who are related to planning, legislation, funding, household, interpersonal relationships, work and relationship with yourself

  • Achieving a dynamic balance between freedom and responsibility
  • Existential and psychological support
  • The formation of social support networks and organized in preparation for independent living
  • Cooperation with local communities regarding employment and with regulations
  • Advisory work with young people while in the program and the program exit
  • Collaboration with employers
story_txt:
Ko smo mi/Who are we


Facebook stranica Dečjeg sela Sremska Kamenica


Dečije selo Novi Sad
Children's Village Novi SadKamenicki park 1-1421208 Sremska KamenicaSerbia http://www.decijeselo.org.rs/Tel: + 381 21 462 879Fax: + 381 21 462 960


English summary: This funding effort is helping the largest orphanage in Serbia (Childrens village in Novi Sad) cope with the heating cost for the forthcoming winter, enabling us to get the pellets (bio renewable heating fuel) we need for the season, totaling around 30.000USD. More information in english on the bottom of the page, and on our website in english: Childrens village english websiteUstanova za decu i omladinu  Dečije selo dr. Milorad Pavlović Sremska Kamenica počela je sa radom 1975 godine. Osnovna delatnost ustanove je zbrinjavanje dece bez roditeljskog staranja, dece čiji je razvoj ometen porodičnim prilikama, raznim oblicima zlostavljanja i zanemarivanja do stvaranja uslova za zbrinjavanje u sopstvenu ili alternativnu porodicu ili do osposobljavanja za samostalni život. Dečije selo je državna ustanova socijalne zaštite, delatnost finansira budžet Republike Srbije a osnivač ustanove je Vlada AP Vojvodine. Organizacija i koncepcija rada utvrdjeni su Podzakonskim aktima Ministarstva za rad i socijalnu politiku R Srbije, a na osnovu ovih akata bliže uređena opštim aktima ustanove koja su na snazi.

 


  Šta smo do sada uradili? 9. septembra 2015. godine, potpisivanjem Ugovora o ugradnji kotlova na biomasu zaokružili smo jednogodišnji ciklus žive aktivnosti i investicija  u Dečje selo "Dr Milorad Pavlović" Sremska Kamenica, Srbija, koji uključuje i:-nastavak 4 i pokretanje novih 8 projekata usmerenih na osnaživanje i obrazovanje štićenika;-pokretanje akcije "Promeni svet sms porukom na 5186";-nabavke i instalacije najmodernije telefonske VoIP centrale;-nabavke i instalacije sistema bežičnog Interneta;-nabavke i instalacije sistema zagrevanja sanitarne vode solarnom energijom;-nabavke i instalacije sistema video nadzora sa daljinskim i odloženim osmatranjem;-potpunu konverziju rasvetnih tela u Selu i stanovima štedljivim, najmodernijim led sijalicama i cevima;-upristojavanje igrališta u Dečjem selu i izgradnja teretane na otvorenom;-projekta javnih radova sa 35 radnika svih profila;-uključivanje stručnih volontera i saradnika u oblastima kao što su radionički rad, logopedija...;-puštanje u rad softvera za učenje na daljinu, kao i sistema za evidenciju prisustva zaposlenih karticama;-opremanje 3 nova, poklonjena stana kompletnim nameštajem i tehnikom;-i mnogo mnogo drugih aktivnosti koje ulepšavaju život i olakšavaju detinjstvo našoj dečici!Ovim putem se ponovo zahvaljujem svim prijateljicama i prijateljima, saradnicima i radnicima, volonterima, donatorima, predstavnicima vlasti i medija, jer bez Vas, ništa od ovoga ne bi bilo moguće!


Zašto nam je sada potrebna Vaša pomoć
Kako bismo nesmetano grejali Dečje selo uz pomoć novih, ekoloških kotlova na biomasu, neophodno je da prikupimo sredstva za nabavku peleta, koja iznose oko 25.000€. 


  Rezultati Svaka Vaša donacija će biti upotrebljena isključivo za nabavku peleta za grejanje. Ove nabavke se obavljaju na potpuno jasan i zakonom propisan način, po pravilima za Javne nabavke u Javnim Ustanovama i preduzećima u Srbiji.
Svaki doniran dinar će omogućiti lakšu, lepšu i topliju zimu za naše štićenike i omogućiti im makar materijalne preduslove za lep život, učenje i rad.
    Rizici U vremenima u kojima živimo često je teško očekivati pomoć drugih kada su u pitanju humanitarni ciljevi, pa makar i jedne takve utemeljene i ugledne Ustanove kao što je Dečje selo u Sremskoj Kamenici. Kampanja "pošalji sms na 5186" je tako dala polovične rezultate, tako da postoji mogući rizik neuspeha i ovog načina prikupljanja sredstava. U tom slučaju će se Selo, kao i do sada, krajnjim naporom zaposlenih i čitave zajednice, snalaziti kako zna i ume.
    Ako nemate novca ili ne posedujete kreditnu karticu Najvrednije što možete da date Selu je prisustvo, pomoć, pažnja našoj deci. Slobodno nas kontaktirajte, navratite, osnažite našu dečicu. Održite im čas matematike, donesite igraču. Ukoliko imate mogućnost da pelet donirate u toj formi, rado ćemo prihvatiti i taj vid pomoći, kao i sve druge.


Još malo o nama
Ustanova Dečije selo pripadalo je do sredine 80tih godina međunarodnoj organizaciji SOS Dečjih sela (Kinderdorf internnational) što znači da je organizacija života i rada u ustanovi bila organizovana na način i po sistemu oponašanja života u porodici. Svaka kućica predstavlja jednu celini i tu živi do 8-10 dece različitog pola i uzrasta o kojima brinu vaspitač i negovateljice. Izmedju njih se neguju i razvijaju veze bliskosti, oponašaju se odnosi u porodici (roditelji, braća i sestre).Ustanova se finansira iz budžeta Republike Srbije u skladu sa zakonom i podzakonskim aktima. Pored toga ustanova stiče sredstva po Projektima koje podržava AP Vojvodina i Projektima koje podržava i finansira Grad Novi Sad, preko gradske uprave za socijalnu zaštitu. Pored ovih sredstava mnoga fizička i pravna lica kako iz zemlje tako i inostranstva doniraju sredstva za pospešivanje kvaliteta života dece u ustanovi. Može se reći da je  Dečije selo ustanova koja ima podršku i ugled u Novom Sadu i šire, tako da gradska uprava, mnoge institucije i privatni preduzetnici i fizička lica, doniraju novac, hranu , letovanja , putovanja, opremu: računarsku, sportsku , ulaznice za razne kulturne i sportske manifestacije što u znatnoj meri utiče na kvalitet života dece u ustanovi kao i njihovo osposobljavanje za samostalan život. Isto tako, naša prednost su:
-	Kvalitetni i funkcionalni stambeni uslovi i kompleks Dečijeg sela koji zadovoljava potrebe života dece iz Dečijeg sela.-	Iskustvo u dosadašnjem radu ustanove od 36 godina stručnog i posvećenog rada zaposlenih;-	Visok standard života dece u selu (smeštaj, ishrana, aktivnosti u slobodnom vremenu razne radionice, sportske i kulturne aktivnotisti); -	Mogućnost školovanja dece shodno njihovim mogućnostima i kapacitetima koje pruža blizina obrazovnih ustanova u Novom Sadu;-	Dugogodišnji programi rada sa decom iz sela koja postepeno prelaze u zaštićeno stanovanje i različiti programi podrške za mlade koji napuštaju socijalnu zaštitu;-	Dugogodišnji rad na razvoju kontakata dece i prijatelja dece i kumova u ciju pružanja podrške deci i njihovim emotivnim potrebama i razvijanju i negovanju porodičnih odnosa za koje su ova deca uskraćena;-	Dosadašnje iskustvo u promenama sistema socijalne zaštite i transformacije ustanaova socijalne zaštite, koja je već primenjena;-	Posedovanja stanova u gradu koji omogućuju razvoj otvorenih oblika socijalne zaštite zaštićeno stanovanje, kuća na pola puta , osamostaljivanje i osnaživanje mladih za samostalan život, pomoć kod zapošljavanja idr. Misija i vizija1.	U narednom periodu nastaviti sa radom i održavanjem dostignutog nivoa uslova smeštaja i adekvatne nege (bezbednost u selu, nega, kvalitetna ishrana, briga i vaspitanja dece i omladine, rad na obavezama vezanim za učenje, briga o zdravlju i stvaranju uslova za kvalitetno odrastanje i korišćenje slobodnog vremena i dodatnih aktivnosti).2.	U narednom periodu razvijaćemo nove programske aktivnosti i usluge, kao što su npr: predah, hraniteljskim porodicama (kada se pojave ozbiljniji problemi kod dece), ili (i) priprema dece i privremeni smeštaj dece do pronalaženja adekvatne hraniteljske porodice.3.	Ulazak u ustanovu i napuštanje ustanove, pažljivo planirati planom tretmana i otpusta utvrditi procedure i uspostaviti tretman prema individualnim potrebama deteta.4.	Participacija deteta u donošenju svih za dete značajnih odluka uz učešće organa starateljstva, i drugih relevantnih lica, kao što su: roditelj, srodnik i sl. Kontinuiranu pomoć svakom detetu imajući u vidu njegove potrebe.5.	Predvideti i doneti programske sadržaje u cilju prevazilaženja i saniranja posledica traumatskih iskustava iz porodice porekla, probleme u adaptaciji, kao i priprema za integraciju u otvorenoj sredini.6.	Poštovanje privatnosti deteta i osmišljavanja pragmatičnog pristupa u radu kroz individualni rad i toleranciju.Additional information in englishChildren’s Village Sremska Kamenica was

story:
NUESTRA GRAN HISTORIA - OUR AMAZING STORY

En 2015 tendrá lugar por primera vez el Solar Decathlon para América Latina y el Caribe, la competencia de arquitectura sostenible más grande del mundo. La esencia de esta edición es construir una vivienda autosustentable, de interés social, que utilice tecnología de vanguardia y sistemas innovadores a bajos costos.  

Soñamos con la casa del futuro: inteligente, eficiente, adaptable, confortable y económica.  LA HEMOS CONSTRUÍDO PERO... ¡AÚN NOS FALTA DEMOSTRAR QUE ES LA MEJOR!

Nuestro equipo está conformado por un plantel multidisciplinario de estudiantes y egresados de la Universidad ORT de Uruguay de las Facultades de Arquitectura, Comunicación y Diseño, Ingeniería, Administración y Ciencias Sociales. Hemos estado trabajando en este proyecto sin fines de lucro por más de un año con plena dedicación por la pasión que existe más allá del concurso.

Con un increíble esfuerzo hemos hecho posible la construcción de la casa que diseñamos, ahora necesitamos llegar a Cali, Colombia a exponer nuestras ideas y para eso necesitamos tu ayuda!


Solar Decathlon is the most important sustainable architecture competition of the world and this is the first time that the contest is held in Latin America and the Caribbean. The essence of this edition is to build an economic dwelling of social interest, innovative, with sustainable technology incorporated

WE dream with the house of the future: intelligent, efficient, adaptive, comfortable and economic. WE HAVE BUILT IT BUT... WE NEED TO DEMONSTRATE THAT'S THE BEST!

Our team is made up by a multidisciplinary group of students and professionals from several Faculties such as: Architecture, Communication, Design, Engineering, Administration and Social Sciences. We have been working on this project for more than a year in a non profitable way, we do it all for the passion towards the goal beyond the contest.

We have made possible, with an incredible effort, the construction of the house we designed. Now we need to get to Cali and present our ideas, and for that we need your help! 


QUE NECESITAMOS - WHAT WE NEED

Necesitamos USD 20.570 para terminar de financiar los gastos del proyecto! Estamos intentando alcanzar nuestra meta por distintos medios por lo que cualquier tipo de aporte será totalmente gratificante y significará estar un paso más cerca de nuestro sueño.

The USD 20.570 goal represents the amount of money needed to finance the missing part of the project! We are fighting to achieve our goal through different ways, so any thing you want to collaborate with we will feel totally honored and therefore we will be one step closer to our dream. 


RECOMPENSAS - REWARDS


MENÚ LCU DE NUESTRA CHEF NANCY:

·  Previa 

o  Tabla de fiambres y quesos (Jamón crudo, jamón cocido, salame, bondiola, lomito canadiense, lomito ahumado, mortadela, quesos sándwich, parmesano, semiduro, aceitunas y  huevos de codorniz)

·  Entradas 

o  Tarta Quiche Lorraine

o  Tarta de Brócoli

·  Mesa Ensaladas

o  Lechuga

o  Tomate

o  Ensalada fantasía (repollo, jamón, choclo, y mayonesa)

o  Cebolla

o  Morrón asado

o  Rúcula

o  Chauchas

·  Plato Principal 

o  Pollo en salsa de champiñones, con guarnición de quinua encebollada

·  Postres 

o  Lemon Pie

o  Postre de Chocolate (Bizcochuelo relleno con crema de manteca, dulce de leche y cacao, bañado con chantillí de chocolate)


Toda recompensa será entregada luego de que la campaña haya terminado

Every reward will be handed after the campaign is closed


THE IMPACT – THE UTOPIA

Consideramos que en la actualidad se asocia la arquitectura ecológica y sustentable con algo que es caro y por lo tanto, inaccesible para muchas personas. Este concurso demuestra que esto no es así. Los 16 prototipos que participarán del mismo costarían menos de USD 50.000 si los mismos se produjeran a gran escala, pensando en barrios y comunidades sustentables. Este no es un dato menor, ya que derribaría una barrera cultural que hoy en día está muy arraigada, no solo en Latinoamérica sino en el mundo entero. Así mismo, si contemplamos también los ahorros que producirían estas casas en cuanto al uso de energía y agua, se acentúa aún más el impacto positivo de las mismas en nuestro planeta.

Vivimos en un mundo donde la energía es cada día más cara, donde muchos países no tienen acceso a agua potable y donde las personas con menos recursos deben consumir más energía de la que pueden pagar solo para subsistir, cuando en realidad debería ser a la inversa. Estos paradigmas deben corregirse si queremos que nuestros hijos y nietos vivan en un mundo mejor. Las personas y sobre todo los gobiernos deben tomar conciencia de que estas innovaciones no son utopías porque no se pueden alcanzar, son utopías porque son pocos quienes quieren invertir en las mismas.


We believe that today the ecological and sustainable architecture is associated with something that is expensive and therefore unaffordable for many people. This competition shows that this is not so. Each of the 16 prototypes involving the contest cost less than USD 50,000 if  produced on a large scale, considering neighborhoods and sustainable communities. This is really important, since it would topple a cultural barrier that today is deeply rooted not only in Latin America but worldwide. Likewise, if we also consider the savings that would produce these houses on the use of energy and water, it would accentuate the positive impact of these sustainable houses on our planet.

We live in a world where energy is more expensive every day, where many countries have no access to clean water and where people with fewer resources must consume more energy than they can afford only to survive, when it should be the other way around. People and especially governments should be aware that these innovations are not utopias that cannot be reached, these are utopias because only few people want to invest in them.


MORE ABOUT OUR PROTOTYPE

Nuestro prototipo puede perfectamente configurarse en forma activa, para que el mismo tome todas las decisiones de ahorro de energía indicando al usuario qué situaciones no son eficientes y a partir de eso sugerir qué hacer. Los sensores de temperatura le indicarán al usuario si debe aumentar o disminuir la temperatura del aire acondicionado; los sensores de luz se darán cuenta si hay una luz prendida cuando afuera aún es de día, y recomendarán apagarla; los sensores de presencia se darán cuenta si no hay nadie dentro de una habitación y en caso afirmativo, notificarán al usuario para que apague la luz u otro electrodoméstico que esté encendido (TV, equipo de audio, otros); y así con el resto de los sensores magnéticos, los “flaps” o alerones, los detectores de incendio, los sensores de CO2 y el recuperador entálpico.

Otro pilar del prototipo diseñado es la eficiencia energética, esto significa, lograr el mismo resultado de confort pero utilizando una menor cantidad de energía. Más por menos, más confort con menos uso de energía, más casa por menos recursos no renovables, más casa, más inteligente, más amigable, con menos recursos materiales. Este aprovechamiento energético tiene sus bases en dos aspectos: una estrategia pasiva basada en el diseño y las prestaciones de la casa, y por otro lado en la reutilización de los recursos que la casa obtiene.


Our prototype can be perfectly configured to respond in an active way, so that it takes all the energy-saving decisions and tells the user what situations are not efficient and therefor what to do. Temperature sensors will tell the user whether to increase or decrease the air conditioner temperature; light sensors will notice if there is a light on when it is still daylight outside, and recommend turning it off; occupancy sensors will notice if there is nobody in a room and if so, notify the user to turn off the light or other appliances that are turned on (TV, stereo, etc.); and so on with the magnetic sensors, CO2 sensors, flaps and the enthlapic recuperator.

Another pillar of the designed prototype is energy efficiency, that is to achieve the same comfort but using less energy. More for less, more comfort with less energy use, more home for smarter, friendlier, and less nonrenewable resources. This energy use is rooted in two aspects: a passive strategy based on design and performance of the house, and secondly on the reuse of the resources that the house gets. 


ESTRATEGIAS PASIVAS

-  La casa se envuelve por una “segunda piel” que genera un microclima en torno a la casa protegiéndola de las incidencias climáticas. De esta forma y a través de la estrategia de aislación y hermeticidad esta casa puede ser construída en una zona tropical tanto como en un clima frío como el de Uruguay, únicamente cambiando la orientación de la misma.

-  La casa cuenta con grandes ventanas y puertas orientados al sur, cubiertas por el alero que produce la cubierta reduciendo la incidencia solar, pero permitiendo la iluminación natural.

-  El agua caliente se generará a partir del calor recuperado de la bomba de calor (equipo externo). El Equipo será altamente eficiente y además de sus propiedades capturara el calor emitido por la bomba de calor generando el agua caliente. Por lo tanto conllevará 5 veces menos energía calentar el agua que con una resistencia.  

-  La superficie horizontal apunta hacia el espacio exterior que está a una temperatura muy baja, por lo que una diferencia de 4 a 5 grados menor que la temperatura de las superficies verticales. El sistema almacenará "el frío", producido por la radiación noche en un depósito interno incorporado en el techo, tenemos la intención de incorporar la Materiales de cambio de fase distribuidos estratégicamente.

-  Estar más cerca del Ecuador convierte a la insolación sol en un gran reto, tenemos que conseguir lo mejor de ella en términos de iluminación natural y la energía solar, pero también es imprescindible protegerse de la insolación directa del sol y las altas temperaturas. Por eso hemos generado un sobretecho que protege el techo propiamente de la casa.

Por otra parte, la reutilización de los recursos forma parte de esta estrategia, como el aprovechamiento del agua de lluvia para cultivos hidropónicos, la utilización del aire caliente del interior de la casa para calentar el del exterior cuando se purifica la casa de CO2 mediante el recuperador entálpico, el uso del agua producida por el aire acondicionado para el lavarropas, así como también la utilización del calor producido por la bomba de calor para calentar el agua del calefón en vez de utilizar la resistencia del mismo. Todas estas pequeñas tácticas sumadas conllevan a la consecución de la estrategia general de más por menos. La casa no solo producirá más energía de la que consume, sino que además será eficiente en el consumo de la misma, logrando así enormes ahorros a lo largo del tiempo.


PASSIVE STRATEGIES:

- It has been designed with a “second skin” that generates a microclimate around the house protecting it from the outdoor aggressive weather. In this way and throughout the insulation strategy we can construct this house for the tropical zone, but also we can change orientation and will be adapted to the Uruguayan climate.

- The house has big windows and doors, covered by the eave that produces the cover where there is less sun incidence but permits natural lighting.

- The hot water will come out of the heat recovered from the heat pump (external equipment). Equipment of highly efficient artificial conditioning that in addition to its properties will capture the heat emitted from the heat pump, making hot water. Therefor you consume 5 time less energy in heating the wather

- Horizontal ceilings radiation aims to outer space which is at a very low temperature, making a difference of 4 to 5 degrees lower than the temperature of the vertical surfaces. The system will store “cold” produced by night radiation in an inner deposit incorporated on the roof, there, we plan to incorporate Economic Phase Change Materials strategically distributed.

- Being closer to the Equator makes the sun insolation a big challenge, we need to get the best of it in terms of natural lighting and solar energy, but it is also important to shelter from direct sun insolation and high temperatures. That is why we created a rainfly over the roof of the house.

Moreover, the reuse of resources is part of this strategy, as the use of rainwater for hydroponics, using the hot air inside the house to heat the one outside when the house is purified of CO2 emissions by the enthalpic recuperator, the use of the water produced by the air conditioning in the washing machine, as well as the use of the heat produced by the heat pump to heat the water in the water heater instead of spending electrical energy to heat it. All these small tactics combined lead to the achievement of the overall strategy of “more for less”. The house not only produces more energy than it consumes, but it will also be efficient in the use of the energy, thus achieving huge savings over time.


OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Tanto si has colaborado con nuestro Proyecto y has conseguido tus recompensas como si no lo has podido hacer, apreciamos sumamente tu ayuda difundiendo el proyecto de la forma en la que se pueda!

Por consultas, sugerencias o críticas por favor escribir a lacasauruguaya@gmail.com o contáctenos por facebook!

Whether you have collaborated with the project and you have gain some reward or you couldn’t make it for some reason, we will still appreciate your help by getting the word out and making some noise about our campaign!

Please send questions, suggestions or critiques to lacasauruguaya@gmail.com or contact us through facebook!

THANK YOU!!!!!
story_txt:
NUESTRA GRAN HISTORIA - OUR AMAZING STORY

En 2015 tendrá lugar por primera vez el Solar
Decathlon para América Latina y el Caribe, la competencia de arquitectura
sostenible más grande del mundo. La esencia de esta edición es construir una
vivienda autosustentable, de interés social, que utilice tecnología de
vanguardia y sistemas innovadores a bajos costos.  
Soñamos con
la casa del futuro: inteligente, eficiente, adaptable, confortable y económica.  LA HEMOS CONSTRUÍDO PERO... ¡AÚN NOS FALTA DEMOSTRAR QUE ES LA MEJOR!
Nuestro equipo está conformado por un plantel
multidisciplinario de estudiantes y egresados de la Universidad ORT de Uruguay
de las Facultades de Arquitectura, Comunicación y Diseño, Ingeniería,
Administración y Ciencias Sociales. Hemos
estado trabajando en este proyecto sin fines de lucro por más de un año con
plena dedicación por la pasión que existe más allá del concurso. 
Con un increíble esfuerzo hemos hecho posible la construcción de la
casa que diseñamos, ahora necesitamos llegar a Cali, Colombia a exponer
nuestras ideas y para eso necesitamos tu ayuda!
Solar
Decathlon is the most important sustainable architecture competition of the
world and this is the first time that the contest is held in Latin America and
the Caribbean. The essence of this edition is to build an economic dwelling of
social interest, innovative, with sustainable technology incorporated 
WE dream with the house of the future: intelligent, efficient, adaptive, comfortable
and economic. WE HAVE BUILT IT BUT... WE NEED TO DEMONSTRATE THAT'S THE BEST!
Our team is
made up by a multidisciplinary group of students and professionals from several
Faculties such as: Architecture, Communication, Design, Engineering,
Administration and Social Sciences. We have
been working on this project for more than a year in a non profitable way, we
do it all for the passion towards the goal beyond the contest. 
We have
made possible, with an incredible effort, the construction of the house we
designed. Now we need to get to Cali and present our ideas, and for that we need your help! 
 

QUE NECESITAMOS - WHAT WE NEED 

Necesitamos USD 20.570 para terminar de financiar los gastos del proyecto! Estamos intentando alcanzar nuestra meta por distintos
medios por lo que cualquier tipo de aporte será totalmente gratificante y
significará estar un paso más cerca de nuestro sueño.
The USD 20.570 goal represents
the amount of money needed to finance the missing part of the project! We are fighting to achieve our goal through different ways, so any
thing you want to collaborate with we will feel totally honored and therefore we
will be one step closer to our dream. 
RECOMPENSAS - REWARDS

MENÚ LCU DE NUESTRA CHEF NANCY:
·  Previa 
o  Tabla de fiambres y quesos (Jamón crudo, jamón cocido, salame, bondiola, lomito canadiense, lomito ahumado, mortadela, quesos sándwich, parmesano, semiduro, aceitunas y  huevos de codorniz)
·  Entradas 
o  Tarta Quiche Lorraine
o  Tarta de Brócoli
·  Mesa Ensaladas
o  Lechuga
o  Tomate
o  Ensalada fantasía (repollo, jamón, choclo, y mayonesa)
o  Cebolla
o  Morrón asado
o  Rúcula
o  Chauchas
·  Plato Principal 
o  Pollo en salsa de champiñones, con guarnición de quinua encebollada
·  Postres 
o  Lemon Pie
o  Postre de Chocolate (Bizcochuelo relleno con crema de manteca, dulce de leche y cacao, bañado con chantillí de chocolate)Toda recompensa será entregada luego de que la campaña haya terminadoEvery reward will be handed after the campaign is closedTHE IMPACT – THE UTOPIAConsideramos que en la actualidad se asocia la arquitectura ecológica y sustentable con algo que es caro y por lo tanto, inaccesible para muchas personas. Este concurso demuestra que esto no es así. Los 16 prototipos que participarán del mismo costarían menos de USD 50.000 si los mismos se produjeran a gran escala, pensando en barrios y comunidades sustentables. Este no es un dato menor, ya que derribaría una barrera cultural que hoy en día está muy arraigada, no solo en Latinoamérica sino en el mundo entero. Así mismo, si contemplamos también los ahorros que producirían estas casas en cuanto al uso de energía y agua, se acentúa aún más el impacto positivo de las mismas en nuestro planeta.Vivimos en un mundo donde la energía es cada día más cara, donde muchos países no tienen acceso a agua potable y donde las personas con menos recursos deben consumir más energía de la que pueden pagar solo para subsistir, cuando en realidad debería ser a la inversa. Estos paradigmas deben corregirse si queremos que nuestros hijos y nietos vivan en un mundo mejor. Las personas y sobre todo los gobiernos deben tomar conciencia de que estas innovaciones no son utopías porque no se pueden alcanzar, son utopías porque son pocos quienes quieren invertir en las mismas.We believe that today the ecological and sustainable architecture is associated with something that is expensive and therefore unaffordable for many people. This competition shows that this is not so. Each of the 16 prototypes involving the contest cost less than USD 50,000 if  produced on a large scale, considering neighborhoods and sustainable communities. This is really important, since it would topple a cultural barrier that today is deeply rooted not only in Latin America but worldwide. Likewise, if we also consider the savings that would produce these houses on the use of energy and water, it would accentuate the positive impact of these sustainable houses on our planet.We live in a world where energy is more expensive every day, where many countries have no access to clean water and where people with fewer resources must consume more energy than they can afford only to survive, when it should be the other way around. People and especially governments should be aware that these innovations are not utopias that cannot be reached, these are utopias because only few people want to invest in them.MORE ABOUT OUR PROTOTYPE

story:
Hello! My name is Annie Rinaldi, and I have worked in public education in the United States for over 15 years. I currently work as the middle school principal at Mammoth Middle School in Mammoth Lakes, California. 

In November 2015, My friend, Domingo Atao Condori, and I would like to help three rural schools in these mountain communities to receive desperately needed school supplies and one of the schools, which is a middle school, would like a field trip to the city of Cusco. This would be the children’s first time in a city going to museums, and a restaurant. The goal is to raise $1000 for each school (the breakdown of costs is under Gallery). The schools are:

Escuela Primaria (Primary School) #50113, Chonta S/N, Chonta, Limatambo (Anta)

Educativa Incial #287, Ccasacunca, Ccasacunca (Anta)                                  

Institucion Educativa #50540, Sonoccomarka, Ccatca (Quispicanchi)

Hello! My name is Domingo Atao Condori. I am a co-owner of Ayni Peru Expedition. When I was 8 years old, I left my very small village in the mountains with my older brothers. The education was not very good there. I remember we had a teacher who spoke, only Spanish and I did not understand anything she said because my language was Quechua, the language of the Incas…my ancestors.

The village school had two desks made by stacked bricks and our seats were stools made with alpaca leather. There were shared pencils and paper but no notebooks, books or backpacks. There was no heating in the room and the chalkboard was old and ready to fall off the wall.

There was no electricity in the village. Therefore, we rushed to do the little homework we received or went to someone’s house who had candles. We never knew if we did the work correctly because of the language difference between the teacher and the students. But we kept going to school hoping to learn something.

By third grade, my older brothers and I left our small village in the back of a truck transporting potatoes to a city called Cusco, where there were opportunities for a better future, which was not easy. I worked and learned Spanish then in my teens I attended night school to learn English and get a certificate in tourism.  Currently, Ayni Peru Expedition helps one school near Cusco. But today with my friend, Annie Rinaldi, we are trying to expand the help and to support more schools and give more children more opportunities to thrive in the Andes. Please see the breakdown of costs under Gallery.

Thank you!

Annie Rinaldi and Domingo Atao Condori

Photo credits: Domingo Atao Condori, Ayni Peru Expedition

https://www.facebook.com/AyniPeruExpedition

https://www.facebook.com/domingo.ataocondori1

story:
Preparing Students for a Global Future

Jackson Elementary School is a Science, Technology, Engineering, and Math (STEM) Magnet located in Altadena, CA and serving children in grades pre-kindergarten through fifth.  We offer a Spanish Dual Language option in addition to mainstream English classes.  All of our students have access to our Community Pride garden where kids learn through exploration and discovery.

Our unique gardening program is made possible through the Garden School Foundation’s educational grant: “From Seed to Table.” The Garden School Foundation provides an instructor and curriculum incorporating lessons in many subjects, but in particular Life Science and Health. The program helps the school maintain our beautiful garden and uses it as an outdoor classroom where students learn important life and science skills through exploration, much like real researchers do. Children learn best by “doing,” and our garden program provides guided activities in an environment designed for optimum learning. 

While the Garden School Foundation grant provides the majority of the funds needed to maintain the program, we do need additional support to keep the garden growing.

What We Need 

We need to raise a total of $5,000 this year to keep our SEED TO TABLE program running.

We want to raise all of the $5,000 with this campaign!  

If we raise more than $5,000 it will be applied to the following year so please give generously.  

We are determined to keep our thriving garden program but we need your help!

What You Get

When you contribute to this year's campaign you will also be contributing to our garden butterfly mural.  Stay tuned as our mural comes to life outside our garden classroom. 

Jackson Community Pride Garden’s perks include:

  • $10- seed packet 
  • $25- seedling plus a flower for our mural 
  • $50- succulent arrangement and a butterfly for our mural
  • $100- garden tile to add to our tile mosaic and a caterpillar for our mural
  • $250- mini butterfly garden for a class planted in your name
Perks can be picked up at the school once the campaign is completed.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute financially, there are still many other ways to help!

  • Use the Indiegogo "Share Tools" to help get our campaign to as many people as possible!
  • Volunteer in our garden!
  • Volunteer in our tutoring programs!
  • Get the word out about the Jackson Elementary garden, science and dual-language programs!

We thank all of our donors, past, present, and future for helping our entire community "leap to success!"
story_txt:
Preparing Students for a Global FutureJackson Elementary School is a Science, Technology, Engineering, and Math (STEM) Magnet located in Altadena, CA and serving children in grades pre-kindergarten through fifth.  We offer a Spanish Dual Language option in addition to mainstream English classes.  All of our students have access to our Community Pride garden where kids learn through exploration and discovery.Our unique gardening program is made possible through the Garden School Foundation’s educational grant: “From Seed to Table.” The Garden School Foundation provides an instructor and curriculum incorporating lessons in many subjects, but in particular Life Science and Health. The program helps the school maintain our beautiful garden and uses it as an outdoor classroom where students learn important life and science skills through exploration, much like real researchers do. Children learn best by “doing,” and our garden program provides guided activities in an environment designed for optimum learning. While the Garden School Foundation grant provides the majority of the funds needed to maintain the program, we do need additional support to keep the garden growing.What We Need We need to raise a total of $5,000 this year to keep our SEED TO TABLE program running.We want to raise all of the $5,000 with this campaign!  If we raise more than $5,000 it will be applied to the following year so please give generously.  We are determined to keep our thriving garden program but we need your help!What You GetWhen you contribute to this year's campaign you will also be contributing to our garden butterfly mural.  Stay tuned as our mural comes to life outside our garden classroom. Jackson Community Pride Garden’s perks include:
$10- seed packet 
$25- seedling plus a flower for our mural 
$50- succulent arrangement and a butterfly for our mural
$100- garden tile to add to our tile mosaic and a caterpillar for our mural
$250- mini butterfly garden for a class planted in your name
Perks can be picked up at the school once the campaign is completed.Other Ways You Can HelpIf you cannot contribute financially, there are still many other ways to help!
Use the Indiegogo "Share Tools" to help get our campaign to as many people as possible!
Volunteer in our garden!
Volunteer in our tutoring programs!
Get the word out about the Jackson Elementary garden, science and dual-language programs!
We thank all of our donors, past, present, and future for helping our entire community "leap to success!"

story:
Establishment of a centre for language practice through role plays and other expressive techniques as an alternative to standard courses and methods for foreign language learning/teaching.

КАМПАНИЯТА НА БЪЛГАРСКИ ЕЗИК

Our approach aims to enhance the learning of foreign languages and the process of mastering language skills through the use of role plays and other expressive techniques. Fun and self-expression support the creation of relaxed and safe atmosphere where students can learn and practice foreign language without the concern of making mistakes. 

Who is behind the idea?

Stanislava Gateva, founder of Esmira.

I have experience in the field of language learning innovations and development of stimulating learning methods as an International Projects Manager. One of the projects I took part is ESEDI European Language Stage (financed by the European Commission, more info here) – a project aiming at mastering language skills through theatre. Here you could watch the video of the final play.

I have experience in psychodrama and promoting spontaneity through play. My passion is searching for new opportunities for learning and development.

I am keen on making difference on the way foreign languages are taught and learnt. I believe that languages can be mastered easily when students play and have fun.

What is your support for?

With your support will be established centre for language practice in Sofia, Bulgaria. The first practice classes will be in English for learners 16+.

With your contribution we intend to:

  • hire premises for the practice classes

  • train teachers how to use role plays, other expressive techniques and  group dynamics so classes are exciting and interesting

  • hire marketing/sales specialist and

  • spread the word about the centre to as much people as possible (on-line and face to face), etc.

for a period of 6 months.

Your contribution will help us offer:

  • diversity in the way foreign languages are taught/learnt and
  • a possibility for those who wish to communicate in a foreign language or do not recognise standard courses/methods as working for them.

Benefits for the language learners

  • Contextualized acquisition and development of communication skills in foreign language. Putting learners in situations resembling real life creates better grounds for mastering of foreign language (words, whole phrases and language structures).

  • Confidence to express thoughts in a foreign language. Confidence allows students to feel safe even in situations where they may not know a word or do not fully understand the interlocutor - they can explain words that they do not know or may ask clarifying questions.

  • Learning comes naturally and fun. Students may not even notice that they are in a foreign language class - an important prerequisite to reduce stress and increase motivation to learn a foreign language.

What is different about the method?

Language practice

Standard courses
  • We practice the language. We speak IN the language. In our classes teachers and students speak IN the target language.

  • Students are active inventing dialogues, situations, roles. They talk, play, sing, improvise.
  • Teachers support the learning process. They provide the structure of the classes and if necessary clarify meanings and language rules.
  • The acquisition of grammar and words comes naturally as in a real situation. Young children learn languages without knowing the rules and structures of the language. They learn led by their own needs and curiosity. Similarly we are aiming at the spontaneous learning we gain when we are in real language situation and engage simultaneously our minds, senses and feelings.
  • Students express themselves and work on topics that are interesting to them.
  • Standard courses rely heavily on language rules explanation. The oral communication in the target language is limited during classes.
  • Less practice, less role plays and less dialogues.
  • The teacher is the active side.
  • Students are passive, receptive, expect information from the teacher.
  • Memorization of rules and words is required.

What the classes look like?

The content of the classes is flexible and conformed to the language skills and interests of the students. Tasks are presented in more or less structured way on relevant for the students topics. During the language practice students work  out different situations. It is not important whether they make mistakes. It is important to talk, to communicate, to express thoughts and ideas. During the classes grammar rules and word meanings may be explained; examples for a situation, words and phrases may be given. The teacher assesses the complexity of the grammar and vocabulary to be given in each exercise.

Depending on the language and comfort level of the students the exercises will be more or less structured. For example:

Exercise “Casting”

Level 1
An actress/actor is on a film casting. S/he has to read text and play. Students rotate in the roles of the actor/actress and the members of the jury. It is up to the students what will be the content of the presentations and conversations during the exercise.

Level 2

Teacher provides students with:

- magazines and books so they can pick a text to reproduce for the casting and

- main characteristics of the members of the jury, for example:

Jury member 1 is angry, just soiled his/her shirt with coffee, s/he does not follow the actor/actresses presentation.
Jury member 2 is eccentric, s/he requests from the actor/actress to read and play more expressively, even extravagantly.
Jury member 3 is balanced and supportive.

Level 3
Teacher provides text for the actor/actress to read and cues for the jury members.

Example

Actor/actress: “It's still two human beings trying to get along, so it's going to be complicated. And love is always complicated. But humans must try to love each other, darling. We must get our hearts broken sometimes. This is a good sign, having a broken heart. It means we have tried for something.” (author Elizabeth Gilbert, “Eat, Pray, Love: One Woman's Search for Everything Across Italy, India and Indonesia”, Penguin Books, 2007)

Jury member 1 (mutter to him/herself): Ugh! I have coffee on my shirt. That is embarrassing. I have to clean it. Ugh, let’s check if I have wet towel in my bag. (to the actor/actress) Please, repeat again. I was kind of distracted.

Jury member 2 (excitedly, almost shouting): But please read more expressively! You could cry when you say the second sentence and cackle after every comma. This way you will grab the attention of the audience!

Jury member 3 (cheerfully): Thank you for your performance. It was great! Could  you tell me where you come from, what is your background and what do you do now?…We will contact you about the results of the casting.

Explanations and feedback

During the exercise the teacher explains when necessary unfamiliar words, phrases and grammar. Students are encouraged to improvise.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share information about our campaign with your friends, family and colleagues.

Please use the Indiegogo share tools.

What is next?

We are planning on a later stage (with a new campaign) introduction of:

  • classes in English for children with the means of storytelling,
  • classes in French, German, Spanish.

story:
Who are we?

Hi everyone!

Buraq Planetary Society started out in 1993 as a CSR project of the Interactive Group, a turnkey  IT solutions firm based in Pakistan. Since 1993 Buraq Planetary Society has been committed to giving back to aspiring children of the community to instill in them the courage of dreaming beyond borders. 

Buraq Space Camps

A small team of social entrepreneurs decided to launch a project with the objective of gathering young, aspiring Pakistani students onto a single platform and instill into them a sense of patriotism, national unity, empowerment, social responsibility & creative thinking. This lead to the inception of Buraq Space Camps. Consequently, in 1994, Buraq held its first Pakistani Space Camp in Murree and has held a total of 11 camps since then.

Every year a total of 40 talented kids are shortlisted from amongst a pool of thousands of applicants for the Camp. This year, as we set out for yet another Space Camp, we want your help to expand our reach to a point where we won't have to go through the pain of taking away from an aspiring kid the chance to be a part of this life-changing 10 day experience.

What We Need 

The image below represents all the costs that are incurred in building the experience of the Buraq Space Camp and how you will be helping us by contributing. 


What we offer to our contributors?

In addition to the satisfaction of being able to contribute to the nurturing of a young mind, our contributors also enjoy a range of carefully designed perks that are sure to incite interest for all who like the concept of space and technology.

The Impact

For 21 years Buraq Planetary society has been giving children of Pakistan the courage to dream of a brighter and bigger future. Our efforts are reflected in the success stories of our alumni who have time and again emerged as social leaders, entrepreneurs and motivated professionals not only in Pakistan but across the globe as well.

Find our outreach and legacy in the image below.

     


Can't donate using a credit card?

Some of our donors would prefer transferring donations directly to our account. If you are one of them, contact us on buraqsociety@gmail.com.

Your contribution will help us continue our mission to paint a better future for all. After all, the way our future will look like depends on how we support our young.

story:
WHAT IS INDIGIFUND?

IndigiFund is a specialized crowdfunding platform (the term "crowdfunding" means the practice of funding a project or venture by raising many small amounts of donations on the Internet from a large number of people in exchange for tangible, non-monetary or the finished product itself (in this case, "IndigiFund").

                                       


HOW DOES INDIGIFUND WORK?


A member who contributes funds to a project is referred to as a contribution-holder (a hybrid of a contributor and shareholder). Contribution-holders may choose to fund projects locally, by region, or choose to launch their own project. Any project introduced through IndigiFund will be funded initially, then funds are dispersed in phases to verify work has been completed efficiently and within schedule.


WHY IS INDIGIFUND ANY DIFFERENT FROM THE OTHER CROWDFUNDING PLATFORMS ONLINE?

Unlike other crowdfunding projects like Kickstarter.com, Indiegogo.com, GoFundMe.com, or even Fundable.com, IndigiFund releases incremental funding versus releasing 100% of the funds at once to ensure project is completed efficiently. IndigiFund also gives transparency and control to the contribution-holders by itemizing the budget line by line where funds are dispersed and a breakdown by percentage to view how funds are dispersed at all times.



WHO WILL BE A PART OF INDIGIFUND?

According to a recent study by the Nielsen Company, "black" people make up 13-percent (43 million+) of the U.S. population, with a median age of 32 and 47 percent which are under 35 years of age, has reached $1.1 trillion in collective buying power by 2015 (increasing to about $1.3 trillion by 2017), making us “more relevant than ever” as a consumer block. If "black" Americans were a country today, we’d be the 16th largest country in the world!


However, out of all "black" people spend in this country with black owned businesses, only seven-percent (7%) of small business are owned by "black". Additionally, the lack of access to capital, clientele, and other resources, hinder many "black" from starting business, despite our long history of entrepreneurship.

To add insult to injury, while a dollar circulates in Asian communities for a month, in Jewish communities approximately 20 days and white communities 17 days, the dollar only circulate in the black community for 6 hours with only 2 cents of every dollar!

***Imagine if we rerouted just 5% of $1.1 Trillion (that's over $50 Billion annually) what we could build if organized. This is why they integrated us!***

So who are the aborignal indigenous? They are the ones who are called "black" , native american, and even "African-American".

United Nations Declaration on the Rights of Indigenous Peoples

President Obama endorses rights of indigenous peoples in the U.S.


WHERE WILL INDIGIFUND FUND PROJECTS?

Initially, IndigiFund will fund in North America only.  



WHEN WILL INDIGIFUND BECOME OPERABLE?

This is why we need all of you! Once the platform is complete we can then begin building our communities stronger again! 

We do ask that you seek within to ask yourself how much is an opportunity like this worth?

When was the last time you had the ability to collectively channel your funds to one platform to build what you've always dreamed of seeing come to fruition for your people?

Now let's build!
