story:
Hello, and welcome to 'Mino's Dream'!

We are actors Alex Sharp and Francesca Faridany, from the TONY award winning production of The Curious Incident of the Dog in the Night-time on Broadway. The play that has made millions of people aware, worldwide, of the challenges facing those on the Autism Spectrum and their families.

We are raising funds for a rock star special-ed teacher we know (and love) in Newark, NJ. Her name is Janet Mino and her dream is to create a center where young adults on the spectrum can continue their growth and education after high school. She has named it The Valentine Center: The Center with a Heart.

By donating today you will be providing vital funds to get the Valentine Center up and running. So that Mino can fling wide the doors and get down to the business of continuing to do what she does best: the advocacy, nuture, engagement, and education of young people challenged by Autism and other developmental disorders.

Her work is documented in the Peabody award winning film Best Kept Secret.

Click below to see her in action:

Best Kept Secret - Documentary preview


The Valentine Center’s mission is solidly focused on addressing one of the most compelling public health issues facing this country today.

                                                                                                                                                                                 

Why should we be concerned?

Autism affects us ALL.  The U.S. Department of Health and Human Services has declared that the increasing number of children being diagnosed with Autism has created a National Health emergency. 1 in 68 children in the U.S. has been diagnosed.

In New Jersey, that rate is 1 in 45, the highest in the nation.

In Newark, 2 in 5 kids live below the national poverty line.

For young adults with Autism, especially those who live in our inner cities, graduation from public school often starts a frightening and rapid deterioration of opportunity and quality of life. For many of these students, after graduation, there is nowhere for them to go.

What is meant by “aging out”?

While they are in public school, children with Autism have an Individual Education Plan (IEP) that sets individual goals and objectives and specifies the services they will receive.

At age 21, the public school system’s responsibility for providing services ends – young adults “age out” of the public school system and services - and the nightmare for graduating students and their families begins.

This is particularly true for those who do not have the resources to pay for services without assistance.

Despite the availability of some government funding, the programs and services currently available fall far short of meeting the needs of adults with Autism.

Heart of the Community

What is unique about Mino's Dream is that the Center will be located right in the heart of Newark. Beyond the ease of accessibility this enables, she will be providing us all with a vital opportunity to develop a better understanding and appreciation of each other.  So that we might all become aware of the challenges and opportunities of life lived on the Spectrum.

Please help us make Mino's Dream a reality. Your generosity is vital and will be so appreciated. No amount is too small, truly!

                       WE CAN BUILD A BETTER FUTURE - TOGETHER


What your money will do

The money you donate will be used to purchase furniture, equipment, computers and assistive technology. All of which will be used to a create a welcoming, stimulating environment in which these young adults can thrive.

"My dream is to give young adults with autism a place where they can continue learning and growing, a place where they feel safe and where they will be treated with respect." Janet Mino.


Other Ways You Can Help

There are other ways to participate and get involved beyond donating money. We realize not everyone is able to make a financial donation.

Sharing information about Mino's Dream is a vital component in our fund-raising. Please forward this link far and wide (using Indiegogo's handy-dandy share tools!). You never know whose life will be changed for the better by this simple action.

The Center will need volunteers, too! Visit the center's site to learn more about getting involved in person:

The Valentine Center

Interested in corporate giving?

The Community Foundation of New Jersey is proud to manage the
Valentine Center Fund and to host the organization’s business planning and pre-development stage activities.

The Community Foundation is interested in bringing together private sector supporters—foundations, corporations and individuals—to advance the Valentine Center’s mission and to bring desperately needed hope to individuals and families throughout Essex County.

You can make a difference. We would like the opportunity to tell you how.

Please contact:

Community Foundation of New Jersey

Hans Dekker, Executive Director

hdekker@cfnj.org

973-267-5533


THANK YOU!

from the bottom of our hearts

Alex and Francesca

this country today.
                                                                                                                                                                                  



Why should we be concerned?

Autism affects us ALL.  The U.S. Department of Health and Human Services has declared that the increasing number of children being diagnosed with Autism has created a National Health emergency. 1 in 68 children in the U.S. has been diagnosed. 






In New Jersey, that rate is 1 in 45, the highest in the nation. 
In Newark, 2 in 5 kids live below the national poverty line.


	
For young adults with Autism,
especially those who live in our
inner cities, graduation from
public school often starts a
frightening and rapid
deterioration of opportunity and
quality of life.
For many of these students, after graduation, there is nowhere for
them to go. 





What is meant by “aging out”?

While they are in public school, children with Autism have an Individual
Education Plan (IEP) that sets individual goals and objectives and
specifies the services they will receive.

At age 21, the public school system’s responsibility for providing services
ends – young adults “age out” of the public school system and services -
and the nightmare for graduating students and their families begins.

This is particularly true for those who do not have the resources to
pay for services without assistance.










Despite the availability of some government funding, the programs and
services currently available fall far short of meeting the needs of adults
with Autism. 

Heart of the Community



	
What is unique about Mino's Dream is that the Center will be 
located right in the heart of Newark. Beyond the ease of 
accessibility this enables, she will be providing us all with a vital 
opportunity to develop a better understanding and appreciation of each 
other.  So that we might all become aware of the challenges and opportunities of life lived on the Spectrum.Please help us make Mino's Dream a reality. Your generosity is vital and will be so appreciated. No amount is too small, truly!                       WE CAN BUILD A BETTER FUTURE - TOGETHER







What your money will do

The money you donate will be used to purchase furniture, equipment, 
computers and assistive technology. All of which will be used to a create a welcoming, stimulating 
environment in which these young adults can thrive.
"My
 dream is to give young adults with autism a place where they can 
continue learning and growing, a place where they feel safe and where 
they will be treated with respect." Janet Mino.


Other Ways You Can Help
There are other ways to participate and get involved beyond donating money. We realize not everyone is able to make a financial donation. 
Sharing information about Mino's Dream is a vital component in our fund-raising. Please forward this link far and wide (using Indiegogo's handy-dandy share tools!). You never know whose life will be changed for the better by this simple action.
The Center will need volunteers, too! Visit the center's site to learn more about getting involved in person:
The Valentine Center







Interested in corporate giving?

The Community Foundation of New Jersey is proud to manage the
Valentine Center Fund and to host the organization’s business planning and
pre-development stage activities. 
The Community Foundation is interested in bringing together private sector
supporters—foundations, corporations and individuals—to advance the
Valentine Center’s mission and to bring desperately needed hope to
individuals and families throughout Essex County.

You can make a difference. We would like the opportunity to tell you how. 







Please contact:

Community Foundation of
New Jersey
Hans Dekker,
Executive Director 
hdekker@cfnj.org 
973-267-5533 


THANK YOU!
from the bottom of our hearts
Alex and Francesca

story:
For you that you've always wanted to help a Kid!  ¡THIS IS YOUR CHANCE! They are real kids with real histories! It's very easy, you can make your contribution from $5 and up.

THIS IS YOUR CHANCE TO HELP A KIDS! Join this great initiative of the Foundation Angiopediatría and your contribution will help us to achieve the goal of $ 20,000, to be used to finance 100% inelastic supports that these children require for a year!

We invite you to see the video (at the top) of the campaing so that you can know in detail  what are inelastic supports? What are these diseases? Why do help you children?

Like and share this campaing on facebook, on twitter, on instagram, In this way help us that more people know about our campaign and we achieve the goal. Go! Like! Share! To Repost! Retweet!

Facebook. Fundación Angiopediatria

Twitter. @angiopediacol

Instagram. @angiopediacol

*Para ti que siempre has querido ayudar un niño ¡ESTA ES TU OPORTUNIDAD! Son niños reales con historias reales. Es muy fácil, puedes hacer tu contribución desde $5 dólares en adelante.

¡ESTA ES TU OPORTUNIDAD DE AYUDAR A UN NIÑO! Te invitamos a que te unas a esta gran iniciativa de la Fundación Angiopediatria y con tu aporte nos ayudes a lograr la meta de $20.000 usd, que serán destinados 100% los soportes inelasticos que requieren estos niños durante un año.

 Te invitamos a ver el video (en la parte superior) de la campaña para que puedas conocer al detalle, ¿Qué son los soportes Inelasticos? ¿Qué son estas enfermedades? ¿porqué ayudar a los niños?*

 

Did you know that there are more than 6.000 orphan diseases in the world?

That’s the name, they’re diseases with a low prevalence of the world population.

This are very rare diseases; it is estimated to affect one out of every 5.000 newborn or even less

In Angiopediatria team we've focused in this types of diseases that affects children. This particular disease, occurs on different components of the bloodstream can affect the arteries, veins or lymphatic vessels. It can be in varying degrees since the birth of these children. Affects the lymph vessels, therefore the lymph can no longer circulate into the bloodstream and accumulates in a tissue, occupying the space between muscles and skin. If is not removed it builds up and the body parts overgrows.

If you want to kwow more about the clinical cases, enter to our website http://www.angiopediatria.com.co/index.php/campana-social?id=57

story:
Why Support the Sixth Revival of the Nemean Games June 10-12, 2016? 

"It is our belief that the modern Olympic Games, despite their obvious success in many respects, have become increasingly removed from the average person. Our goal is the participation, on the sacred ancient earth of Greece, of anyone and everyone, in games that will revive the spirit of the Olympics. We will achieve this by reliving authentic ancient athletic customs in the ancient stadium of Nemea."                                                                                                              - Statement of Purpose of the Society for the Revival of the Nemean Games

The Sixth Nemead is your chance to support and relive the ancient games. Come join us in Nemea on June 10-12, 2016. The Games are open to everyone and participation is free of charge.  In 2012, over 1000 people from 87 countries came and ran on the ancient track and in the 7.5 kilometer race "In the footsteps of Heracles." The Nemean Games are as authentically ancient as they can be. Don your chiton in the apodyterion, walk through the ancient tunnel to the 4th century B.C., step on the track, and feel Ancient Greece through the soles of your bare feet.

The Society for the Revival of the Nemean Games is a movement born from nearly 40 years of excavation by the University of California at Berkeley in the Pan-Hellenic Sanctuary of Zeus at Nemea, Greece and from the enthusiasm and dedication of local residents of Nemea who feel that they could make an important contribution to today's world because of their personal ties to this remarkable ancient site.

Your support not only preserves history, it provides an opportunity for you to experience history. 

Why we believe in this campaign

We are a team of five from Toronto, Canada, California, U.S., and Greece.

We are supporting the Nemean Games because they have an international impact in experiencing our common humanity. We want to ensure that the Games continue to bring the "ancient" experience to participants from all over the world . To put on the Games successfully, the Society needs to raise $75,000. Like the ancient games, there are no corporate sponsors. We need your help to reach our goal.



How Money is going to be spent

The budget includes many items in several categories, each critical to the successful execution of the Games. 

Communications includes: telephone, mailings, postage                                                     Supplies includes: office and mailing supplies, T-shirts, awards                                       Materials includes: Advertising, trumpets, "ancient" chitons and discuses, new country flags, posters, drinking water for participants. feet wash basins           Services includes: preparing the stadium, office assistance, cleaning seating for audience, bus transportation, portable toilets.                                                                         Fund raising includes: crowd funding costs.

The funds raised will go to: 

The Society for the Revival of the Nemean Games                                                           Post Office Box 2016 Nemea,                                                                                                     Greece GR – 205 00

Telephone and FAX: (30) 27460-24125                                         

email: info@nemeangames.org

For more information and/or to become a member of the Society, please visit the Society for the Revival of the Nemean Games website: www.nemeangames.org/

story:
Necesitamos aumentar el impacto

No obstante, la naturaleza digital de la plataforma limitó este propósito ya que la mayoría de las víctimas viven en región y no tienen acceso a internet. Es por esto que nace un segundo proyecto llamado ‘Yo sobreviví al conflicto’, el cual, busca acercar Rutas del Conflicto a las víctimas y de esta forma lograr una reconstrucción conjunta de estos hechos y darles voz a través de un ejercicio de memoria histórica. 

Buscamos acercar esta plataforma digital a las regiones de Colombia para alcanzar una mayor participación de las víctimas de las comunidades rurales. Vamos a crear una forma para que las comunidades construyan la historia de la guerra con herramientas periodísticas, desde su realidad, desde su creatividad, desde su visión de los hechos.

Para lograrlo necesitamos financiar viajes hacia tres regiones de Colombia: Antioquia, Cauca y Santander, además de recursos humanos y tecnológicos para dictar cursos básicos de periodismo que le den a estos nuevos participantes herramientas para narrar sus propias historias.

Con tu ayuda podremos mejorar la información de Rutas del Conflicto y seguir produciendo contenidos que contribuyan a completar la memoria del conflicto en Colombia.

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

  • Si no puedes donar, ayúdanos con tu red de contactos para contarle al mundo de nuestra campaña, el proyecto y de lo que queremos hacer por nuestro país.

  • Visita nuestra página y suscríbete al boletín para mantenerte informado.

  • Síguenos en Facebook, Twitter y nuestra cuenta de Instagram y si quieres compartir esta campaña puedes mencionar a @RutasConflicto.

Acerca de:

¿Quién sabe de la guerra en Colombia? ¿Los ciudadanos, la justicia, los medios de comunicación o los grupos armados? La realidad es que la información está dispersa y es inexacta. Por eso creamos el proyecto Rutas del Conflicto, el primer portal web que reúne toda esta información a partir de una base de datos periodística con información del conflicto en Colombia.

Esta plataforma permite visualizar los datos a través de mapas y líneas de tiempo que explican el contexto histórico y geográfico de la guerra. Víctimas, investigadores académicos y periodistas pueden aportar información para seguir construyendo la base de datos. Desde su lanzamiento en 2014 más de tres mil personas descargaron la aplicación para móviles y el sitio web ha tenido  alrededor de 250 mil visitas.

Rutas del Conflicto surgió de la necesidad de visibilizar los hechos del conflicto armado colombiano que no habían sido narrados ni resaltados por los medios de comunicación y el mismo Estado, convirtiéndose en la primera base de datos periodística con información visualizada y de contexto.


Para más información

Rutas del Conflicto se ha construído de la mano del portal periodístico VerdadAbierta.com, el Centro Nacional de Memoria Histórica y ConLupa.co,  documentando 728 masacres perpetradas entre 1982 hasta la fecha. Somos un proyecto que busca ser una fuente de consulta para centros de enseñanza, investigadores, medios de comunicación, organizaciones de víctimas y ciudadanos del común.

¿Tienes preguntas? Contáctanos al correo rutasdelconflicto@gmail.com y estaremos pendientes de contestarte.

¡Gracias por apoyarnos!

                 

                                                                         

Lo que han dicho los medios sobre Rutas del Conflicto:

                                                                BBC Mundo:

                                

                                                        El País de España:

                                

                                                              El Espectador:

                                   

                                                                   El Tiempo:

                                    



ENGLISH

Join the 'I survived the internal conflict' project

We need to increase the impact

This project was created with the purpose of sharing information about violence perpetrated by different actors of the conflict, and making it readily available for victims and other citizens as well. However, the digital nature of the platform limited this purpose because most of victims live in the countryside and don't have access to Internet.

That's why a second project was born: “Yo sobreviví al conflicto” ('I survived the internal conflict'), which links Rutas del Conflicto to victims and, in this way, allows the victims to express themselves by rebuilding the experiences they lived through a historical memory exercise.

A part of the story is still untold. That's why, with the second stage of 'I survived the internal conflict', we want to nourish our database with tales that come directly from the voice of the victims. The project consists of a platform for the communities to construct their own war memories with journalistic tools, built from their reality and their version of facts.

We seek to bring this digital platform to regions of Colombia and achieve greater participation of victims in rural communities.

To achieve that goal, we need to fund travels to three regions of Colombia: Antioquia (Northwest of Colombia), Cauca (Southwest of Colombia) and Santander (North of Colombia). Also, we need human and technological resources to teach rural population how to tell their own stories with journalistic tools.

With your help we can improve Routes of Conflict to keep producing media content that contributes the production of memory work about Colombia's internal conflict.

Other ways you can help: spread the voice!

  • If you can't donate, help us by telling the world about our campaign, the project and what we do for our country.

  • Visit our website and subscribe to our newsletter to keep informed.

  • Follow us on Facebook, Twitter and our Instagram account and if you want to share this campaign, you  can use the @RutasConflicto tag.

About:

Who knows about the war in Colombia ? Citizens? Justice organs? Media? Armed groups? To this date, information on this topic is scattered and inaccurate. This is why we created the project "Rutas del Conflicto" (Routes of Conflict) , the first web page that gathers information about Colombia's internal conflict as a database with journalistic material.

Rutas del Conflicto (Routes of Conflict) is the first journalist database with info about Colombia internal conflict. Through maps and timelines that explain and help visualize the historical and geographical context of war, this platform reveals facts previously untold by mass media and the Colombian state itself; invisible facts that need to be let out in the open. Victims, academics, researchers and journalists alike can supply information to keep building this database.

Rutas del Conflicto appeared from the need to tell invisible facts from Colombian internal conflict. Facts untold by mass media or the Colombian state itself. Thus, the project becomes the first journalist database with displayed visualizations and information about the context.


Thanks for your support!

story:
Isis executes Palmyra antiquities chief and hangs him from ruins he spent a lifetime restoring



It was sadly reported today in the press that  Isis militants have tortured and executed the antiquities chief of the ancient city of Palmyra, 81-year-old Khaled al-Assad.

The head of Syria's department of antiquities said that militants later took Mr Asaad's body from the square where he was executed and hung it from a Roman column in one of the ruins he had dedicated more than 50 years of his life to restoring.

They tortured him for a month to get information about the city and its treasures.

He refused to tell them anything.

Source: http://ind.pn/1TTcqIn
Held for a month a tortured by barbarians this heroic man gave no quarter and died safeguarding humanity's history, his life's work and irreplaceable artefacts that belong to the whole of humanity. 


My Name is Jay Burnett, I'm not an expert on archaeological studies, nor a student of the field myself but what I am is a human with utter admiration for a man who would die defending humanity's heritage, these ruins and antiquities he spent his life restoring tell a part of our collective story and it saddened me greatly to hear of his passing in such a fashion at the hands of misguided and (for want of a better word) evil men determined to drag the region back centuries and destroy monuments that have stood for thousands of years, to allay my feelings of impotence and despair at the way the world is going and to salvage some good from this heartbreaking story I propose that we raise enough to fund the studies of a student in the field of Archaeology is his memory to continue the noble work that was this brave man's passion and to commemorate this hero's passing. 

His valiant efforts in the face of overwhelming cruelty should never be forgotten and if some good can come of this I feel this would act as a fitting memorial.  

If you agree please donate what you can and I will pass on all funds raised through appropriate channels to see that a student out there interested in this field has their studies funded in his memory.

 For more: http://huff.to/1J3wwaJ

This campaign has been sanctioned by Directorate-General of Antiquities & Museums, Syria.

For more: http://on.fb.me/1MSaqMj


We need to raise £25,000 to fund a students studies in this field to act as a fitting memorial to this man's heroic sacrifice. 


  • The money raised from this campaign will be donated to  Aliyah Hasinah Holder
    who is aiming to raise £18,000 to study a BA in History & International Relations at Royal Holloway! The minimum amount I must raise is £4,500 by September in order to enroll! 

    She's also pushing for more representation of ethnic minority groups through art such as film and writing. She wants to study at University in order to learn and bring attention to so called alternative histories, I'll dig deep into history in return for you digging deep or shallowly into your generous pockets!

    You can find out more about  Aliyah here: https://hubbub.net/p/fundAlyBA

The Impact

We live in a world where some seek to hold back education and enlightenment and take us back to a dark age where war lords use quasi-religious justifications to do the worst deeds imaginable, leaving misery and destruction in their wake, I for one feel unable to stop the tide of cruelty that I see many drowning in however I think that collectively we can make a difference and that this man's death should be a catalyst for ensuring that a student out there passionate about this field should be funded to continue in Khaled al-Assad's vein protecting humanity's collective history and preserving it for posterity to enlighten us all.

I'm just one guy and can't fund such studies by myself so I am reaching out to you all, other's who I have seen comment and commiserate and lament his passing to chip in and do what you can to salvage some good from this dreadful situation, to lift the spirits of those who like me all to often feel powerless in the face of such things to do anything other than lament the passing of a good man from a sometimes too cruel world and to help a student out there start on a journey that may see them follow in his footsteps into a noble career spanning a lifetime and to in that small way feel my own soul less burdened by the grief I felt at hearing of his passing in such a horrendous way. 

He died saving something for all of us, I honestly feel the least we can do as a global community is to show our appreciation for the ultimate sacrifice he made and to do some good in his name. We cannot bring him back but we can collectively commemorate his bravery and enable someone else to continue his work. 

Risks & Challenges

I have never done a crowd funder before nor sponsored a students studies however I am a good man and work promoting businesses on Facebook and have achieved some modest successes with certain communities I've built that have reached over 1 million likes in my time which I will happily be promoting this on until such time as it reaches it's goal or becomes apparent that it sadly won't in which case as previously stated the monies raised will still do much good by assisting those in dire need in the region.

I welcome any assistance or advice from anyone who does have experience in crowd funding or the educational/archaeological fields to see how best to allocate the monies raised to achieve the stated goals and will be reaching out to local universities in the next couple of days to see how this can be facilitated and processed and to do good .

I'm tenacious and if this, as I hope, does raise enough money to fund a student I will work diligently in conjunction with some members of my family, my trusted elders, with experience in the field of eduction to see the money is well spent and be transparent in how in any event the monies raised are allocated to assure you that some good will come of this man's sad demise one way or another. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not in a position to donate but would like to assist this effort then please share this page, tweet and email your friends and promote on social media and in public forums, the press, anywhere as you see fit. It really does make a massive difference. 

Please use the Indiegogo share tools and your own initiative to help people hear about this cause if you were moved as I was by Khaled al-Assad's courage in his final days! Men like this don't come along often and should be honoured when they pass. He was a bona fide hero. Let's not lament his passing but applaud and show gratitude and appreciation for his life and his life's work. 

More about me: 

I run: www.facebook.com/chocolates where I'll be promoting this 

I support uk businesses here: https://www.facebook.com/groups/uksmallbusiness...

And I always open the door for ladies and I am a nice guy. My mother say's so so it must be true.  :)

If you would like to know anything more about me please feel free to contact me on Facebook at: http://on.fb.me/1LjailV  or via my email address: jayburnette79@gmail.com

story:
A Unique German-Bavarian Restaurant

Traditional Bavarian culture meets modern American lifestyle

Project:

My goal is to start a restaurant business at ten different places in the USA, situated at high traffic locations. These restaurants will be in a German/Bavarian style. It is my intention that this will be the first and only drive-in in this style anywhere in the world.

We have worked relentlessly and have designed a tri-modular concept that has not been seen before that includes a restaurant with a bakery, a butcher shop as well as a drive-in, all combined under one roof.

Many full-time jobs will be created with our new tri-modular restaurant business model. Thus the money you invest will help to create sustainable income for over 200 workers.

At 3 separate drive-in counters with large shop windows, the customer will be able to watch the production of fresh baked breads,  meat products according to original German, Bavarian and Austrian recipes and purchase single products or pick them up as a finished menu.

In addition, the two indoor levels and two outdoor terraces will offer the possibility of eating locally for up to 300 guests. Coupled with a hearty German hospitality, the quaint premises, in stylistic reference to the Munich Oktoberfest, will be styled to always offer an invitation to relax.

The facilities will also offer event character through the implementation of family and company parties, department, club, and corporate events, as well as special theme days: Dance around the Maypole, Oktoberfest, Thanksgiving as well as many others.

The on-site merchandising shop will provide the typical souvenirs, from key chains to pitchers, dirndl, cuckoo clocks and everything the heart desires.

The Concept

The result would be a drive-in restaurant with strong Bavarian character. The architecture would be reminiscent of a typical Alpine mountain farm. It would showcase massive woodwork in the indoor and outdoor areas, balconies in the inner and outer part of the facility, and terraces in a beer garden style.

The furnishings in rustic solid wood trim can withstand the highest frequency of guests even when they dance to Bavarian brass music on tables and benches in a relaxed mood.

The combined drive-in stations would first present:

The Bakery:

Fresh rolls, pretzels, traditional German brown and black bread, cakes, pies and the like will be produced in the open kitchen for all to see, according to original recipes and production methods, and offered for sale fresh out of the oven.

The Butcher Shop:

Also according to original recipe, the master butcher prepares everything from Bavarian white sausages to meatloaf and meatballs, fried chicken, roasted pork leg, schnitzel and bratwurst, Nürnberger sausage with sauerkraut or pork roast with red cabbage. Seasonal dishes like kale and smoked sausage, groats or various stews individually round out the offer.



I believe that by using this crowd funding platform, we can raise the necessary funds to move this from the drawing board to actual implementation. We are actively in the process of locating the premises for this undertaking and we could certainly benefit from your generosity.

We know you cannot spend as much as we need but with enough money, we can finance the cost of an IPO. Remember the story of Shake Shack earlier this year? They generated 25 million dollars for one restaurant. We only need 3-4 million per restaurant.

Please click on the donate button if you can contribute to this project that brings the Old World to the New World.

If you donate $75, we will add your name to a plate and you will receive 10 x 10% Off Coupons, and if you donate $200, we will immortalize your name on a plate all to yourself and you will receive 10 x 10% Off Coupons for meals at the restaurant as sign of your generosity to help others.

Thank you in advance for your generosity.

Marque Bilek

story:
Campaign Update!!! 

When you help me, you help thousands of families in need, because Business Coach and Trainer Dani Johnson, has decided not to make money on any of her seminars, and transfer 100% of the profit to her King's Ransom Foundation.

"Over 150,000 children are trafficked world wide in the sex trade every single year. With the help of our organizations we are able to rescue these children and provide a safe home so they can discover the healing that comes through Christ."

                                                                                                                                                                                      -King's Ransom

 See what others have to say about  First Steps To Success

I have personally read Spirit Driven Success in October of 2014, and within 7 months, I was out of debt of over $3,000 on $11.50/hour.

If this is as far as I can get just by reading a book, I am excited to see what will happen when I plug in. I just dream about the amount of people I can help get out of the rut.

"If there is one person I would choose for an award of excellence in dance, it would be Sasha Blessed Farquharson. They say that "preparation meets opportunity". I believe Sasha has prepared, and is ready for the next dimension which is to instruct others. She has a plethora of knowledge, style and techniques to share with the world. I endorse Sasha as an instructor because with her Passion and Gift she will INSPIRE you!"

-Steve Kerr

Life Coach Specialist 

As Warren Buffet once said "If you tell me who your heroes are, I can tell you how you're going to turn out, It's really important to have the right heroes." 

 

"I first saw Sasha dancing at an event that was organized as a tribute to the phenomenal woman Maya Angelou upon her passing. I have been very involved in the ethnic dances and all cultural aspects of it from an anthropological prospect; however when I witnessed Sasha dancing, it was magical experience.

Sasha dances like a wave from the ocean. She soaks you in her charisma of moves while dancing. Sasha’s Dance is much more than just a dance. It is spirituality personified in her moves. It’s different! I’m proud to call her my soul sister.

- Loveen Kaur Gill (Philanthropist, Poet & Motivational Speaker, Founder of Amar Karma Organ Donation Charity)

 Thank you so much in advance, I appreciate every hard earned dollar you contribute and I know many lives like those of King's Ransom will pass on what you have contributed. 

The King richly bless you for being a blessing to me :)

 

 Visit Dani's website for  Your Free Book today!

story:
Campaign Page : https://www.facebook.com/SaveIndianFarmersYesYouCan

Its time to show our Care for those who feed the nations across the globe

The initiative will help the farmers in 3 critical areas

  1. Help the farmers in need with basic necessities for them and family.
  2. Help them to adopt sustainable organic farming methods and techniques.
  3. Help them to market their Organic farm products and Safe food for our consumption through online and retails outlets in urban and rural areas.

We collaborate and work with Centre for Sustainable Agriculture  http://csa-india.org/ in helping this cause to make it a reality .

Help us make a difference in the lives of Indian farmers.

Request you to come forward and donate money to Save our Farmers. We will not have our food in plate if we fail to save our Farmers.

You can donate using one of the options below

  • Donation (India - 80(G) Tax exemption)

Please send me a message with Name, email id and Amount donated for our records.

http://csa-india.org/donate/

  • Donation ( NRIs/Abroad / Foreign nationals)
http://igg.me/at/SaveIndianFarmersfromsuicide/x/11179335

You can make a difference to help us lay the foundation stone for organic Farming and Fair Farming Practice. Every rupee and dollar you donate will go to address these issues and brings a back safe food in our plates and for our younger generation. Yes You Can! Save a Farmer Today.
Every change starts with you deciding to make the change. Start small but do your bit.

Save our Farmers from Suicide. Yes you can to do it .

Thank you , Farmer Champion

Dinesh Chandrasekar DC*

story:
Short Summary

"Education is a woman's fastest route out of Poverty."
-- Barbara Lucas, US Board Chair, WomensTrust 
This campaign is for our education program.  Our simple aim: to get and keep Ghanaian girls in school. 70% percent of girls drop out of high school in Ghana.  In our program, 95% of our scholarship recipients graduate. Currently we grant around 240 scholarships a year.  This year we have four students at University.

What We Need & What You Get

Mostly, we need you to help us fund scholarships.

Here's what you get for how much you give:

  • $25 covers a backpack and school supplies for one girl.
  • $50 covers a school uniform.
  • $100 covers fees for one year of Junior High School.
  • $350 coveres fees for one year of Senior High School.
  • . . . But even $1 moves us closer to our goal,
  • And a gift of any amount earns our eternal gratitude.

Impact

"They need to know they can do so much more than just sit at home."
-- Regina, WomensTrust Scholarship Recipient, on the fate of elderly women in rural Ghana and why she is training to be their nurse

Giving a girl a scholarship is one of the best things you can do for a girl, her country, and the world. Countries with educated women have higher GNPs and healthier economies than their counterparts. Educated girls are generally wealthier, more successful, and provide better lives for their children and grandchildren. 

Our scholarship recipients give back to their village, their community and their country, and they give back generously and often. Most of our university students talk excitedly of using their education to benefit people in their hometown, and all of them remain committed to living and working in Ghana.

If you educate a girl, she will lift up her family, her village, her country and her world.

Risks & Challenges

Educating girls in Ghana poses some fairly serious challenges. The odds are steep and not often in our favor. Our scholarship recipients face high drop out rates, poverty, and personal struggle. Many are on their own financially, Most struggle with family problems. Some are orphans. 

But we can do this. We have over a decade of experience offering scholarships in Ghana.  We are a highly personal and highly connected organization.  We know each of our recipients personally. We know their struggles and their considerable strengths. And we are dedicated to them. We stick with them, and stand by them, from 7 to 21, all the way from grade school though university. We know who we are helping and how best to help. With your help we will succeed.

Other Ways You Can Help

Short on cash? OK. Would you consider joining our mailing list? Encouraging others? Just letting people we care know we exist? All of those things would be tremendously helpful to us and to our work.
story_txt:
Short Summary "Education is a woman's fastest route out of Poverty."-- Barbara Lucas, US Board Chair, WomensTrust This campaign is for our education program.  Our simple aim: to get and keep Ghanaian girls in school. 70% percent of girls drop out of high school in Ghana.  In our program, 95% of our scholarship recipients graduate. Currently we grant around 240 scholarships a year.  This year we have four students at University.   What We Need & What You Get Mostly, we need you to help us fund scholarships.
Here's what you get for how much you give:  $25 covers a backpack and school supplies for one girl. $50 covers a school uniform. $100 covers fees for one year of Junior High School.
$350 coveres fees for one year of Senior High School.
. . . But even $1 moves us closer to our goal,
And a gift of any amount earns our eternal gratitude.    Impact "They need to know they can do so much more than just sit at home."-- Regina, WomensTrust Scholarship Recipient, on the fate of elderly women in rural Ghana and why she is training to be their nurse
Giving a girl a scholarship is one of the best things you can do for a girl, her country, and the world. Countries with educated women have higher GNPs and healthier economies than their counterparts. Educated girls are generally wealthier, more successful, and provide better lives for their children and grandchildren. 
Our scholarship recipients give back to their village, their community and their country, and they give back generously and often. Most of our university students talk excitedly of using their education to benefit people in their hometown, and all of them remain committed to living and working in Ghana.
If you educate a girl, she will lift up her family, her village, her country and her world.   Risks & Challenges Educating girls in Ghana poses some fairly serious challenges. The odds are steep and not often in our favor. Our scholarship recipients face high drop out rates, poverty, and personal struggle. Many are on their own financially, Most struggle with family problems. Some are orphans. 
But we can do this. We have over a decade of experience offering scholarships in Ghana.  We are a highly personal and highly connected organization.  We know each of our recipients personally. We know their struggles and their considerable strengths. And we are dedicated to them. We stick with them, and stand by them, from 7 to 21, all the way from grade school though university. We know who we are helping and how best to help. With your help we will succeed.   Other Ways You Can Help Short on cash? OK. Would you consider joining our mailing list? Encouraging others? Just letting people we care know we exist? All of those things would be tremendously helpful to us and to our work.

story:
Short Summary

I am here to introduce you to the amazing Dara Chrem, who is committed to improving and developing the rural community in which he was born and raised.  I met Dara when I was his English teacher, serving as a US Peace Corps Volunteer in Dang Tung, Cambodia from 2008-2010. Dara is a native of Dang Tung District, the poorest district in Kampot Province, Cambodia, a district of about 58,000 people, of which 40% are under the age of 18 and 91% are subsistence-level rice farmers. As of 2013, the population of Dang Tung has been decreasing as people leave to seek jobs elsewhere. In 2013, 9% of the Dang Tung population had to leave their children and families behind to work within Cambodia, mostly in sweatshops/factories around  the capital. 4.5% left to work outside the country in similar but even more trying settings.

While watching the video above, you will learn about Dara’s hopes and dreams for Dang Tung, and you will meet members of the Dang Tung community who are so eager to bring more learning to their home, a place where every year more and more students simply drop out of school, with 9% of the 7600 children aged 6-11, and 13% of all children, not enrolled in 2013.   (For more stories of Dang Tung residents, check out the photos and stories in the Gallery, more and more of which we will be adding on a regular basis.) 

Your donation and support will help Dara create the first Dang Tung based nonprofit, Cambodian Rural Children and Youth Organization (CRCO), an organization that will not only provide English training, but also empower youth, keep them in school, and help them to succeed through support and training that you can make happen.

By donating today, you will:

· Provide quality education for children who never dreamed they could afford to learn 

· Bring parents together as a team to work toward problem-solving at the community level

·  Advance a community towards a self-dependent future rather than continuing to be a place from which people leave to work elsewhere


What We Need & What You Get

With your help, Dara will start an organization in Dang Tung to provide 1 year of free English classes in two separate locations. These English classes will be accompanied by other programming targeted toward at-risk students to encourage them to develop sustainable study techniques and habits and find their voices as empowered members of society. In return, there are perks available ranging from thank-you videos from the children you help to a tour and/or homestay in Dang Tung itself. But the biggest perk is definitely knowing you made a difference in these children's lives!

How will your donations be used?

  • $15 provides travel expenses for 3 children and a chaperone to travel to the larger provincial town to record a radio program developed by students to promote ideas important to them
  • $25 provides teaching supplies for 200 children for a month and a half 
  • $60 provides the full cost of producing and airing one month of a children's radio program  
  • $120 provides 1 month of living wages for a volunteer/intern teacher 
  • $200 provides 1 month of living wages for a certified teacher
  • $300 provides a year's worth of supplies to facilitate parent-parent meetings filled with shared ideas and hope 
  • $1,200 provides 6 months' living wages for a certified teacher
  • $2,500 provides about 1/5 of the entire project's cost for a year! 
  • If you donate, you will be sent a video of the very kids you help thanking you personally for your donation 

  • If we don't reach our funding goal, the donations will still go toward this program; however, it will have fewer teachers and less classroom hours and ultimately be able to help less kids 

The Impact

This campaign will bring light and hope to children who right now think that because their families cannot afford to pay for private lessons or bribes to the government, they will never be able to learn enough to complete secondary, or even primary school. It will be run by a leader, Mr. Dara Chrem, who is from the very community he wants to help and who has been involved for over 4 years in community development work surrounding youth, gender development, and land and housing rights. He has a wealth of experience includes community needs assessment, project planning and implementation, and reporting. If you would like to see his CV, please contact me! 

Here are the objectives he has developed (with the potential for a change in start date depending on when the funding is finalized):

1)  By April 2016, Dang Tung district parents, especially those who are low income, will become more invested and involved in their children’s education, with 100 parents attending bi-monthly meetings in which they share problems faced as well as tactics used to successfully support children's learning

2)  By April 2016, Ang Tamung Community School and Ajinoto Phnom Toj Thlok Thlong primary school will have built ties with local related community and government organizations, through 12 meetings with the commune Committees of Women's and Children's Affairs, at least 4 meetings with Cambodian NGOs working in education, and at least 12 joint meetings with faculty from local public schools

3)  By April 2016, 200 poor and vulnerable students will receive English education at Ang Tamung Community School, Ajinomoto Phnom Toj Thlok Thlong primary school with at least 100 females attending class and at least 100 students with measured improvements in English abilities.

4)  By April 2016, at least 12 episodes of a children’s radio program will have aired to provide children an opportunity to engage in media and announce their needs.

Risks & Challenges

We acknowledge that we will likely face some challenges during the course of the year. Although Dara has worked to secure free space for the organization to run in school buildings in Dang Tung and has already worked with local government to secure permission and endorsement for the project. It is also possible that it will be difficult to recruit teachers to live in rural Dang Tung, but Dara is confident that he can use his network and knowledge of teaching universities in Cambodia to recruit teachers to go there. He will also use his familiarity with the community to find them housing to rent in Dang Tung, as there are no hotels, boarding houses, or anything of that nature. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't donate today, please help share this amazing campaign with others to help us make these Dang Tung dreams come true! You can:

  • Share the campaign on Facebook, Twitter, or other social media 
  • Email the campaign to friends
  • Hold a fundraiser (bake sale, etc.) in your hometown to help raise money to donate
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools for even more!

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Dara has created a detailed budget to explain the resources needed to fund the project Community English Learning for its first year in action, and it can be found here:  http://tinyurl.com/communityenglishlearning  alongside a detailed project proposal: http://tinyurl.com/CRCOproposal.

story:
Founders Adam Gutman (originally from Mount Dora, Florida, USA) and Stefan van der Spek (originally from Hoogkarspel, Netherlands) saw a gap in the services available to boys in the neighborhoods in and around Cabarete. Their solution was to support their community by organizing an out-of-school learning program. 


Together, Adam and Stefan bring more than 31 years of management and coaching experience to the organization.



Currently, the program has 11 boys (ages 7 to 11). We believe that by initially focusing on a core group of motivated boys and parent(s), we can effectively achieve the program’s goals, and show the community the benefits of the program. As we build on our successes and obtain more resources, we'll increase the number of boys in the program. The program is available at no charge to Dominicans and Haitians.

  1. Teach English, 
  2. Develop character and values, and 
  3. Develop a healthy lifestyle. 


Advantages For The Boys:
Learn English to expand their career options. Develop personal and interpersonal skills such as critical thinking,  problem solving,  and assuming personal and group responsibility. Build self-esteem and self-confidence. Reduce the risk of unsafe behavior such as using drugs or having unprotected sex. Develop healthy friendships and strong support networks.

Advantages For The Community:
Involving young people in the community helps them see themselves as part of the community; they are more likely to be part of the solution to the challenges facing the community. By involving young people, the community is allowing them to develop their leadership potential, so that they grow and learn that they can become caring, responsible leaders of society.

Our vision is to serve as a model program and to assist other communities so they too can inspire their boys to be productive and responsible  citizens.

To date we've received $2,624 in monetary donations, more than $1,400 in meals, and $1,275 in volunteer labor and materials. Stefan and I have contributed $9,029 of personal savings to fund repairs to youth center, 6 months pre-paid rent, utilities, and more. 


We performed comparative cost research from local and online sources and calculated the program’s budget. To see a detailed list of items visit:
InspireDR.org > How You Can Help > Wish-List

Your support will make a positive difference in the lives of a minimum 11 boys, their families, and future generations. Together we can help the boys create opportunities for themselves and break the cycle of poverty for their families.

Funding Goal:
In the event we don’t reach our funding goal, we’ll use contributions based on priority (listed above in descending order).

Why are we crowd-funding?
It’s our best option to reach a worldwide audience that can relate to what we’re looking to accomplish in our quest to help the boys of Cabarete.

Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help us:
•  Take a deep breath; then get the word out and make some noise about InspireDR
•  Please Share with others!
•  Join us on www.facebook.com/inspiredr.org

story:
I met Beatha when I was working as a volunteer English teacher for VSO back in 2001. We lived together for nearly three years, and kept in touch when I returned to the UK. She married and had two children, but later chose to leave her husband because he was violent towards her. Her strength and courage mean Mucyo and Mugisha will grow up knowing that violence towards women is unacceptable. She is bringing them up alone, with no help from parents or siblings, as they all died in the 1994 genocide.

Last summer Beatha became very ill with fluid on her lungs, and while she was away from her small local shop it was robbed - everything was taken. Her health, home and livelihood all gone in one cruel blow. She moved in with a friend and called me. Although the urgent crisis is over, she now needs help to get back on her feet again,

The 1090 GBP raised will pay for:

200 = A year of schooling (primary) for both boys. The school costs 30 per term per child (180) and books and pens also need to be bought (20). The boys both love school, and Mucyo, the eldest, has regularly come top of his class!

360 = A year's rental for the house in Butare where they are now living, at 30 per month.

280 = Approximate ongoing medical costs for Beatha. Treatment should be complete by April, after which she can think about working again.

250 = Towards the cost of starting up a small business, selling food and other essentials, as Beatha was doing successfully before she became ill.

I myself, with the help of friends and family, will continue to support Beatha regularly while she still needs it, with money to pay for food and other daily necessities, but your contribution will make sure that the vital longer term goals of good health and access to education aren't sacrificed as a result of today's hunger.
Beatha is one of the strongest women I have ever met. She and her sons give me hope for a country that is in great need of such integrity and intelligence. In supporting them you are giving strength to Rwanda's roots.

story:
This summer I will be working in Edinburgh with the Association of Chief Officers of Scottish Volunteer Organizations!  In this position I will be learning about Scotland's third sector and working closely with non-profits and government agencies.  This will help me achieve my future career goals of becoming a diplomat for the Unites States in that I will learn more about international cooperation and international politics.

 For this position I will need to get a working visa which will cost 800$. Thanks for your support!
story_txt: This summer I will be working in Edinburgh with the Association of Chief Officers of Scottish Volunteer Organizations!  In this position I will be learning about Scotland's third sector and working closely with non-profits and government agencies.  This will help me achieve my future career goals of becoming a diplomat for the Unites States in that I will learn more about international cooperation and international politics. For this position I will need to get a working visa which will cost 800$. Thanks for your support!

story:
Hello! I ask for your help with all my heart to treat my baby Vanya from Poltava.
When he turned 7 month I start to worry since he still did not sit on his own, and did not even try to crawl. Althought we visited the children's neurologist every month, and doctor reassured that it is nothing to worry about, it might be due to early birth and it will pass.
But already when he was 9 months we heard terrible diagnosis, "cerebral palsy" and it started ... 

(this is medical diagnosis)
Endless, uninterrupted courses of massage, exercise therapy, physiotherapy, increased medical treatment, rehabilitation courses in the regional center.


3 times he received in-stay treatment in the neurology department of the regional hospital in Poltava, passed 3 courses of Intensive neurophysiology rehabilitation in International Clinic of Rehabilitation in city Truskavets. We spent huge amount of money on that treatment, but it did not bring any of expected  results.  Treatment in Ukraine brings some results but they are very small, my 3 years old Vanya still can not speak, stand, crawl or walk. Now Vanya became worse. There was one hope for treatment abroad in Chinese clinic "Tadun" in Harbin. But for this treatment i need to raise 23100 dollars. While taking care of my disable child, I can not earn that huge money and i have nobody to ask for help. I am an orphan and divorced with my husband. The only hope i have - is You, kind and caring people. Please, help me to give my child a happy childhood. My biggest fear is that without money I can not help my kid, and it's killing me. He needs Your help. Only your help can bring my baby to a normal full life without a wheelchair. The faster we will collect the necessary amount, the faster we start treatment and more chances he will have. I appeal to you with the last hope to raise money for the treatment of my baby Vanya.
Below our invitation and bill for theraphy in China.

story:
Italian with Elisa is a multimedia language course. Volume 1 (220 pages) was published on Valentine's Day 2015. Everything's free: the PDF, the MP3 audio files, and the tablet-friendly and smartphone-friendly website.

Let's continue with Volume 2. By the end of 2015, we will produce

  • a free PDF
  • more than 100 MP3 audio files
  • tablet-friendly web pages
  • smartphone-friendly web pages



In addition to the perks shown in the right column, Italian with Elisa has set up a tombola for donations of $25 or more. The prizes:

1st Prize: A 4-day stay at 20Richer at the heart of Paris.

2nd Prize: A diner for two on a Bâteau-Mouche OR a show for two at the Moulin Rouge.

3rd Prize: A diner for two at L'Arbre de Canelle, Paris, 9e Arrondissement.

Find detailed information at the Elisa tombola page.



Based on our previous publishing experience, Volume 1 of Italian with Elisa will be downloaded more than 10,000 times in the next 12 months (see real-time download data). Thousands of people will listen to Italian voices for the first time in their life and learn their first Italian words. Many of them will go through Levels 1 to 7 and will reach an amazing level of comprehension and expression.

During the 60-day campaign for Volume 2 which contains Levels 8-14 we will
present you with weekly downloads. Italian with Elisa will travel around the world - you'll follow Elisa as she goes to the most faraway places on the planet!

story:
Dear Friends, 

More than 50 years ago — FREEDOM SUMMER of 1964 — a group of courageous young people of all races joined a cause for equality and human dignity, when they boarded buses bound for the south to support the cause of FREEDOM for all Americans. College interns from around the country traveled to Mississippi to help with voter registration and to teach black children and others reading, writing and other subjects. The Mississippi Freedom Summer Project was organized by two civil rights groups, with the support of various other political and civil organizations

We called those brave believers FREEDOM RIDERS because they put their values and their lives on the line to help others and started what we call today, Freedom Schools - a program of the national Children’s Defense Fund, the brainchild of Ms. Marian Wright Edelman, the first African American women admitted to the Mississippi bar and a staunch, vocal advocate for children’s education.

FREEDOM SCHOOLS are named after the FREEDOM RIDERS movement, and the cause for equality and access to education for all persons (young and old) continues today.

As the Kansas City Freedom Schools Initiative marks 20 years of service to the community, we appeal to you to help us continue our mission of empowering children and families through reading, academic achievement, community service and leadership development.

We are recruiting busloads of FREEDOM RIDERS to make the Freedom School experience possible for more Kansas City children. 

Your Freedom Rider Pledge ($50, $100, $250, $500, $800 or more) will partially or fully fund all the expenses (books, materials, teachers, interns, meals, trips, and more) for one child for six weeks of quality learning, social engagement, and an opportunity to live lives of fulfillment and success. 

Our 2015 fundraising goal is $80,000. The funds raised will serve as the catalyst to provide summer enrichment and reading readiness programs for Kansas City Freedom School scholars for years to come.

Join us as we get on the bus bound for Freedom.

Thank you.

story:
What kind of Wales do you want for your children?

Thank you for your kind support to the first and second parts of the IWA's Constitutional Convention crowdfunding campaign. We have raised almost £4000, which has enabled us to design a start ready to launch on the 26th January 2015. We now need to raise further funds to keep the convention going. Please consider giving us further support.

About the IWA's Constitutional Convention

Following Scotland's decisive vote, the debate over the future shape of the UK is now taking off in earnest, but where is Wales' voice? What kind of Wales do you want for your children? Now is the time to discuss the type of Government we should have.

Independent think-tank the Institute of Welsh Affairs (IWA) is setting up a Constitutional Convention above the heads of the political elites. We will be drawing on the example of Iceland where crowd sourcing techniques were used to draw up a new constitution in the wake of their economic crisis.

The Convention will:

  • Give people the chance to shape the political and economic future of Wales.
  • Be independent from all political parties.
  • Encourage people in Wales to take part, online.

Why we need your help?

The IWA is a registered charity (1078435) and an independent think tank dedicated to making Wales a better place to live and work.

We are not aligned to any political party and receive no funding from the Government, and as such we're uniquely placed to challenge Government. We are a well established and trusted 'safe space' where debate can take place.

We can't organise this convention without your help, we are writing to Trusts, asking our members and seeking crowd funding to help us organise this convention. We plan to:

Set up a bespoke website to crowdsource opinions.

Recruit participants and encourage them to take part.

Draft a report based on responses and feed-in to the debate in Government.

If you can't provide funding support, please help in other ways, please tell other people about our campaign and ask others to spread the word or donate.

Remember to take part in the debate which will be live on the 26th January.

story: The “Troy” Chavez Memorial Peace Garden has been established since 1994 and is built on an acre and a half of land. The fence we would like to build must allow the community to always be able to view the garden as to always make them feel welcome and a part of it. We have considered many styles of fences and have given it much thought. We realize the fence we desire is a little more expensive but a wooden fence would cut the community off and a wrought iron fence gives the garden an unwelcoming feeling. Our goal is not to cut the community off but to protect the garden. The fence we currently have has three openings so we would also have to replace three gates that we can lock and close the garden at night. Although the garden is highly respected, watched and cared for by the community, once the plants grow and it’s late at night it is easy for people to hide from view. We have installed solar lights and of course our goal is to put in more as we raise funds but we still get homeless people who unfortunately are not interested in the care of the garden. We work with youth and their safety is always a priority of our organization. We also feel there is no need for anyone to be in the garden after hours but currently have no way of preventing their entry. This fence would not only provide safety to the garden but also add security for the youth who participate. We really hope anyone who considers donating to this project that you take the time to walk through the garden so that you can see its importance to the community located at 3825 Shoshone St in Denver CO. Please feel free to visit our website that is updated with our work in the community and visit us at the garden in the spring.

story:
‪#‎personalfinancebooksforteachers‬

I will be leading this dream project of mine.

They taught us how to read and write. Everyday they walk into rooms, check papers, call out names of kids who either a) forced to recite b) a lil sleepy c) too bibo. They sway their hips at exercise time. And call attention if we're snoozing at flag ceremonies.

My dream project this year is to distribute personal finance books to public school teachers. Crazy I thought if we travel nationwide and do this in all public schools. I've been to building houses, painting classrooms, donation drives and all. But this one just fits into this personal finance advocacy.

But I cannot do this on my own. I need people who will be willing to ride with me in this journey. To speak in front of teachers and share. People who will contribute to purchase books. 

Are you with me in this? For me, this is challenge accepted.

Please join the Filipino Financial Freedom Forum Facebook group. 

Visit my personal finance blog MoneyLifeBlood.

story: This campaign is to raise senior high school fees for three children , Vivian Achieng, vivian magak and Joseph odhiambo. The target is to raise term one school fees in 10 days. They have upto 28th February to report in school otherwise be cut off from joining high school this year. This is an appeal to raise the school fees.

story:
Changing the world one robot at a time


Under the direction of Dr. Andrew B. Williams, the HEIR Lab engineering team at Marquette University is making strides to expand their knowledge of robotics by participating in RoboCup 2015 in Hefei, China this July.

Through the not so simple act of having robots play competitive soccer against each other, our team is collaborating with robotics experts from around the world to progress the use of robotics in academics and daily lives.  While soccer is the current mission, we can see the long term benefits of robots in the near future. The HEIR Lab's mission is to fight childhood obesity and transform the lives of children with robots. The current robots in the lab are prototypes of personal training robots that can be used to teach children proper exercise technique and inspire children of all backgrounds. Through our robotic developments, we can change the world.

This will be our second year competing in RoboCup and over the course of the last year, we have made significant improvements to our robots' design and programing. We will once again be the only American team in attendance and want to continue to build international robotic connections to continue our research.  We are looking for your help to raise funds for three things:

  • The construction of our second robot
  • Registration fees
  • Travel expenses
By participating in RoboCup again this year, we know we can get one step closer to coming up with the appropriate technology to build a robot that can assist children with their everyday tasks. Thank you in advance for supporting us in this endeavor.


Our Project Leader

Dr. Andrew B. Williams is a tenured Full Professor and the John P. Raynor, S.J., Distinguished Chair in Electrical and Computer Engineering at Marquette University. He is also the Director of the Humanoid Engineering and Intelligent Robotics Lab. Dr. Williams and his robotics work have been featured media outlets including the 700 Club, CNN, CBS Evening News, National Public Radio and a TEDx Talk. Dr. Williams invents robotics and mobile intelligent technology to address societal problems such as childhood obesity. Dr. Williams goal as a Champion for Change is to help students develop and market innovations that will lead to everyone having an ethical and affordable humanoid robot in every home to assist children and adults from all backgrounds with life tasks, healthy living, and learning in a culturally relevant and socially intelligent manner.

Learn more:

  • Fox 6 Interview
  • HEIR Lab
  • Dr. Andrew B Williams (Dr. Williams was named in Milwaukee Magazine's 20 Most Creative People )
  • NPR Tell Me More
  • "Belonging in Technology - What I learned from Steve Jobs" TEDx Talk 
The Humanoid Robotics Program is part of Marquette's Social Innovation Initiative (SII). As featured on the Marquette Men's Basketball home court, Marquette Changemakers attacking root causes of global social problems with sustainable solutions. Be the change!


Student and Faculty involvement

Humanoid Robot Team 

Dr. Andrew B. Williams


Social Media Team

Phil Batzner

Rebecca Dempsey 

Alexa Hackfort

story:
We are seeking donations towards the completion of my documentary 'Mysteries of Northern California.' With the correct funding the film could be made in a professional manner and put up on the internet for free. This would be a great public service and provide free historical and mystery based programing.
All proceeds will be used to buy equipment and travel to the appropriate destinations. This documentary will examine the true hidden nature of many of the monuments we take for granted in our everyday lives. In order to make a professional grade film it is necessary to travel and purchase additional equipment. Along the way a strict budget will be adhered to. Camping and any other cost saving activities will be practiced.

To date I have only been able to produce low budget and frankly low quality films but I always provide them commercial free and profit free. It will be nice to make this documentary to expose the truth about this age old tradition. In order to do this I need your help. If you have enjoyed my work over the years please make a small contribution.
Thanks, Cort Lindahl

story:
Who Are We?

We are Burns Bog Conservation Society, a Canadian charity that is committed to protecting and sustaining the world's wetlands and peatlands since 1988. Using Burns Bog as a model, we are dedicated to educating the public on the importance of Burns Bog and the world's peatlands. We provide a voice for the public on important decisions regarding the bog's future, opportunities for the public to interact with the bog's natural environment, and offer a variety of community events to engage the public.

We are hosting the Stepping into Nature Festival with a host of environmental partners for a future with environmentally connected and conscious citizens.

-----

Less technology and more nature for kids

Youths ages 8 to 10 are spending an average of 8 hours a day in front of a screen (i.e. phone, computer, and TV).  Older kids are plugged in for more than 11 hours a day.  With so much time dedicated indoors and on screens, children are developing a disconnect with nature, leading to a new disorder called Nature Deficit Disorder - the theory that a wide range of learning, emotional, and social problems are occurring in children as a result of spending less time outdoors (Last Child in the Woods by Richard Louv). Some of the problems include: anxiety, sedentary lifestyles, depression, attention deficit disorders, and the inability to develop essential social skills. Today, kids are aware of the global threats to the environment, but their physical contact and intimacy with nature is fading.

Benefits of nature

Increasing evidence shows interactions with nature has physical, emotional, social benefits and is important for maintaining and improving human health in a rapidly changing world. In addition, nature also stimulates creativity and discovery that comes with experiential play and not just spending their time on video games or TV.

The problem

Both working parents, weather, safety, and lack of parks and natural surroundings in our bleak urban landscape have been blamed for children spending less time outdoors.

Mission

To bring approximately 400 Grade 6 and 7 students into nature to learn about the importance of their environment through hands-on interactive learning during our inaugural Stepping into Nature Festival. We want to inspire, connect, and engage students with nature and demonstrate their interdependence on it. 

Details

The festival will take place over the course of 4 days in October 2015 in the Delta Nature Reserve.  The reserve is part of the iconic Burns Bog - the largest undeveloped urban wilderness in North America.  It is located in the heart of the Lower Mainland and easily accessible to surrounding schools. Local environmental education organizations have carefully planned hands-on activities which will teach participants about the importance and fragility of their local environment. Students will leave the festival with an environmental challenge that will impact those around them and which they must fulfill within the course of their school year.

Building leaders in the community

Local high school students will be getting involved as well.  With training from our environmental partners, students will be developing their leadership skills and helping to deliver station activities to elementary students during festival days.

Challenge - Where we need your help!

Transit is expensive. Very expensive! It costs more to get a child to the program than it does to provide the actual program to them.  We want to make this as affordable and accessible to as many local schools as possible. Our budget for the entire program to start up would be $24,776.29. The Pacific Salmon Foundation, Chris Spencer Foundation and the Hamber Foundation have kicked in $7,200 so far, a small student fee will contribute $3,024 and it`s up to us to raise the rest.

After Indiegogo and credit card fees, that becomes exactly $13,388.11 for the program to launch in October 2015.

Our goal for this fundraiser is to raise a modest $5000 to help cover transportation and initial start-up costs.

Every dollar we raise will move us closer to creating a valuable learning experience that will become an annual event.

Solid funding is the core of every project like this one.  The root of conservation is Passion and by engaging students to their natural surroundings, you create amazing citizens for your community.  Here's our breakdown for all the costs involved in the project to the penny.

We are so close to success, but we need your help to finish it off! With less than a month of release about the festival, we have maxed out our registrations with 432 students registered for the festival and a wait-list started for Oct 2015.  Sixty high school student leaders have been confirmed and set to deliver stations over the duration of the festival.  Our incredible environmental partner hosts have programmed excellent hands-on educational stations for students, which align with British Columbia school curriculum.

Help us finish and bring some great kids to learn about nature and open up their minds to the potential they hold as environmentally conscious citizens.  Your pledge could mean a world of difference to someone.  Every environmentalist started with a valuable interaction with nature.

Your Impact

  • Providing us the funding for bus transportation to help us connect 432 students to nature.
  • Supporting a great opportunity to educate the students on the importance of nature and environment and their interdependence on it.
  • Helping to engage students to nature through hands-on experience  in an out-door learning environment
  • Encouraging and fostering environmentally responsible citizens.
  • Building and empowering young leaders in the community.

The Perks
We want to reward you for your journey with us.  We tried to keep the cost of the perks low so we can put as much money as possible into the program, but I think there are some pretty invaluable perks that come straight from the people who you will be helping out.  Take a look to see what may interest you.
Stretch Goal
If we're somehow lucky enough to achieve our funding goal, we won`t stop there! Additional funding will allow us to cover the remaining operational costs and continue to develop the festival for the following years.  We have a large demand for outdoor educational programs, but we can`t make it happen without funding!

Our Sponsors

We've been very lucky to have some great supporters and help along the way.  We want to recognize those who are helping us along our journey, whether it be big or small.  Thank you and the kids will thank you too!

                                     



Our Environmental Partners
           

  



Frequently Asked Questions

Why is the goal set to $5k instead of the $14k you need to raise?

We set our sights on $5k to have an achievable goal.  $14k is a large amount of money.  We're still pushing to match our goal, but we didn't want folks to feel their contributions didn't matter.  Every single dollar absolutely matters!

Why are you doing all this?

Youths have the potential to make powerful decisions about their future. By providing education on the importance of their environment, we hope to create environmentally-conscious citizens who have the ability to think critically about the decisions that will affect the environment and their future.

What's the goal after this year?

The festival has been adapted from two very successful outdoor festivals in Ontario - The Carolinian Forest Festival and the Marsh Quest festival. These festivals have been educating students on the importance of the environment for over 6 years.  We aim to achieve the same success and make this an annual event, with the goal of reaching every single elementary school in the Lower Mainland.

I'd love to donate something to your cause.  How can I help?

First and foremost, donating money goes the longest way to achieving our goals. In-kinds are highly appreciated as well. If your company would like to donate something you think our funders would like, please email us at education@burnsbog.org or call 604-572-0373. We welcome everyone who wishes to come aboard as a sponsor by supplying a great perk.

If you'd like to make a bigger donation, have questions or want to talk to someone further about the project, please feel free to reach out to the contact above for more information.
