Your Impact

Providing us the funding for bus transportation to help us connect 432 students to nature.
Supporting a great opportunity to educate the students on the importance of nature and environment and their interdependence on it.

Helping to engage students to nature through hands-on experience  in an out-door learning environment 


Encouraging and fostering environmentally responsible citizens.

Building and empowering young leaders in the community.


 The PerksWe want to reward you for your journey with us.  We tried to keep the cost of the perks low so we can put as much money as possible into the program, but I think there are some pretty invaluable perks that come straight from the people who you will be helping out.  Take a look to see what may interest you. Stretch GoalIf we're somehow lucky enough to achieve our funding goal, we won`t stop there! Additional funding will allow us to cover the remaining operational costs and continue to develop the festival for the following years.  We have a large demand for outdoor educational programs, but we can`t make it happen without funding!
 Our Sponsors
We've been very lucky to have some great supporters and help along the way.  We want to recognize those who are helping us along our journey, whether it be big or small.  Thank you and the kids will thank you too!
                                      

Our Environmental Partners             


 Frequently Asked QuestionsWhy is the goal set to $5k instead of the $14k you need to raise?
We set our sights on $5k to have an achievable goal.  $14k is a large amount of money.  We're still pushing to match our goal, but we didn't want folks to feel their contributions didn't matter.  Every single dollar absolutely matters!
Why are you doing all this?
Youths have the potential to make powerful decisions about their future. By providing education on the importance of their environment, we hope to create environmentally-conscious citizens who have the ability to think critically about the decisions that will affect the environment and their future.
What's the goal after this year?
The festival has been adapted from two very successful outdoor festivals in Ontario - The Carolinian Forest Festival and the Marsh Quest festival. These festivals have been educating students on the importance of the environment for over 6 years.  We aim to achieve the same success and make this an annual event, with the goal of reaching every single elementary school in the Lower Mainland.
I'd love to donate something to your cause.  How can I help?
First and foremost, donating money goes the longest way to achieving our goals. In-kinds are highly appreciated as well. If your company would like to donate something you think our funders would like, please email us at education@burnsbog.org or call 604-572-0373. We welcome everyone who wishes to come aboard as a sponsor by supplying a great perk.
If you'd like to make a bigger donation, have questions or want to talk to someone further about the project, please feel free to reach out to the contact above for more information.

story:
Okullarda Fiziksel Güvenlik Projesi Nedir?

Türkiye’de her yıl, en az 20 çocuk okullarda önlenebilir, fiziksel güvenlik eksiklikleri sebebiyle yaşamını yitiriyor! 

Binlercesi yaralanıyor ya da sakat kalıyor! 

Geliştirilecek standartlar, alınacak basit tedbirler ile okullardaki ölüm ve yaralanmaları engellemek mümkün!

Okullarda Fiziksel Güvenlik Projesi çocukların eğitim ortamı ve yakın çevrelerinde, fiziksel çevreyi oluşturan yapılar ve donanımları nedeni ile maddi ve manevi bütünlüklerinin zarar görmesinin, bedensel ve psikolojik yaralanmalarının ve en önemlisi yaşamlarını kaybetmelerinin önüne geçilmesini amaçlamaktadır.

Neden Yapıyoruz ? 

Türkiye’de 2011-2014 yılları arasında en az 60 çocuk, okullardaki fiziksel güvenlik eksiklikleri sebebiyle yaşamını yitirdi. Bu sayının ağırlıklı olarak basın taraması yoluyla elde edildiği göz önünde tutulduğunda gerçek rakamın bunun çok üzerinde olması ciddi derecede kaygı verici bir durumdur.

Bunun yanı sıra Türkiye’de okullarda meydana gelen yaralanma ve sakat kalmaya dair resmi veri de tutulmuyor. En az 60 çocuğun okullarda fiziksel güvenlik eksikliği nedeniyle yaşamını kaybetmiş olması durumu, farklı ülkelerdeki risk piramitleriyle karşılaştırıldığında; 1800 çocuğun ciddi ölüm tehlikesi geçirerek ağır yaralandığı ve 17.400 çocuğun da ölüm tehlikesi olmasa da hafif şekilde yaralandığı tahmin edilmektedir. Dolayısıyla ilgili zaman aralığı içerisinde okullarda fiziksel güvenlik eksikliğinden kaynaklı olay sayısının 174.000 olduğu tahmin edilebilir.

Bunun yanı sıra eğitim ortamlarında fiziksel güvenlik yetersizlikleri nedeniyle oluşan ölüm vakalarının oluş biçimleri yakından incelendiğinde, tamamının alınacak çok basit tedbirlerle önlenebilir olduğu görülmektedir. İş güvenliği prensipleri de okullarda meydana gelen ölümcül kazaların tamamına yakınının önlenebilir olduğuna işaret etmektedir.Çocukların eğitim ortamlarında fiziksel çevreden kaynaklanan nedenlerden dolayı herhangi bir şekilde zarar görmemeleri, başta yaşama ve gelişme haklarının korunmasına yönelik çalışmaların yapılandırılması öncelikli bir konudur!

Amacımız, çocukların eğitim ortam ve çevrelerinde, fiziksel çevre nedeni ile maddi ve manevi bütünlüklerinin zarar görmelerinin önüne geçilmesidir. Bu doğrultuda Milli Eğitim Bakanlığı Temel Eğitim Genel Müdürlüğü ile Gündem Çocuk Derneği arasında “Okullarda Fiziksel Güvenlik İşbirliği Protokolü” imzalanmıştır.

Hedefimiz:

- Annelerin, babaların çocuklarını gönül rahatlığı ile emanet edebildiği güvenli okullar,

- Hiçbir çocuğun okulda, fiziksel güvenlik eksikliğinden kaynaklı bir sebeple yaşamını yitirmediği bir Türkiye! 

(Ayrıntılı bilgi için: http://www.gundemcocuk.org/okullarda-fiziksel-g... )

story:
What Is This All About?


Samkelwe S.S High School in Addo, South Africa is a school of around 800 students.
I visited them in September of last year and felt touched by how much they appreciated what little they had. What I intend to do is to help by fundraising for Raspberry Pi computers (http://simple.wikipedia.org/wiki/Raspberry_Pi).  

In their school at the time they had 6 internet connected desktop computers that were donated from an outside company. In their library they had around 100 books, each one more valuable to them than the last. Their biggest desire was to enable the students access to more information to further their learning.  
I hope to help them with this.


What I Am Looking To Do


I would like to raise enough money to go towards as many Raspberry Pi's as possible. Raspberry Pi computers are small credit card sized computers that run off a small USB cable. They have an HDMI out slot, as well as hardware that nearly matches that of an iPhone.

The price in total for the computer, a case, cabling and an SD card for the software comes to just over £50. 

I shall spend the time to put together all the software, install everything and have them all prepared for use in the school. They can then be shipped either via Airmail, or taken with my family when they go this September.


The Impact


Based on the fact that the school only has 6 computers, any contribution would be huge. The biggest thing for this school is to have more tools for learning.


Other Ways You Can Help


Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help. With this in mind, please think about sharing and helping me out by any means possible!

Thanks for taking the time to read this.

- Josh S.

story:
Help the kids of the children to be warm in the coming winter..

 
I need yours help to make children in the shelter have a feeling of warmth and happiness. As you know,the previous winter was very miserable because of the distribution after  the last attack on Gaza .Actually this winter is not better than the previous one they are still without houses to protect them from the cold winter. We want to help them to wear a warm sweater as all children in this world.Children in this shelter really need your help.All of you can contribute in this blessing work ,and Im sure that all of you love the smile of these children .

Our main goals in this campaign are to draw a smile on their faces and distribute sweaters for them as a gift from all people who will help and donate.They deserve the smile and warmth.

Be with us , and donate to help.

The financial cost of the campaign is :

Onw sweater costs 7$

The total number of children is 97.

(97 * 7 = 679$ )

All the best.

story:
Launched in 2014, E2Learn was created to make class a rewarding experience. Literally. Our app equips schools and families with a tool that tracks students’ attendance and rewards them financially for every class attended. Funds can then be disbursed either directly into a student’s standard bank account or into an E2Learn Gift of College 529 savings account where they can be matched dollar-for-dollar, empowering students to achieve their higher education goals.

The process begins with parents who first download the app and create an E2Learn account. Next, they establish their student’s reward accounts (standard bank account and/or E2Learn Gift of College 529), fund the account with a minimum of $25, set their hourly attendance reward level ($1/hr by default) and choose their reward disbursement split percentage (40% standard / 60% E2Learn Gift of College 529, for example). Note: only funds deposited into an E2Learn Gift of College 529 are eligible for matched funding.

Once set-up has been completed, students can download and open the app. At the beginning of class, students tap the Start button. At the end of class, students tap the End button. E2Learn tracks and rewards students for each hour of class attended, and provides parents with an account of all classes attended. Parents distribute funds into their student’s account(s) at the time of their choosing. Success!

We need your help to fund our upcoming 2016 Pilot Program!

Each $25 you contribute will help change the life of one student in the Program by opening an E2Learn Gift of College 529 savings account in their name. Let these students know that someone out there cares about their future enough to reward their good school attendance with higher education funding!


We all want to see our schools and our students be as successful as possible and when children attend class on a regular basis, everyone wins!


Beyond your donations, we need your help spreading the word!

E2Learn is a grass-roots movement created to reward good school attendance while supporting Michelle Obama's "Better Make Room" Campaign and the Reach Higher initiative that seeks to provide educational opportunities for U.S. Students. Whether you donate to our campaign or not, you can still help change the life of a student. Here's how:

  • Spread the word about E2Learn on Facebook or Twitter. 
  • Ask your school to host an E2Learn Pilot Program in their school. Contact support@E2Learn.org for more details. 
  • Amazon.com customers: Do your shopping at smile.amazon.com to donate a % of all purchases to E2Learn.org.

CONNECT WITH US: WEBSITE | FACEBOOK I TWITTER | LINKEDIN

story:
Short Summary

Mt Olympus: The Creation’ a new documentary by award winner documanterian Athina Krikeli - a production of Ellopia Films USA. 
The Team of Ellopia, have the skills and the ability to ‘pass over’ to the viewers this great magic of the Gods and the pride and dignity of the mortals.  Ellopia Media Group EMG - is a very successful and promising multimedia organisation of Greeks abroad in USA, who keeps a top position among other Greek Media initiatives in USA - " Mt Olympus the creation"is an educational documentary project, which involves both History and Science fields, about the greek Mt. Olympus. 

People around the world will "meet"not only the greatness of the Mountain of the Gods but the significant birth - creation of it. With a the geological help we travel 250 million years ago t meet the first shape of Olympus. Modern approach in the filming-making art - with the main contribution of Athina Krikeli - the director of the Olympus documentary series - is making this project more promising!
The 1st documentary about Mt Olympus, with the title ‘Elassona - the Secret Path to Mt Olympus’, has already been awarded twice in 2015 with international recognition in short films making. (Best shorts competition and Inde Film Festival USA)

What We Need & What You Get

We finish already the filming. It took us 3 months to do so! Now we need to go ahead with the production, post production, editing, voice over, audio studio hours, graphic animations, music. Also travel expenses withing USA for Geologists interviews.

  • All the above will cost about 70 thousand dollars
  • Why we are so excited about this documentary? because it will bring for the first time in history of that area, the geological wonders of the Mountain. It will offer to the viewers universities, students and academia in general , a great tool of knowledge. A better understating about the geological path of or past!
  • We all ready in process of the completion! Talented  people donate their work for this project, and they make sure, it will not stop because we do not have the funds yet! the project will be ready in December for viewing!
  • All contributions above 100 dollars will be mention under SPECIAL THANKS at the credits, also all names will be available on our website www.ellopiatv.com as a token of appreciation!

The Impact

It will be an extraordinary project! it is the first time, Mt Olympus's highest peak "Pantheon" allowed TV crews to bring drone cameras and fly them around! Its a spectacular scenery!

  • We have done 28 documentaries in the past. We won First prize awards like (4 Telly Awards, First prize Cannes, Emmy nominations, Best shorts, Inde, Independence film festival, European Festivals etc) This one is a contribution to the world! Both its historical, mythical and geological point of you, will change the way people look at high rocks and mountains for ever

Other Ways You Can Help

Also please support Indiegogo. You "hear" our voice because of them

  • Even if you can not help financialy please spread the world and keep up with our monthly updates and new trailers.
  • Also, please support Indiegogo. You "hear" our voice because of them

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Who we are

Everyone does science. Sure some of us do it as a career, but everyone on this planet can observe how the world works, ask questions, and develop ideas. These are all key traits of being a scientist that everyone has. Sadly, hearing about science can sometimes feel like traveling in a foreign country. You aren’t familiar with the language or culture (scientists can sometimes use unfamiliar words or concepts) or you just happen to get lost (you don’t even know where to go to find out the answers you want). However, just like traveling, until you learn the area, it is much more helpful to have a guide. Science ACEs aims to be that guide, helping newcomers explore the world of science, while training other scientists to be guides themselves.

The Science ACEs believe that the wonder of science should be accessible to everyone, regardless of their educational background or political persuasion. As graduate students in the biomedical sciences, we are well-equipped to break down the communication barriers between scientists and the general public by being stewards of scientific knowledge, and by fostering collaborative environments.

What we do

Already Science ACEs is an active participant in the following activities:

Science Café: Once a month, Science ACEs invites a local scientist to give a brief presentation of their work at a local bar. The atmosphere and topic are designed to be light and conversational; encouraging questions and discussion. The speakers have a strong desire to not just present their work, but help people understand why it matters to everyone.

Student Programs: Science ACEs members are currently working with several organizations involved in teaching science to students of ages ranging from elementary school to high school, while encouraging said students to pursue science as a career. Here the goal is not on details but helping students understand big ideas, and why they should be excited about discovering them. We hope with funding to one day develop a program of our own.

Videos: Who doesn’t love a good movie? Science ACEs recognizes videos are a great way to explain science, and are trying to put out several videos a year that both inform and entertain, like this one.

So what will your funding do?

We try to achieve our goals as frugally as possible: social media is free, plenty of science can be done on the cheap, but your support will be used to finance the continual development and expansion of this program. We are also looking to file as a 501(c)(3) educational non-profit organization. If we are successful in this campaign, all future donations to us will be tax deductible.

If you donate now, you will have our eternal gratitude. For $5, we will send you a personal shout-out on Twitter. For $20, we will send you a personalized thank you card, signed by all the ACEs. If you donate $100, you get to have dinner with one of our Science Cafe speakers.

Even if you can’t donate, you can also help us by reading our blog, liking our Facebook page, following us on Twitter, and joining in on the conversation. Tell us what you want to know about science.

Blog: https://scienceaces.wordpress.com

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/scienceaces

Twitter: https://www.twitter.com/scienceaces

Email: science.aces15@gmail.com

However, just like traveling, until you learn the area, it is much more helpful to have a guide. Science ACEs aims to be that guide, helping newcomers explore the world of science, while training other scientists to be guides themselves.The Science ACEs believe that the wonder of science should be accessible to everyone, regardless of their educational background or political persuasion. As graduate students in the biomedical sciences, we are well-equipped to break down the communication barriers between scientists and the general public by being stewards of scientific knowledge, and by fostering collaborative environments.What we doAlready Science ACEs is an active participant in the following activities:Science Café: Once a month, Science ACEs invites a local scientist to give a brief presentation of their work at a local bar. The atmosphere and topic are designed to be light and conversational; encouraging questions and discussion. The speakers have a strong desire to not just present their work, but help people understand why it matters to everyone.Student Programs: Science ACEs members are currently working with several organizations involved in teaching science to students of ages ranging from elementary school to high school, while encouraging said students to pursue science as a career. Here the goal is not on details but helping students understand big ideas, and why they should be excited about discovering them. We hope with funding to one day develop a program of our own.Videos: Who doesn’t love a good movie? Science ACEs recognizes videos are a great way to explain science, and are trying to put out several videos a year that both inform and entertain, like this one.So what will your funding do?We try to achieve our goals as frugally as possible: social media is free, plenty of science can be done on the cheap, but your support will be used to finance the continual development and expansion of this program. We are also looking to file as a 501(c)(3) educational non-profit organization. If we are successful in this campaign, all future donations to us will be tax deductible.If you donate now, you will have our eternal gratitude. For $5, we will send you a personal shout-out on Twitter. For $20, we will send you a personalized thank you card, signed by all the ACEs. If you donate $100, you get to have dinner with one of our Science Cafe speakers.Even if you can’t donate, you can also help us by reading our blog, liking our Facebook page, following us on Twitter, and joining in on the conversation. Tell us what you want to know about science.Blog: https://scienceaces.wordpress.comFacebook: https://www.facebook.com/scienceacesTwitter: https://www.twitter.com/scienceacesEmail: science.aces15@gmail.com

story:
The We Get Free Media Crew has been archiving Chicago's Hip Hop art, culture and resistance for the past three years. These Kuumba Lynx youth artists between the ages of 8 -26 have created photos, videos, documentaries, social media and more.


Their works include documentation of local youth programs rooted in a critical pedagogy, interviews w/ academics, activists, and artists, annual events such as louder than a bomb and brave new voices poetry competitions; road trips; transitional leadership building; youth led social movements; intergenerational learning and liberation and that's just a few highlights of what we call WE GET FREE.


Funds are needed to fuel the continuation of this necessary work. When you contribute to our campaign, you will be investing in the creation and preservation of our hip hop, community and liberatory based media archive. We want to keep our history and narrative in our own hand. With your help we can do just that and more.

story:
My interest in the human body has inspired me to pursue a career in the health profession. I want to learn more about the human body, and how best to take care of people when they’re sick or in crisis. I know that becoming a paramedic will support me towards realizing these goals. I've witnessed how important the decisions made by paramedics are to the health of the person in need. I know that the skills I will acquire in paramedic school will be with me my whole life and prove to be valuable in future endeavors. In order to make this dream a reality I need your support. Paying off my undergraduate loans and working in sustainable agriculture in NYC has made it extremely difficult to generate savings. 

The full amount I need to raise, to cover the costs of shipping my belongings to Portland, OR and paying the first part of my tuition, is $3,200.

Whatever amount you are able to contribute is deeply appreciated. Your support is truly invaluable--I can't do this without you. Thank you!

story:
MillionDC aims solve a common problem faced by startups in developing countries 

Imagine that you are from the Philippines, Indonesia or any developing country with limited resources.

You have a great idea and you want to make it into a startup.

However, the available platforms confuse you because they are mostly targeting people with deep knowledge of business. The available platforms are full of highly technical terms that don’t make sense to you.

This is where MillionDC comes in – MillionDC is a platform for startups from developing countries, to teach and guide them on how to turn ideas into profitable business.

Help us with our plan!

We need your help as we build 1. an online platform MillionDC.com, 2. create educational materials, and 3. conduct workshops for founders from developing countries.  We aim to raise USD 30,000 to realize our plans. 

  • The website www.milliondc.com - is for hosting stories of successful startups and their journey. The website is also a place where you have access to educational material.
  • The educational material is sets of tailored guidebooks that were created in partnership with professionals from startup industry.
  • MillionDC workshops provide meaningful person-to-person consultations with our experts. We plan to visit different locations across countries and help as many young entrepreneurs in developing regions as possible.

MillionDC has already won an award as Top 100 Startups in Asia in 2015. The insights for building MillionDC.com has been featured in a book titled Cyberpreneur Philippines, which is a National Book Awards finalist in 2016. 

MillionDC has recently been featured in Philippines and Taiwan news!

 

What we offer in exchange

For your $25 - A GuideBook tiled: Social Media for Startups. This is one of the many guidebooks that we are also giving to our target users. For those residing in Taiwan, we are also conducting workshops - first hand experience on how we plan to teach startups in developing countries. We need to add shipping cost for those outside Taiwan.

We also have other things to offer in the perk section such as our very own MillionDC shirt for your $100 - you get to wear our cool uniform!

About Us

I'm Paolo Lising, a former business journalist turned tech marketing professional.

I believe that this platform will greatly impact in the lives of many in the developing countries by providing them a more sustainable source of income.

Initially this was my personal project, now I have Mathieu Morel, as our head of business development, and my buddy from college, Ryan Borja, is our social media manager. We’ve also had developers who helped us along the way.

Email me paolojoseph@millionDC.com and I'll be glad to talk more about our vision for this platform.

Other Ways to Help

We appreciate your help in any form.

Please share this campaign to your friends.

Prayers will be much helpful.

---

打造新南向的新創媒合交流平台，需要你的支持！

你好，我是賴柏橋（Paolo Lising），2015亞洲前百大創業品牌（Top 100 Startups in Asia）「MillionDC.com」的創辦人。我來自菲律賓，擁有八年財經記者資歷，來台後投入科技行銷領域，並創立創業家社群平台MillionDC.com，希望能幫助亞洲開發中國家的新創將想法化為商業概念。我堅信這個平台將會牽引台灣以至於亞洲創業圈的無限可能。

東協（ASEAN）的GDP在2013年達到2.4兆美元，已是全球第七大經濟體，超過六億的人口不僅年輕，規模更勝北美或歐盟。為拓展東南亞經貿佈局，台灣政府推出的「新南向政策」，以擴大與東南亞之各國聯繫、創造雙邊人才交流為目標，可說與MillionDC.com的使命不謀而合。

總部設在台灣，我們的團隊將以台灣為樞紐，串連印尼、馬來西亞、泰國與菲律賓等各國的新創企業，並提供教育與媒合服務。現行的媒合平台多是為具高度創業知識的人才所設計，無法提供發展中國家所需的基礎資訊與資源，而MillionDC.com正是為發展中國家的新創所打造的平台。

期待你能助我們一臂之力，為台灣創業圈注入新的活力與機會，邁向亞洲新創中心之路！

請各界朋友多多協助分享此募資計劃，有興趣深入了解品牌願景或洽談合作機會者，歡迎Email至paolojoseph@millionDC.com。

story:
Celebrate Five Years of We Act Radio

We Act is a media corporation that combines broadcast and new media to deliver the voices of resistance in the formats people use most. We Act’s original programs can be found streaming at WeActRadio.com; on AM and FM radio stations around the country; on podcast; and livestreaming on We Act’s YouTube channel. After five years of operation, We Act Radio has grown to include the only state of the art television studio east of the Anacostia.

"The most progressive AM station in North America." - Congressman John Conyers

In the era of TRUMP

With a Trump administration in the nation's capital we need more visibility to amplify the voices of dissent and organize beyond the activist community. A new website and an electric powered station vehicle would provide the spark we need to create a movement that votes with it's dollars and prays with its feet.

This is not normal. We refuse to normalize fascism. We don't debate racism. We don't debate anti-semitism. We don't debate Islamophobia or Homophobia. We condemn it. We denounce it and we struggle to resist.

Our longtime motto is to #dosomething. If we exceed our $45k goal all additional funds will contribute to:

•Security & Alarm System Upgrade
•Expand Community Garden
•Broadcast Equipment Upgrade 
•Operation Expense

The impact of having a dedicated media outlet in the streets of the nation's capital rallying support for a very public economic resistance is of paramount importance to a working class community that can't afford to do it themselves. With our newly fully renovated storefront studio, We Act Radio is uniquely qualified to undertake this campaign after (5) years in operation with tours of duty providing indie media coverage in:

  • Occupy Wall Street, Zuccotti Park & Freedom Plaza
  • Ferguson, Missouri (2x)
  • Baltimore Uprising
  • No DAPL, Standing Rock

As part of our campaign of resistance, we will be using the new electronic car to travel around DC and identify EVERY SINGLE establishment that serves Yeungling beer that endorsed Trump and those that refuse to sell it to create a #YeunglingFreeDC and further the efforts of the Grab Your Wallet campaign.

Co-Founders

Kymone Freeman is an award winning playwright, activist and program director of We Act Radio. He is subject of one chapter of the book Beat of a Different Drum: African Americans Forging New Paths in Work and Life. (Hyperion) He was a major contributor to WAMU's #AnacostiUnmapped aired on NPR organizing against gentrification and promoting Community Land Trusts.

    Hosted the nationally televised NSA Rally Against Surveillance aired on C-SPAN  and the Save Our Safety Net Rally in the fight against austerity measures cutting social services held at City Hall before being thrown out the council chamber. He has appeared on TeleSur, CCTV, ZDF German TV, BBC, several French networks and is a regular guest on News One / TV One with Roland Martin and the Big Picture with Host Thom Hartmann as well as a guest columnist for the historic Ebony Magazine. 

    Alex Lawson is the Executive Director of Social Security Works, the convening member of the Strengthen Social Security Coalition— a coalition made up of over 340 national and state organizations representing over 50 million Americans. 

    Lawson has appeared on numerous TV and radio outlets including C-SPAN, FOX News and Al-Jazeera and is a frequent guest host of The Thom Hartmann Program, one of the top progressive radio shows in the country.

story:
The Problem

Every minute, 24 people around the world are forced to flee their homes. That’s 34,000 people a day who leave everything behind in the hope of finding safety and a better tomorrow. There are 66 million forcibly displaced persons in the world today and over 1.5 million refugees in Uganda alone, a country with only 40 million inhabitants. The refugees have fled mainly from Burundi, DR Congo, Somalia, Eritrea, Ethiopia and South Sudan and are facing an uncertain future.

The unemployment rate of youth in Uganda is high (83% according to UBOS) and opportunities are almost non-existent. On the other hand refugee youth has an enormous drive to be able to sustain themselves, generate income and create a dignified life for themselves, but they are seen as burden in different communities.

Our Solution

Since 2014 the Social Innovation Academy (SINA, http://www.socialinnovationacademy.org) educates former orphans, street children, refugees and other disadvantaged youth in Uganda to become job creators and social entrepreneurs with the ability to turn challenges into solutions. Over 20 newly created social enterprises have been impacting over 250,000 lives and won several international awards.

The first replication of the SINA model was successfully implemented in the Nakivale Refugee Camp in Uganda, where over 100,000 people live. In SINA OPPORTUNIGEE (http://www.socialinnovationacademy.org/opportun...) currently 40 young refugees are creating their own opportunities.

It is now time to scale the SINA model further and two dedicated teams of young refugees from the Democratic Republic of Congo will bring it to an urban slum in Kampala, where many refugees live and into Congo itself, in Bukavu, where many refugees come from.

The teams are creating unique self-learning spaces where young refugees unleash their potentials, create their own opportunities and develop their own passions into social businesses. They create their own jobs and contribute to the society they live in.

How it works

These self-learning spaces will allow young refugees in Uganda and marginalized youth in DR Congo to make a sustainable living out of what they are passionate about. By helping them to transform their lives, they become social entrepreneurs and job creators.

Through self-organization and *Freesponsibility*, the youth transforms their own personal tragedies and tackles the most pressing issues in their slums and local communities.

Within a supporting framework these young refugees and marginalized youth are in charge of themselves. The first thing taught is how they can teach themselves. The learning spaces then distribute all authority among them. Young people are gradually empowered to make autonomous decisions in their roles. Task groups define what is expected of each role and hold each other accountable. Roles are dynamically updated which lets the young people grow their skills in different areas.

The young people do the accounting for the learning spaces, connect to the government or handle all logistics and manage also income generating activities for self-sustainability.

Life-Coaching helps them to find their purpose or discover themselves and understand their difficult past as strength, rather than a subject of shame. Their life experiences are valuable assets that no one can learn in a school. 

Managing a social enterprise requires experience and the ability to lead, which can only be learned by actually leading. They get hands-on business skills and their project ideas are then mentored to become social enterprises.

Seeds have all ingredients to be able to flourish into strong plants; if the soil is not fertile the seedling will wither.

SINA Lazima Nipate in Kampala, the capital of Uganda, and SINA Bukavu in the DR Congo will re-pot withering students and nurture them until they flourish, bear fruits and pollinating even others.
There will be no courses, no right or wrong answers but solutions to the root causes of problems they and the society are facing.

Who we are

We are a team of six young refugees in Uganda and another team of four marginalized youth from DR Congo. We are all scholars in the Social Innovation Academy (SINA). We have become young leaders and transformed our difficult past into the motivation to support other refugees.

The empowerment and community at SINA had the effect, that we understood our past as strength, rather than a subject of shame and we want to do the same with others.

It is now upon us to bring the model forward to Kampala and to Bukavu DR Congo because our vision is “A world where young people are self-sustainable and contribute to the communities they are living in.“

We hope that young refugees and young people with challenging life stories and backgrounds, are no longer seen as a problem but an opportunity, bringing diversity, talent, skills and a different perspective into their (host) communities and the world. We know, based on our own stories, that they are able to unleash their potential, if they only get the right support.

What we need

We conducted interviews in different slums in Kampala and different communities in Bukavu to get feedback about the needs of youth there and to find the best suitable locations to replicate SINA. To establish these learning spaces we need 20.000 USD which will allow us to purchase land in Bukavu and Kampala.

We have already been able to raise funds for the plastic bottle construction of the facilities that will host SINA through a European plastic bottle producer. Together with the local communities, we will create our space, using 15.000 plastic bottles and old plastic containers. The construction will mark bold innovation, spark creativity and help our scholars to think outside the box.

Their life experiences are valuable assets that no one can learn in a school. Managing a social enterprise requires experience and the ability to lead, which can only be learned by actually leading. They get hands-on business skills and their project ideas are then mentored to become social enterprises.Seeds have all ingredients to be able to flourish into strong plants; if the soil is not fertile the seedling will wither.SINA Lazima Nipate in Kampala, the capital of Uganda, and SINA Bukavu in the DR Congo will re-pot withering students and nurture them until they flourish, bear fruits and pollinating even others.There will be no courses, no right or wrong answers but solutions to the root causes of problems they and the society are facing.Who we areWe are a team of six young refugees in Uganda and another team of four marginalized youth from DR Congo. We are all scholars in the Social Innovation Academy (SINA). We have become young leaders and transformed our difficult past into the motivation to support other refugees.The empowerment and community at SINA had the effect, that we understood our past as strength, rather than a subject of shame and we want to do the same with others.It is now upon us to bring the model forward to Kampala and to Bukavu DR Congo because our vision is “A world where young people are self-sustainable and contribute to the communities they are living in.“We hope that young refugees and young people with challenging life stories and backgrounds, are no longer seen as a problem but an opportunity, bringing diversity, talent, skills and a different perspective into their (host) communities and the world. We know, based on our own stories, that they are able to unleash their potential, if they only get the right support.What we needWe conducted interviews in different slums in Kampala and different communities in Bukavu to get feedback about the needs of youth there and to find the best suitable locations to replicate SINA. To establish these learning spaces we need 20.000 USD which will allow us to purchase land in Bukavu and Kampala.We have already been able to raise funds for the plastic bottle construction of the facilities that will host SINA through a European plastic bottle producer. Together with the local communities, we will create our space, using 15.000 plastic bottles and old plastic containers. The construction will mark bold innovation, spark creativity and help our scholars to think outside the box.

story:
The Interactive Stage is a unique STEAM toy that's fun for the entire family! 

Work with your kids to build their own version of the Interactive Stage while introducing them to the world of theater magic and programming concepts. Together you can direct, design and create your own stage performance.

 

The Interactive Stage is an open-ended toy that:

• Incorporates,theater arts, engineering, visual programming and storytelling. It sparks creativity and imagination  
• Empowers and motivates self-directed discovery and learning
• Ideal for ages 5-10

Our Baby Monster Group Story

My husband and I are both engineers and together we have two daughters. As we raised them we looked for toys to get them interested in STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering and Math), but we soon found that none of the STEM toys we bought held the interest of our daughters for long. Many parents encounter this issue but rather than be dissuaded by the STEM toy options out there, we decided that we'd try to change the landscape by inventing our own product.

Hear from Linda Chen, the founder of Baby Monster Group:

 

For backing at $75 level, you will get one manufactured Interactive Stage diorama kit and its software

 

Our third version of the prototype will soon be ready for manufacturing.   

In this version, you will have a software application optimized for young children's experiential programming through real-time feedback of all the electronics.  As our early backer, you will receive all software feature improvement and updates that can grow with your child's continuing interest in performing arts.  

This version of the hardware will include a robust theater stage for placing LED light strips, a motor, an RFID sensor and a micro-controller.  It will also come with RFID stickers, puppet stands and puppet templates.  The electronics are transportable to any existing play-set that your child already owns. 

While it is our first time doing so, we have experienced companies to guide us through the process.  The biggest challenge is the high cost of manufacturing and shipping, but we have consulted many experts to get the best estimates possible for getting the product manufactured, tested and shipped to final users.  

Our goal of $25,000 is the best estimate for minimum manufacturing order.   

 

The Impact

Research tells us that those who are underrepresented in STEM fields need to be encouraged early on.  

 

According to The Harris Project:

Only 1 in 5 students feel “very confident” when it comes to learning STEAM subjects. And hands-on learning tools have the potential to improve educational outcomes that prepare students for the future.

According to Claire Shipman, author of The Confidence Code for Girls:

Between elementary school and high school, girls experience a 30% drop in confidence.

 

Interactive Stage Projects That Our Students Have Created:      

Over the past two years, we have inspired over 200 students to create original stories, parades and concerts with the Interactive Stage at our workshops and after school programs.  We’ve seen students' excitement as they begin with creating a show from scratch and moving along to programming lights and motors. All the while, they are just doing what they do best, imagining and playing. Furthermore, they are being exposed to engineering and programming without being formally instructed to do so.   

 

 

 

What's In It For You?

Crowdfunding campaign backers can donate at several different tiers:

$15 - A Thank You Shout Out on our social media, and a subscription to Baby Monster Group's e-newsletter

$30 - Support a school/organization with other backers, get a thank you note/card from the kids you supported, and a subscription to Baby Monster Group's e-newsletter

$75 - You will receive one of the first Interactive Stage kits from this production run, and a subscription to Baby Monster Group's e-newsletter 

$150 - Receive one Interactive Stage kit + a second kit will be donated to a school/organization, and a subscription to Baby Monster Group's e-newsletter

$300 - five Interactive Stage kits for pre-school is perfect for teachers to create interactive shows for their students.  

$1,000 - Choose a teacher/instructor at a school/organization to receive 10 Interactive Stage kits with instructions and lesson plan materials, and a subscription to Baby Monster Group's e-newsletter.  This is just $10/student for use during one school year.  

 

What The Future Holds For Baby Monster Group

After our crowdfunding goal has been reached we will work on rolling out the Interactive Stage to pilot schools, nonprofits and organizations.

We also plan to expand our afterschool STEM programs and to invent more STEM toys.

 

Have a School Or A Teacher That You'd Like To Donate An Interactive Stage Kit To?

If you have a school/organization or a teacher/educator that you'd like to donate an Interactive Stage kit to, please email us at: bmgstage@gmail.com

Teachers or schools can also apply to have an Interactive Stage kit donated to them.

Teachers/educators and schools/organizations can apply to have an Interactive Stage kit donated to them, please email us at: bmgstage@gmail.com

 

Can't Donate? Here's How You Can Help

If monetary contribution isn't possible for you, we are continuing to seek volunteers to help us develop software on iOS and other platforms besides Android.  We are also needing volunteers to help us with PR, marketing and reaching educators. 

If you are an institution that can use Interactive Stage to support students STEM learning, please give us your contact information and we will find a way to work with you. You can reach us at: bmgstage@gmail.com

We understand that not everyone can make a contribution. You can help simply by spreading the word about our crowdfunding campaign and sharing it with someone you know who'd be interested in supporting us.

story:
OUR STORY

We're Craig and Shaun, two brothers from South London, but with Jamaica in our hearts and souls.

 

Our Mum and Nanny taught us to cook, and Original Flava is all about recipes that are vibrant,  Fun and FLAVAful. We started our Journey in 2016 showcasing cooking video from our nans house, building an online following of 600,000 and you’ve been a major part of the journey so far, and we want you to continue with us on our next step.



 

ORIGINAL FLAVA STUDIO

With the money raised we’ll move out of Nanny’s yard and build Original Flava Studios – a hub where we can really take the quality of our content to the next level, whilst impacting the next generation of chefs.

 

 

With your help, this new space will enable us to have the space and necessary equipment to produce more delicious recipes for you, and capture Caribbean food to the highest quality it deserves.

This means; More recipes, cooking shows, training, mentorship & opportunities for young chefs.

We want to give underrepresented young chefs a platform to showcase their talents & the opportunity to produce quality food content and give them the confidence to achieve greatness, and we need your help to do this.

 

EQUIPPING THE NEXT GENERATION OF CHEFS

 

We started Original Flava to help others, especially the younger generation, after the challenges we faced growing up we’re passionate about encouraging a brighter route for them.

We’ve had the privilege of teaching workshops in schools around London and Jamaica. It's great to And we want to impact even more students.

Your support will help go into more schools around the UK to teach students not just about Caribbean food, also, it's deep rooted history, empowering them . We believe cooking is an important life school, and can be a tool to ignite confidence.

 

ORIGINAL FLAVA COOKING COURSE

We’ll create The Original Flava Caribbean cooking course, a programme that teaches participants how to become the ultimate Caribbean chef! 

Alongside this course, we'll be producing a mentoring programme for young black chefs. Including giving scholarships to 10 young black chefs per year where they’ll be offered this course for free, plus 1-on-1 support, advice and tailored workshops equipping them to succeed in the food industry.

 

CHAMPIONING UNDERREPRESENTED FOOD CREATORS

We believe in representation, growing up, there were a small amount of black chefs on our screens. We feel its time that younger chefs see more chefs that look like them.

Original Flava Studios will be a platform where we'll give a wider platform for talented underrepresented food creators.

We've been blessed with a reach of over 4 million people per week online, and we want to share that with creators, by inviting them onto our new cooking shows that will give them the opportunity to showcase their raw & authentic talent.

 

ABOUT ORIGINAL FLAVA

Founded by brothers Craig & Shaun McAnuff, have built an online cooking platform of over 600,000 social media followers from their Nan's kitchen - bringing people together with Flavaful food.

They've gone on to have 2 x best selling cookbooks and have gained recognition and featured on some of the biggest brands & media platforms.

How can you help?

Be a part of the journey, and help us help the next generation of chefs. Donation come with fantastic rewards too!

Where will the money go?

Money raised will be going towards the maintenance of the space, part-time support staff, upgrade to our visual & cookery equipment. These will help us provide the necessary resources to achieve the above. If we do go over our goal, it will go towards getting more enhanced equipment, marketing & material costs, and support staff. No money will be going into our pocket.

BREAKDOWN

40% -  Studio rent for first 12 months

28% -  Visual, audio & cookery Equipment

20% - Part time staff

12% - Renovation

 

Thank you from the bottom of our hear for your support - Please Share via your friendship/familiy group

story:
A TEACHER AFFECTS ETERNITY!

My name is Pat Cruz. I believe that as educators, we have the superpower to inform communities and inspire grassroots action. This is why I started The Transcontinental Educator Artist Collective for Humanity = TEACH.

I believe Greta Thunberg: we are in a climate emergency! This young woman has done more to raise environmental awareness than any government entity and she has inspired me to take action. I realized, if this young student can accomplish this, imagine what we educators can do?

This is why we created the TEACH ClimateChangeAgents Project.

OUR GOAL: 

Activate Climate Change Initiatives in Communities Across the Globe through STEAM & Arts Integration.

 

OUR PLAN: 2 Fold - July 2021

1 - TEACH Climate Change Virtual Conference: will include: asynchronous workshops, keynotes, as will as live, interactive, arts integrated and STEAM workshops as well as discussion groups scheduled for different time zones. 

2 - TEACH ClimateChangeAgents Institute: A four day in-person institute with keynotes, interactive workshops, and room and board in Northern Italy. The institute will culminate STEAM presentations by participants which will be included in the Virtual Conference. 

 

YOUR IMPACT: 

ALL proceeds go towards the TEACH ClimateChangeAgents Project, which includes a Virtual Conference for up to 1000 educators, and an in-person institute in Italy for 15 or more educator leaders from around the world!

We feel it is important for this professional development to be available to ALL teachers, regardless of income.  This is why we hope to exceed our goal so that, in addition to providing free training, room, and board, we may also provide a travel stipend for all participants attending from outside of Europe. 

 

OUR TRACK RECORD:  

We have a strong team of STEAM educators/teaching artists who each have over 20 years of experience in education. Meet our TEACH TEAM:

Fernanda Aller, Scientist in Residence. Fer has a multidisciplinary background in Engineering, Agriculture Environmental Science with a postgraduate Sustainable Value Chain. This background has been essential to developing and work across different industries. Fer will speak on what we can do on a local level protect soil fertility to grow sustainable food with fewer resources and to produce affordable green energy to fight climate change.

Tambra Harris, Featured Teaching Artist. Tambra is Artistic Director of Giwayen Mata an award winning Dance, Percussion, and vocal ensemble that celebrates the richness of traditional Afrika. Tambra successfully developed the K-12 dance program at Atlanta’s first charter school, Charles R. Drew where her curriculum specialized in STEAM and arts integration, unifying the school community through African culture and the core values of Project Based Learning. 

Jeff Mather, Featured Teaching Artist. Jeff is a sculptor and interdisciplinary teaching artist. Since 2012 Jeff has served as the STEAM Artist in Residence at Drew Charter School, the first STEAM-certified charter school in Georgia. Since 2012 Mather has also worked at the Beverly Taylor Sorenson Arts Access program in Utah, a full inclusion arts program. When directing public art projects he always works in collaboration with other artists and community members. He is also a facilitator with Alternate ROOTS' Resources for Social Change training team.

John Morogiello, Facilitator. Artistic Director of Best Medicine Rep Theater Company and an Award Winning International Playwright.  His Engaging Shaw (Old Globe, Vienna’s English Theatre in Austria, New Jersey Rep, Oldcastle, and Abingdon Theatre Company off-Broadway) and Blame It On Beckett (Colony Theatre, Abingdon) have both been published by Samuel French. John provides playwriting residencies through The Maryland State Arts Council. He served as performing artists facilitator for the Teaching Artists Institute in for many years.

Federico Colombo, Facilitator -  docente di sostegno presso IC Silvio Pellico - Vedano Olona, Cultore della Materia, Universita Cattolica del Sacro Cuore. Federico is a great educator and university professor who integrates the arts with physics in the primary grades. Federico is a community connector who seems to know everyone in Italy! He has coordinated our partnership with the Astronomical Observatory Foundation of Tradate. He is also the founder of the STEAM and Arts Integration in Education group in Italy.

Pat Cruz, Director. I have been facilitating and directing Institutes for over 2 decades.  I worked for the Maryland State Board of Education's summer arts integration institute, MATI, for over a decade. I have taught arts integration courses at Towson University and University of Maryland in Baltimore County (UMBC). I am the founding director of the Teaching Artists Institute in Maryland. I am honored to have been recognized by my peers in 2017 when I received the Linda Popp Leadership Award from The Maryland Art Education Association in 2017.

We will utilize Wiggins and McTighe's Understanding By Design (UbD) framework and Design thinking, a human-centered approach to innovation.

 

OUR PARTNERS:

Astronomical Observatory Foundation of Tradate "Messier 13"

STEAM & Arts Integration in Education

Taikoza EastWinds Non-Profit

Graduate Credit available through UMBC - University of Maryland Baltimore County

 

RISKS & CHALLENGES

If we fail to raise the full $30,000, we will design this program like a typical Institute (the old way) - where only those who can afford to attend participate. But, we believe there is a better way. We believe by hosting a Creative Challenge to select the participating teachers we will find the dynamic educational leaders who will inspire others to become environmental citizens who take immediate action.

If we fail to meet our goal we will offer spots for sale in January 2021. We will offer one or more free spots, based on how much we raise ($1500 = 1 free spot). 

If the pandemic makes it impossible to conduct the institute in July 2021, then we will host a virtual conference in July 2021, and postpone the in-person Institute until July 2022.

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP!

Some people are unable to contribute financially, but that doesn't mean you can't help.

  • PLEASE talk to people about the TEACH Climate Change Project! Help us get the word out and reach our goal of 1000 teacher memberships by Dec 31, 2020. This pilot program will be a prototype for conducting similar institutes around the world.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools! "Sharing" is not enough - TALKING about our TEACH ClimateChangeAgent Project is better!
  • Any pro-bono marketing or video production work is most welcome!
  • Volunteers Needed! We need:
    • a very organized person who can dedicate 2-3 hrs a week on administrative work for this campaign.

We are in a climate emergency. We are asking you to be an emergency responder! It is amazing what we can accomplish when we all pool our resources to serve the common good. 

 "A teacher affects eternity. They can never tell where their influence stops."

If we fail to raise the full $30,000, we will design this program like a typical Institute (the old way) - where only those who can afford to attend participate. But, we believe there is a better way. We believe by hosting a Creative Challenge to select the participating teachers we will find the dynamic educational leaders who will inspire others to become environmental citizens who take immediate action.
If we fail to meet our goal we will offer spots for sale in January 2021. We will offer one or more free spots, based on how much we raise ($1500 = 1 free spot). 
If the pandemic makes it impossible to conduct the institute in July 2021, then we will host a virtual conference in July 2021, and postpone the in-person Institute until July 2022.
 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP!
Some people are unable to contribute financially, but that doesn't mean you can't help.

PLEASE talk to people about the TEACH Climate Change Project! Help us get the word out and reach our goal of 1000 teacher memberships by Dec 31, 2020. This pilot program will be a prototype for conducting similar institutes around the world.
Use the Indiegogo share tools! "Sharing" is not enough - TALKING about our TEACH ClimateChangeAgent Project is better!
Any pro-bono marketing or video production work is most welcome!
Volunteers Needed! We need:a very organized person who can dedicate 2-3 hrs a week on administrative work for this campaign.


We are in a climate emergency. We are asking you to be an emergency responder! It is amazing what we can accomplish when we all pool our resources to serve the common good.  "A teacher affects eternity. They can never tell where their influence stops."

story:
In a nutshell:

This holiday season, we hope you consider giving the gift of a brighter future to a group of high-potential students from underserved communities in Minnesota. Silicon North Stars provides 24 eighth-graders every year with an opportunity to meet with tech leaders in our ecosystem - and create their own startup companies together. We're raising $10,000 in our holiday campaign to support our program in it's 7th year, ensuring it remains 100% cost-free to every student.

Read more about our program in the Star Tribune: http://strib.mn/2Y4bF7S

Hi everyone,

This holiday season, we hope you consider giving the gift of a brighter future to a group of high-potential students from underserved communities in Minnesota. With your help, we can empower them to pursue their dreams of careers in tech.

Every year, our non-profit Silicon North Stars brings 24 eighth-graders together for a one-week tech camp. They tour tech companies large and small in the Twin Cities, and learn the basics of entrepreneurship - so that they can enter high school with a vision for their future and, most importantly, a belief that they can achieve their dreams. 

We're raising $10,000 in our holiday campaign to ensure these kids can participate in our program cost-free. This is our 7th year of Silicon North Stars. By the end of this campaign we'll have brought over 115 students into our unique program.

 

What is the challenge we're trying to solve?

For kids who come from underserved communities, imagining a career in technology can be tough. Role models are hard to find, and there’s no clear path to success in front of them. Yet at the same time, the tech industry desperately needs to diversify its workforce - studies show that the more diverse a company is, the better products it creates and the happier its workforce becomes. Talent is universal, but access to opportunity is not.

That’s where Silicon North Stars comes in. Each year, we select 24 students from underrepresented communities in Minnesota’s Twin Cities and bring them together for a unique, one-week technology camp. They visit the campuses and meet with professionals from some of our state's most successful tech companies, they set goals during a career counseling session, and then create and pitch their own startup ideas to the Twin Cities tech community.

After the camp, they join students from previous classes in meetups once per quarter. These Saturday morning visits to companies help the students stay connected with the Twin Cities tech community and each other, and keeps them rooted in the goals that they set during the camp.

We're building a community that we believe will build the future of the tech community in Minnesota.

What does this all cost?

Our annual operating costs are $125,000. This includes all operational costs for the organization, travel, accommodations, and Minnesota-based programming. We’re firmly committed to offering membership 100% free to every student. 

New this year: we're hiring an executive director who will work full time to grow our programming and support for students - including a scholarship program for our junior class to help make post-secondary study possible. 

You can find out more about us at www.siliconnorthstars.org.

We truly appreciate your support!

With Gratitude,

Mary and Steve Grove

Co-founders of Silicon North Stars

story:
"IF YOU WANNA RULE"

is a musical children's book about a little girl named Piper and her magical dog Penelope 

that will help parents instill great values

in their children in a very fun and friendly way.  

Piper and Penelope are both great performers who encounter some of the same obstacles all children experience in life.  Children and their parents will have a lot of fun reading and singing along with these lovable characters. 

 

HOW YOU CAN HELP!

 

Our beautiful book is completed and all we need from our Indiegogo Supporters is for you to purchase your very own personal copy.   We would like to put an order in for no less than 100 books to start,  and we are asking for your support in the printing process by buying a copy of the book for $29. We will be sure to give you a big shout out on social media as well!!!

 

If you'd like an autographed copy of the book,

please choose the 2nd perk for $49 and we will of course, in addition, give you a big shout out on social media!

 

If you decide to donate $300 or more to our campaign you will receive an autographed copy of IF YOU WANNA RULE, A SHOUT OUT ON SOCIAL MEDIA, A COOL T-SHIRT and DINNER ON US!!!

story:
We are looking for people like you to join our team to establish Organic Farming Demonstration Farms that train youths, women and agricultural students in Africa.

Through our practical and academic experience, we have designed a system that can use Organic Farms to create more economic opportunities and leverage Africa's youth demographic and agricultural natural resources advantages. We designed the system to be self-sustaining and we called it STAC - which means Smart Transfer of Agro Capacities (STAC). It is a combination of Smart Tools and training systems for improved agricultural productivity. We designed it as a capacity-building strategy that affords the participant to acquire the knowledge and technical skills needed to be self-employed or employable. Each unit of STAC will train 100 youths practical skills needed to operate a successful and profitable organic farm.

We have also built a robust team of partners in Nigeria, Rwanda and the United States. We are setting up the first set of demonstration farms at the University of Ibadan and Obafemi Awolowo University in Nigeria, as well as the University of Rwanda.

Even though each unit of STAC will be self-sustaining once established, we still need help from people like you. We need funds to establish the first set of demonstration farms. These demonstration farms can unlock the potential of thousands of youths in Africa and contribute to global food security and sustainable development.

Will you support us and together inspire a critical mass of agricultural entrepreneurs, innovators, and change-makers in Africa?

Why the campaign?

We need $15,000 to establish each of the Organic Agriculture Demonstration Farm. All the money generated through this campaign will be used for two things:

  1. Set up the irrigation systems, permanent beds, and storage systems
  2. Develop Community Supported Agriculture Marketing System.

Did you know?

  • Africa has the largest population of young people in the world (nearly 420 million people between the age of 15 and 35).
  • 72% of youth in Africa are unemployed or vulnerably employed.
  • Africa holds two-thirds of the world’s remaining arable land.
  • Nigeria holds 60% of all arable lands in West Africa covering over 80 million hectares of uncultivated arable lands.
  • Africa's greatest opportunity to play on the global scene lies in Agriculture.
  • Food production needs to increase by 70% to nourish a rapidly growing global population estimated to reach 9 billion by 2050.

Our Story & Motivation

Cornelius grew up in Nigeria. He started an Organic vegetable farm with an equivalent of $20 after graduating from college. The farm grew and ended up employing fifteen people within 3 years. 

Cedric is from Rwanda. He lived in a refugee camp and experienced hunger for most of his childhood. But along the line, he got the opportunity to have ACCESS to education and acquire practical skills to lift himself out of poverty.

Now, we have both earned master and PhD degrees, working on groundbreaking research, and serving on boards of a various international development organization.

We want to use our experience, knowledge, and privileges to educate, train, and inspire a generation of agricultural entrepreneurs, innovators, and change-makers for sustainable agricultural development in Africa. But we need more people to join our team to make this happen.

Join us and together inspire a critical mass of agricultural entrepreneurs, innovators, and change-makers in Africa.

Risks and challenges

We are tenacious and will push forward despite any conditions. With each donation however you will make the journey move much more swift and meaningful. Thank you again for joining us on this journey.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Tell your friends, family, and coworkers about the campaign.

  • Follow us on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram and share our posts.

  • Share our video far and wide.

People like you help us make this dream a reality.  

Please join us!

 

To Learn More About Us:

Read more about Cornelius here

Read more about Cedric here

story:
Project summary

What is this project?

This project is an indoor international children's play center, where kids can build lifelong fun experiences through three creative play areas. We will provide an indoor playground, theater area for performing arts and children events, along with a science and discover area.
 

How will the funds bring it to life?

The costed are derived from leasing of the facility in Leipzig, Germany, design production & renovation, marketing, exhibits, man-power, and fabrication. We will also be hosting a bio-based cafe area which provides healthy balanced snacks and beverages for our guest to purchase. 

 

Who is the creator?

The founder is DeLondon Hawthorne, a father, a business owner and sports trainer for kids from Chicago, USA. He is living since the last year in Leipzig, Germany and he is trying to make a difference in the german community and bring something new to the city. 

 

Project description

We are raising funds to bring to the city of Leipzig, Germany a new concept in child growth and learning through play. We are looking to lease, what once was an old grocery store operation and transforming the space into a wonderful indoor play and learning center for kids ages 1-10 to participate in montessori style games and activities. The aim is to have children find ways on their own to be creative and develop life long memories that will remain for a lifetime.

I believe in the magic of children and with the right resources presented to them their power to be inspiring and creative is unmeasurable. We live in a highly technological world, where to often we are not allowed to express our true talents. Through natural play and discovery, I believe that talent can be found again and adored. The Wonder Works, as the name portrays, provides such an environment for a child to display their potentials through constructive play. 

Our plan will be to build a three section play area, which will include; a tree house play  area with a two small pretend villages namely a bakery and an animal hospital, a theater stage area where kids can make their own performances and productions from various back-drops and costumes, and thirdly an area hosting a natural science and exhibition center with thinking games, experiments, water crafts, and so much more.

 

Risks and challenges

Our main challenge is to reach the total budget of the project.
