UPDATE: If you're in the Atlanta area, please join us for a free workshop and discussion with Thecla Harris, Artistic Director of PS Broadway, on Wednesday, February 18 at 4:00 on the Emory University campus.  1602 Fishburne Drive, Room 205, Atlanta, GA 30322
We need:


Volunteer Teaching Assistants to work with Thecla Harris in-school February 18-20 and during the final performance on February 21.
A restaurant sponsor (or ambitious volunteers) to provide a healthy meal for the children before their final performance on February 21.  

Thank you!
We would like to thank our sponsor at Fifth Third Bank Broadway in Atlanta for the generous ticket donation.
Fifth Third Bank Broadway in Atlanta is the premier presenter of touring Broadway productions in Atlanta. Over the past 34 years, more than 3 million guests have enjoyed more than 160 Broadway In Atlanta shows at the historic Fox Theatre in Midtown Atlanta.  To learn more, visit BroadwayInAtlanta.com.  

Special thanks to:
The Lovett Foundation

The Emory University Department of Film and Media Studies
Theater Emory and Janice Akers
Rosie's Theater Kids
Colin Niebergall

Jordan Flowers

story:
What is Tutornauts?

We are an online learning platform that enables tutors/instructors to teach students one-to-one, in real time, anytime, anywhere.

What is in it for me as a student?

As a student, you get to:

  • Schedule a lesson that fits your budget
  • Choose a tutor
  • Post questions and get answers (Homework Help!)
  • Learn academic subjects, skills or expertise from tutors/instructors all over the world
NEW UPDATES TO PERKS!
  • Contribute to any Student Perk and choose to have lessons with any of our Featured Tutors!
  •  Select any Student Perk and get 5 BONUS CREDITS when you sign up! (22 Jan 2015)
FEATURED TUTORS

                                 

Mr Jimmy Ling (9 Credits per hour)
- Teaches Primary Math, Secondary Math, Additional Math and  Elementary Math (O-levels), JC1/JC2  H1/H2 Math (A-levels).
- Graduated from National University of Singapore with a degree in Mathematics
- 10 years of experience

Mr Jerry Lee (9 Credits per hour)
- Teaches English, all levels - Primary, Secondary and  JC General Paper, Essay writing ( Creative Writing, Narrative, Expository, Persuasive.)
- Graduated from Nanyang Technological University with a degree in Engineering
- 5 years of experience

What is in it for me as a tutor/instructor?

As a tutor/instructor, you get to:

  • Earn money by teaching students online
  • Earn money providing solutions to students' questions
  • Set your own fees per hour 
  • Decide your own schedule
  • Teach anything!  (Academic subjects, expertise or skills)
  • *Huge demand for English tutors in Asia*


How will your contribution be used?

Your contributions will be used to:

  • Fund the operating costs at the start
  • Improve on existing functions
  • Add on new functions (your feedback will be appreciated!)


Referral Scheme Bonus!

Refer a friend to our crowd funding campaign and if he/she contributes to our campaign, 10 extra credits will be credited into your student account when you sign up as a student.  Do remember to use the share buttons provided above so that we can track your referrals!  


Be part of South East Asia's Online Learning Revolution!

The e-learning industry in South East Asia is still at its infancy, with many people still clinging on to the traditional ways of learning, resisting change.  We feel that we can push for progress in the region by proving to everyone the endless possibilities and opportunities that come with online education.  

Launching out of Singapore, we are blessed with a diverse community of individuals from various cultural backgrounds.  We feel this is not only advantageous, but also essential in building the early foundations of the Tutornauts Online Learning Platform.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you do not wish to contribute, you can still:

  • Sign up for our mailing list to keep up-to-date with our launch at http://tutornauts.launchrock.com
  • Share this project with a friend ! ( Do use the share buttons above!)

Some screen shots of our website (Under Construction):

Main Page


Student Registration Page


Subjects Page


Tutor Search Function


Virtual Classroom - teach students in real time.  Display notes in pdf, doc, jpeg, png formats. Mindmap provided by www.designcognition.com.


Virtual Classroom - teach students in real time.  Learn Math with efficient drawing of  graphs, shapes and  writing of equations.

Expected Launch Date: 24 February 2015



FAQs

1. What are credits and how are they used?

Credits are used to purchase services on Tutornauts.  Services include lessons with tutors/instructors or Asking a Question (Homework Help.)  Lessons with tutors can start from 5 credits per hour; Asking A Question costs 5 credits.

2.  How are the credits sold?

The credits are sold in packages of 10, 30, 50 and 100.  (The price of the credit packages you pay at this campaign are discounted from the normal price!)

3. What are the tutor's working hours and salary?

The tutors plan and decide their own schedule, lessons and fees per hour.  The tutors will earn 80% of all fees collected.  (Tutors who contributed to this campaign, get to earn 90% of all fees collected, for a period of time based on the perks selected.)

4.  How will the tutors be paid?

Tutors will be paid via Paypal.  

5.  I am a tutor and I have referred people who have contributed.  How can I claim my extra credits?

The extra credits will only be credited to your student account.  If you do not have a student account, you will need to open one.  However, do take note that the credits cannot be converted back to cash.


More Questions? Get in Touch with Us!

General enquiries :   enquiry@tutornauts.com

Student enquiries:   studentsupport@tutornauts.com

Tutor enquiries:        tutorsupport@tutornauts.com

story:
The Trip:

In April, I will be working with The Archibald Project (TAP) and Sole Hope along with other artists to serve the beautiful people of Uganda.

The Archibald Project is an orphan care media organization, and tells stories that promote adoption, foster care, volunteer opportunities, sponsorship and resettlement. Resettlement means that not only do they promote adoption of eligible orphans, but they promote supporting birth parents and help them to get their child out of an orphanage and back to where they belong: with their family. Through their stories, fewer children will be called orphans.

Sole Hope works towards preventing diseases that enter through the feet in impoverished communities through foot treatment clinics, education, and teaching the trade of shoe making. Many of the people they treat are orphans and the elderly.

I have the privilege of going to Jinja, Uganda to serve with Sole Hope and to use my love of photography to share their mission with the world through The Archibald Project. You can learn more about our April Media Mission here.

How you can help:

Firstly, you can help by praying for me and the others on my trip. We will all be out of our comfort zones and we ask for you to pray for wisdom, strength, and compassion so that we may serve the people we meet to the best of our ability.

You can also serve along with me by helping me raise the funds to get to Uganda. Here is what the money you donate will go toward:

• Transportation. A large chunk of the cost of the trip is the flight. But once we're in Uganda, gas and drivers are very expensive as they're not as prevalent as they are in the US.

• Housing and Food. Most of the trip will be spent staying in the Sole Hope guesthouse and we want to make sure to give them the funds they need to operate and cover the cost of feeding us.

• Lastly, a portion of the funds will go to support The Archibald Project in everything they do such as provide a tiny salary for the full time staff (they have to live too) and the orphanages with every day expenses.

story:
Summary

Hello, 

My name is Joe and I live in the UK. I am a father of 4 and this project is very important to me. My children have the opportunity for a great education in the UK. Plenty of schools and funding means they are able to get the best start in life. For so many children around the world this is not the case. 

The national illiteracy rate in Madagascar has reached 80% and the region Azafady works in (Anosy, SE) is one of the least developed parts of the country following decades of almost no intervention by the state or other service providers to maintain the education infrastructure.This school was built in 1968 and has not been renovated since. 1 in 2 children have never been to school and over 2 in 3 have not completed primary education. This situation contributes to perpetuating a poverty cycle.

I am asking for donations to support a community in Madagascar to repair their school for students aged 7 - 16 . The building will be fitted with a new roof, windows and doors, a new partition-wall between the two classrooms and the cracked and chipped walls will be rendered. 40 desks and benches and a new blackboard will be provided and the refurbished school will be fully rendered, helping to protect the clay bricks whilst creating a safe environment to learn in and to be proud of.

Where the money goes

I need to raise £1800 to be able to join the volunteer program. This is made up of the following costs:

£595 - Cost of volunteer program

£925 - Flights

£90 - Travel insurance

£190 - Vaccinations that are not free such as rabies and Hep A + B.

The Impact

The repair will improve the learning environment at the school increasing the quality of education available through the provision of desks, benches and resources. The separation of the two rooms will enable each class to work independently from one another. The repair of the roof will allow more time to be focused on learning rather than sweeping away water and this will also protect books and materials. Overall, students, teachers and the wider community will benefit for generations to come.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

Spread the word about this campaign by sharing with as many people as possible. It's that easy.

Thank you.

story:
A S K  ,   S E E K    &     K N O C K



OVERVIEW


This campaign presents a unique opportunity for you to support my studies in Film&Television outside of my country.  Some might think of film as a hobby. Shooting a video might be a novel interest, maybe even relaxing. And that's the main point. If you love doing something, do it for life. Glorify God with your life.




So why study film in the U.S.?


One benefit is that the film industry is worldwide. The earliest filming devices were developed by inventors from all over the world. Simon von Stampfer from Austria, Joseph Plateau from Belgium and William Horner from in Britain all developed an early type of film equipment in the 1830s.
That excitement still continues today as film is a diversion enjoyed by most people around the world. Although the U.S. film industry is still active, "a shift in production of theatrical motion pictures from the U.S. continues to grow as countries all over the world introduced incentives," according to a press release by Center for Entertainment Industry Data and Research.

"There were $13.8 billion in film and television exports in 2009, up 3% over 2008, and up 37% over 2005," according to the Motion Picture Association of America's fact sheet.

All these numbers mean that international students studying film in the U.S. will get a chance to use their skills all over the world on production shoots and other film related activities as well as interact and plan with other countries as the American film industry branches out to other countries.

Another benefit to studying film in the U.S. is the wide availability of production companies and jobs in film located in America. Many of the large studios are located in Hollywood, California. New York City is also a hub for the film industry. But with production companies located all over the U.S., international students studying film have freedom to choose where they will live.



"We all have dreams. But in order to make dreams come into reality, it takes an awful lot of determination, dedication, self-discipline, and effort." - Jesse Owens

T    H    E         G    O    A    L



For I know the plans I have for you,” declares the Lord, “plans to prosper you and not to harm you, plans to give you hope and a future. Jeremiah 29:11


Everyone loves films, right? We have all grown up in front of the silver screen and we all become captivated by the excitement and escapism it offers.

There is a slightly surreal quality to the cinema experience; you walk into an unlit cave and sit next to strangers in total darkness and silence. Then, when the forty-foot high screen lights up, suddenly we lose ourselves in the beautiful imagery, the rich sound design and truthful acting that leaves us feeling different, changed from when we started. The alchemy of film is certainly potent.

It is hardly surprising that many people, with time, grow dissatisfied with simply going to the cinema, just watching movies, just eating popcorn. Instead the creative urges become hard to resist. We begin to watch movies and think about how we would have done it. We start to look at our own life, our own thoughts and experiences; wondering what they would look like projected 40 feet high. Film offers us a chance to share our own unique take on the world around us.
And my goal is to take that chance to share with others the grace of God. His gospel. And make Him famous through the media because that's worth it. Imagine sharing the Gospel by a 40 feet high wall with around 350 people listening quietly and paying attention for at least an hour and a half. Honduras is a country that is constantly growing in the social media, We need to take advantage of it and glorify God. 

                 P U R S U I T

              T H E   G R E A T

       O P P O R T U N I T I E S  

           


''Making the most of every opportunity, because the days are evil.'' Ephesians 5:16

What type of person should become a film student? Well, to quote Danny Boyle, 'to be a filmmaker, you have to be relentless. You have to be psychotic in your desire to do something and keep working. People always like the easy route. You can’t, you have to push very hard to get something unusual, something different to stand out.'


T H E  N E E D 


In order to study Film&Television in the U.S I need approximately $45,000 to afford tuition and living expenses for two years. I'm currently saving every penny that I can with my parents to afford the other two years. This project is meant to knock every door as possible and letting everything else in God's hands. God haves a perfect timing and a perfect plan. It's all about Him after all. 

$ 4 5 , 0 0 0 



He replied, “Because you have so little faith. Truly I tell you, if you have faith as small as a mustard seed, you can say to this mountain, ‘Move from here to there,’ and it will move. Nothing will be impossible for you.”                                                 Matthew 17:20

R I S K S  &  C H A L L E N G E S


The main risk & challenge would be to trust God. The risk of not completing the fundraise  is a big one. But If God's with me, who's against me? Please join me in this journey of faith and let's embrace what will come next. Please share this campaign with freinds and family. And if you're able/willing to support you are more than welcome. Thanks in advance for everything.

story:
This summer four friends will be driving across North America with a mission: to see a little bit of the world and make it just a little bit better. Us four adventurers, Morgan Campbell, Dylan Evans, Harrison Tanner, and Alex Tomaszewski will be buying a yellow 48 passenger school bus and turning it into an RV. We'll fire up that bad boy and leave Toronto heading west across Canada, south down the coast, east through the southern United States, and finally back home, going with the road and stopping where we will. 

In each major city we stop in along the way we'll spend a day volunteering our time at an array of organizations. These will include food banks, tree planting, habitat-for-humanity, and other community based outreach programs. Through these experiences our hope is to bring positivity to the communities we visit and do some good on the road. Our overarching hope is to inspire others to follow in our footsteps and travel with a purpose.

Alex, our newest Northern Lights member, very recently decided to join the team. Throughout the trip he will be collecting footage of our experiences and conducting interviews of team members, organization leaders, and individuals we meet along the way. With that footage we will be creating a documentary that will focus on the concept of voluntourism and giving back to the communities one visits. This documentary will allow us to share our message on a broad scale.  We will be able to spread our message, travel with a purpose, to communities far and wide.

The donations we receive will be used to purchase the school bus, renovate and adapt it, fill her up with fuel to keep her moving, and ultimately get us from one volunteer organization to the next. With your support we can make this dream a reality!

Listed below is the route we will be taking and the organizations we will be volunteering at:

Winnipeg, MB 

Winnipeg Harvest - http://winnipegharvest.org/ 

-

Calgary, AB 

The Mustard Seed - https://www.theseed.ca/ 

-

Vancouver, BC  

TBD 

-

Seattle, WA 

Restore Dead Horse Canyon - http://volunteer.truist.com/uwkc/org/10317298969.html 

-

Portland, OR

Friends of Tryon Creek - http://www.tryonfriends.org/ 

-

San Francisco, CA 

Friends of Alemany Farm - http://www.alemanyfarm.org/   

Bike Kitchen - http://bikekitchen.org/               

-

Flagstaff, AZ

Flagstaff Family Food Center - http://www.hotfood.org/           

-

Santa Fe, NM

story_txt:
This summer four friends
will be driving across North America with a mission: to see a little bit of the
world and make it just a little bit better. Us four adventurers, Morgan
Campbell, Dylan Evans, Harrison Tanner, and Alex Tomaszewski will be buying a yellow 48 passenger
school bus and turning it into an RV. We'll fire up that bad boy and leave
Toronto heading west across Canada, south down the coast, east through the
southern United States, and finally back home, going with the road and stopping
where we will. 
In each major city we stop
in along the way we'll spend a day volunteering our time at an array of
organizations. These will include food banks, tree planting,
habitat-for-humanity, and other community based outreach programs. Through
these experiences our hope is to bring positivity to the communities we visit
and do some good on the road. Our overarching hope is to inspire others to
follow in our footsteps and travel with a purpose.
Alex, our newest Northern Lights member, very recently decided to join the team. Throughout the trip he will be collecting footage of our
experiences and conducting interviews of team members, organization leaders, and individuals we meet along the way. With that footage we will be creating a documentary that will focus on the concept of voluntourism and giving back to the communities one visits. This documentary will allow us to share our message on a broad scale.  We will be able to spread our message, travel with a purpose, to communities far and wide.
The donations we receive will be used to purchase the school bus, renovate and adapt it, fill her up with fuel to keep her moving, and ultimately get us from one volunteer organization to the next. With your support we can make this dream a reality!Listed below is the route we will be taking and the
organizations we will be volunteering at:
Winnipeg, MB 
Winnipeg Harvest - http://winnipegharvest.org/ 
-
Calgary, AB 
The Mustard Seed - https://www.theseed.ca/

story:
*We are accepting payments by Paypal only.

Our Story

Three years ago, coaches John Devlin, John Commins and Colin Throness decided they had enough talent between Perspectives I and II to enter a team into the Greater Montreal Athletics Association’s Division 1. It was a long season and the team only managed one victory. The next year, with the addition of Options II coach Paul Berry, the coaches approached the GMAA about letting other alternative schools (of which there are ten in total) provide the team with players. The proposal was accepted and thus the Alternative United Pit Bulls were born. 

They entered GMAA’s Division 1 again, sourcing players from five different schools. This very talented group of ballers immediately made a name for themselves as a tough, passionate and scrappy team. They posted 7 wins and 4 losses and made the playoffs in dramatic fashion, but lost narrowly in the quarter finals.

That summer Gatorade found an article about Alternative United in the Montreal Gazette. They contacted the coaches and asked to make a promotional video about the team as part of their online series, Win From Within. Gatorade shot the video in early October, at the outset of the season, and released it in January to huge accolades. It quickly went viral and the media coverage around the team blew up: CBC, Global, Sportsnet Central, Breakfast Television and the Gazette all did stories on the Pit Bulls fantastic and growing success.

As a thanks for making the video, Gatorade sent the whole team by train to Toronto to take in a Raptors game in a luxury suite. The players were spoiled with a two-course meal at Real Sports Bar & Grill and were greeted in their luxury box with great Raptors swag, t-shirts and hats, and pizzas and snacks, as well as some of the best seats in the house. The Raptors must have been inspired by the Pit Bulls presence, because in Alternative United fashion they mounted a late comeback and won the game in the dying seconds.

Fuelled by all the excitement, the Pit Bulls won their last game of the season in the dying seconds to tie for a playoff spot. Sadly they lost the tiebreaker against Greaves in a scrappy and exciting tilt. But the season had already been deemed a success – Alternative United was now an internationally celebrated high school franchise.

Fundraising Campaign

There are two reasons we’re raising money. Firstly, we’re looking for a basketball court to call home. The schools all have gyms, but none of them are adequate to host games. We do have practices, but the gym we use is only big enough to play 4-on-4. We’ve got our future home base narrowed down to two venues: either the YMCA downtown or the Little Burgundy Sports Centre. Both are great options in terms of location and environment.

The second reason we’re looking for funding is to provide tutoring for the players and other alternative-school students who are in need. The tutoring centre will be called the Alternative United Headquarters and it will ideally be located near to or in the same building as our home court. While there are occasionally tutors available at our schools, budgets have been cut in the past year and individual academic attention is harder to come by for our students. There are thousands of university students who are capable and willing to help as volunteers, interns and part-time staff. It’s time to get the ball rolling.

Our players and students are considered youth at risk, learning disabled, behavioural problems, delinquents – there are plenty of labels, too many to list. We want to help break these young people free from those often harmful stamps and the best way to do that is to lead by example. None of us would have read this far if we hadn’t had good people encouraging us to keep learning.

We’re reaching out to you, the people who know and care about the social issues that our players and students face. There is a subtle and crippling bigotry inherent in having low expectations for people. We can’t up on youth before they give up in themselves. Not only do we believe our students can succeed if they put their hearts into it, we know they will succeed. 

If we can’t show them how to believe and know in themselves, then who will? If we can’t show them how to reach out and help someone, who will? 

Alternative United Headquarters

The simple equation behind the Alternative United Headquarters is to offer team members and other Outreach students free tutoring and a healthy snack after school. It’s no secret that many of the students in the Outreach system do not have enough access to one-on-one education and will not get a high school diploma without help. Private tutors don’t come cheap these days and the government has cut funding to in-school tutors, so our schools have had trouble providing the usual and necessary supply of supplementary instruction. But just because tutoring budgets were cut doesn’t mean our students don’t need tutors anymore – quite the opposite, in fact. 

The goal is to set up a tutoring centre that’s near our home court, if not in the same building. The YMCA and Little Burgundy Sports Centre are both viable options and discussions are underway. The Headquarters will hire both veteran tutors and junior volunteers, such as undergrad students and student teachers. This bright young team of academics, future professionals and teachers will also get involved with a homemade snack program provided to all students who attend. The tutoring centre will ideally be open four days a week, three hours a day after school.


Thank you for your support!

story:
Nepal was shaken by a 7.8 magnitude earthquake on April 25th 2015 at 06:11:26 UTC claiming 1900 lives so far and the death toll still rising. Mother nature's wrath has left this small Himalayan nation in treamendous destruction and fright as the after shocks are still shaking different cities (almost 70 aftershocks so far). There is no account of the total lives lost and property damages but one thing is for sure that it will be a lot. So please let's come together as a citizen of this earth and help those people in need by donating and sharing this link as much as possible.

We are a 501c3 non profit organization NAFA (Nepalis and Friends Association) based in Arizona, USA.

story:
The Scoop

My name is Lucas Bessey and I live in Boston with my beautiful wife, Sonia. We are expecting our first baby in September! Praise the Lord! Pray for us. Seriously.

I am a Technology teacher at Veritas Christian Academy. A huge part of my curriculum is teaching students how to type. Right now there are no appropriate typing sites for young techies to practice their typing skills on. The typing sites that do exist are:

  • loaded with advertisements that tend to be inappropriate
  • full of sentences that add no eternal value to the young student's life

TypeChrist offers a Godly solution to this problem. At TypeChrist.com students will never be exposed to inappropriate advertisements again, and they will be learning to type through the living Word of God!   

Our Costs

Virtually all of the money we raise here on Indiegogo is for developing the website. We are hiring my good friend Sam to lead development. Sam is a front-end web developer at TED. He is one of the most Godly and talented  people I have ever met and I have no doubt in his ability to bring TypeChrist to life.  

Eternal Impact

Paul teaches us in Ephesians that the Sword of the Spirit is the Word of God. By joining us you can be a part of something eternally significant. TypeChrist will give the world access to the Word of God in a way that they did not have before. If 2nd graders start typing on TypeChrist and continue throughout junior high, by the time they are going into high school they will have memorized a huge portion of Scripture. The fruit of this is really exciting to think about! 

The Challenge

Programming is an art. The greatest challenge we face is designing a product that has all the cool functionality and yet is still simple. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that you may not be able to support us financially. More than anything we ask for your prayers. 

Specific Prayer Points:

  • Pray that God will be glorified through TypeChrist.
  • Pray that souls would be ministered to through TypeChrist.
  • Pray that doors would be opened so that TypeChrist becomes a reality. 
  • Pray that those of us on the TypeChrist team will keep our eyes on Jesus.
You can also help us a ton by spreading the word. Posting this campaign on Facebook or other social media sites would be a huge help. 

The internet can be a dangerous place for our kids to explore. It is time that Christians take ground in this area. Our kids need healthy and safe alternatives to the stuff the world has to offer. Please prayerfully consider joining us today for His Glory. God bless you!

story: More than 1.2 million Syrian refugees mostly women and children live in make shift camps in Lebanon, mostly in mountainous areas. They need diesel oil for their heaters to keep them warm. Many children suffer from cold weather disease and the international aid agency funding is limited to less than a dollar a day for those registered with UNHCR. NGOs like Lebanese For Refugees work with different Syrian communities to provide basic humanitarian aid. Your support saves lives.
